column3: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

column2: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).
column3: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

column2: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.
column3: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.

column2: And We have provided therein means of subsistence,- for you and for those for whose sustenance ye are not responsible.
column3: And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.

column2: And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures (inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due and ascertainable measures.
column3: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:

column2: And We send the fecundating winds, then cause the rain to descend from the sky, therewith providing you with water (in abundance), though ye are not the guardians of its stores.
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: And verily, it is We Who give life, and Who give death: it is We Who remain inheritors (after all else passes away).
column3: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:

column2: To Us are known those of you who hasten forward, and those who lag behind.
column3: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

column2: Assuredly it is thy Lord Who will gather them together: for He is perfect in Wisdom and Knowledge.
column3: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

column2: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;
column3: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

column2: And the Jinn race, We had created before, from the fire of a scorching wind.
column3: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

column2: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;
column3: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

column2: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
column3: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.

column2: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
column3: And when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves, and worshipped.

column2: Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
column3: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,

column2: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among those who prostrated themselves?"
column3: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

column2: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
column3: John answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

column2: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected, accursed.
column3: The LORD said moreover unto me; Son of man, wilt thou judge Aholah and Aholibah? yea, declare unto them their abominations;

column2: "And the curse shall be on thee till the day of Judgment."
column3: And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith the Lord GOD.

column2: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
column3: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

column2: (Allah) said: "Respite is granted thee
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: "Till the Day of the Time appointed."
column3: In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.

column2: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-
column3: Therefore, O Aholibah, thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will raise up thy lovers against thee, from whom thy mind is alienated, and I will bring them against thee on every side;

column2: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
column3: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

column2: (Allah) said: "This (way of My sincere servants) is indeed a way that leads straight to Me.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
column3: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.

column2: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!
column3: Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

column2: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
column3: By number and by weight of every one: and all the weight was written at that time.

column2: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).
column3: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

column2: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."
column3: Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

column2: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).
column3: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.

column2: There no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave.
column3: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame: there shall not be a coal to warm at, nor fire to sit before it.

column2: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;
column3: But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

column2: And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.
column3: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

column2: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.
column3: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.

column2: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
column3: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.

column2: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
column3: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.

column2: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"
column3: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

column2: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"
column3: Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

column2: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"
column3: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?

column2: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"
column3: Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?

column2: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,
column3: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

column2: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."
column3: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

column2: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,
column3: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

column2: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
column3: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

column2: They said: "Yea, we have come to thee to accomplish that of which they doubt.
column3: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

column2: "We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due, and assuredly we tell the truth.
column3: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

column2: "Then travel by night with thy household, when a portion of the night (yet remains), and do thou bring up the rear: let no one amongst you look back, but pass on whither ye are ordered."
column3: Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us? seeing I go whither I may, return thou, and take back thy brethren: mercy and truth be with thee.

column2: And We made known this decree to him, that the last remnants of those (sinners) should be cut off by the morning.
column3: And that whosoever would not come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of those that had been carried away.

column2: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).
column3: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.

column2: Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:
column3: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:

column2: "But fear Allah, and shame me not."
column3: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

column2: They said: "Did we not forbid thee (to speak) for all and sundry?"
column3: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man's blood upon us.

column2: He said: "There are my daughters (to marry), if ye must act (so)."
column3: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;

column2: Verily, by thy life (O Prophet), in their wild intoxication, they wander in distraction, to and fro.
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning,
column3: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

column2: And We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay.
column3: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

column2: Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.
column3: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

column2: And the (cities were) right on the high-road.
column3: These cities were every one with their suburbs round about them: thus were all these cities.

column2: Behold! in this is a sign for those who believed.
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;
column3: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.

column2: So We exacted retribution from them. They were both on an open highway, plain to see.
column3: And they straightway left their nets, and followed him.

column2: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the messengers:
column3: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.

column2: We sent them Our Signs, but they persisted in turning away from them.
column3: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

column2: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.
column3: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

column2: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,
column3: And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.

column2: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!
column3: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?

column2: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, but for just ends. And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be manifest). So overlook (any human faults) with gracious forgiveness.
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: For verily it is thy Lord who is the Master-Creator, knowing all things.
column3: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high,

column2: And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-repeated (verses) and the Grand Qur'an.
column3: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.

column2: Strain not thine eyes. (Wistfully) at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them, nor grieve over them: but lower thy wing (in gentleness) to the believers.
column3: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column2: And say: "I am indeed he that warneth openly and without ambiguity,"-
column3: As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

column2: (Of just such wrath) as We sent down on those who divided (Scripture into arbitrary parts),-
column3: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:

column2: (So also on such) as have made Qur'an into shreds (as they please).
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: Therefore, by the Lord, We will, of a surety, call them to account,
column3: Pass through the host, and command the people, saying, Prepare you victuals; for within three days ye shall pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land, which the LORD your God giveth you to possess it.

column2: For all their deeds.
column3: All these are the beginning of sorrows.

column2: Therefore expound openly what thou art commanded, and turn away from those who join false gods with Allah.
column3: But I have a few things against thee, because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed unto idols, and to commit fornication.

column2: For sufficient are We unto thee against those who scoff,-
column3: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

column2: Those who adopt, with Allah, another god: but soon will they come to know.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: We do indeed know how thy heart is distressed at what they say.
column3: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.

column2: But celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves in adoration.
column3: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

column2: And serve thy Lord until there come unto thee the Hour that is Certain.
column3: Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.

column2: (Inevitable) cometh (to pass) the Command of Allah: seek ye not then to hasten it: Glory to Him, and far is He above having the partners they ascribe unto Him!
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: He doth send down His angels with inspiration of His Command, to such of His servants as He pleaseth, (saying): "Warn (Man) that there is no god but I: so do your duty unto Me."
column3: But this thing commanded I them, saying, Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well unto you.

column2: He has created the heavens and the earth for just ends: Far is He above having the partners they ascribe to Him!
column3: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?

column2: He has created man from a sperm-drop; and behold this same (man) becomes an open disputer!
column3: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?

column2: And cattle He has created for you (men): from them ye derive warmth, and numerous benefits, and of their (meat) ye eat.
column3: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.

column2: And ye have a sense of pride and beauty in them as ye drive them home in the evening, and as ye lead them forth to pasture in the morning.
column3: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young.

column2: And they carry your heavy loads to lands that ye could not (otherwise) reach except with souls distressed: for your Lord is indeed Most Kind, Most Merciful,
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys, for you to ride and use for show; and He has created (other) things of which ye have no knowledge.
column3: And the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.

column2: And unto Allah leads straight the Way, but there are ways that turn aside: if Allah had willed, He could have guided all of you.
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: It is He who sends down rain from the sky: from it ye drink, and out of it (grows) the vegetation on which ye feed your cattle.
column3: For as the rain cometh down, and the snow from heaven, and returneth not thither, but watereth the earth, and maketh it bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower, and bread to the eater:

column2: With it He produces for you corn, olives, date-palms, grapes and every kind of fruit: verily in this is a sign for those who give thought.
column3: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column2: He has made subject to you the Night and the Day; the sun and the moon; and the stars are in subjection by His Command: verily in this are Signs for men who are wise.
column3: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

column2: And the things on this earth which He has multiplied in varying colours (and qualities): verily in this is a sign for men who celebrate the praises of Allah (in gratitude).
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.
column3: Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.

column2: And He has set up on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and rivers and roads; that ye may guide yourselves;
column3: And whereas the king saw a watcher and an holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, Hew the tree down, and destroy it; yet leave the stump of the roots thereof in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts of the field, till seven times pass over him;

column2: And marks and sign-posts; and by the stars (men) guide themselves.
column3: The words of the wise are as goads, and as nails fastened by the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.

column2: Is then He Who creates like one that creates not? Will ye not receive admonition?
column3: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

column2: If ye would count up the favours of Allah, never would ye be able to number them: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

column2: And Allah doth know what ye conceal, and what ye reveal.
column3: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.

column2: Those whom they invoke besides Allah create nothing and are themselves created.
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: (They are things) dead, lifeless: nor do they know when they will be raised up.
column3: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.

column2: Your Allah is one Allah: as to those who believe not in the Hereafter, their hearts refuse to know, and they are arrogant.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column2: Undoubtedly Allah doth know what they conceal, and what they reveal: verily He loveth not the arrogant.
column3: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

column2: When it is said to them, "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" they say, "Tales of the ancients!"
column3: The vision of Obadiah. Thus saith the Lord GOD concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the heathen, Arise ye, and let us rise up against her in battle.

column2: Let them bear, on the Day of Judgment, their own burdens in full, and also (something) of the burdens of those without knowledge, whom they misled. Alas, how grievous the burdens they will bear!
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: Those before them did also plot (against Allah's Way): but Allah took their structures from their foundations, and the roof fell down on them from above; and the Wrath seized them from directions they did not perceive.
column3: And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.

column2: Then, on the Day of Judgment, He will cover them with shame, and say: "Where are My 'partners' concerning whom ye used to dispute (with the godly)?" Those endued with knowledge will say: "This Day, indeed, are the Unbelievers covered with shame and misery,-
column3: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

column2: "(Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of wrong-doing to their own souls." Then would they offer submission (with the pretence), "We did no evil (knowingly)." (The angels will reply), "Nay, but verily Allah knoweth all that ye did;
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: "So enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein. Thus evil indeed is the abode of the arrogant."
column3: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

column2: To the righteous (when) it is said, "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" they say, "All that is good." To those who do good, there is good in this world, and the Home of the Hereafter is even better and excellent indeed is the Home of the righteous,-
column3: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:

column2: Gardens of Eternity which they will enter: beneath them flow (pleasant) rivers: they will have therein all that they wish: thus doth Allah reward the righteous,-
column3: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.

column2: (Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of purity, saying (to them), "Peace be on you; enter ye the Garden, because of (the good) which ye did (in the world)."
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Do the (ungodly) wait until the angels come to them, or there comes the Command of thy Lord (for their doom)? So did those who went before them. But Allah wronged them not: nay, they wronged their own souls.
column3: The priests said not, Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

column2: But the evil results of their deeds overtook them, and that very (Wrath) at which they had scoffed hemmed them in.
column3: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.

column2: The worshippers of false gods say: "If Allah had so willed, we should not have worshipped aught but Him - neither we nor our fathers,- nor should we have prescribed prohibitions other than His." So did those who went before them. But what is the mission of messengers but to preach the Clear Message?
column3: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the LORD, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.

column2: For We assuredly sent amongst every People a messenger, (with the Command), "Serve Allah, and eschew Evil": of the People were some whom Allah guided, and some on whom error became inevitably (established). So travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those who denied (the Truth).
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: If thou art anxious for their guidance, yet Allah guideth not such as He leaves to stray, and there is none to help them.
column3: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

column2: They swear their strongest oaths by Allah, that Allah will not raise up those who die: Nay, but it is a promise (binding) on Him in truth: but most among mankind realise it not.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: (They must be raised up), in order that He may manifest to them the truth of that wherein they differ, and that the rejecters of Truth may realise that they had indeed (surrendered to) Falsehood.
column3: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

column2: For to anything which We have willed, We but say the word, "Be", and it is.
column3: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

column2: To those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah, after suffering oppression,- We will assuredly give a goodly home in this world; but truly the reward of the Hereafter will be greater. If they only realised (this)!
column3: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

column2: (They are) those who persevere in patience, and put their trust on their Lord.
column3: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

column2: And before thee also the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: if ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
column3: To hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;

column2: (We sent them) with Clear Signs and Books of dark prophecies; and We have sent down unto thee (also) the Message; that thou mayest explain clearly to men what is sent for them, and that they may give thought.
column3: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

column2: Do then those who devise evil (plots) feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them up, or that the Wrath will not seize them from directions they little perceive?-
column3: And it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled on their lees: that say in their heart, The LORD will not do good, neither will he do evil.

column2: Or that He may not call them to account in the midst of their goings to and fro, without a chance of their frustrating Him?-
column3: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

column2: Or that He may not call them to account by a process of slow wastage - for thy Lord is indeed full of kindness and mercy.
column3: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

column2: Do they not look at Allah's creation, (even) among (inanimate) things,- How their (very) shadows turn round, from the right and the left, prostrating themselves to Allah, and that in the humblest manner?
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: And to Allah doth obeisance all that is in the heavens and on earth, whether moving (living) creatures or the angels: for none are arrogant (before their Lord).
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: They all revere their Lord, high above them, and they do all that they are commanded.
column3: Then he shall minister in the name of the LORD his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, which stand there before the LORD.

column2: Allah has said: "Take not (for worship) two gods: for He is just One Allah: then fear Me (and Me alone)."
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth, and to Him is duty due always: then will ye fear other than Allah?
column3: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof:

column2: And ye have no good thing but is from Allah: and moreover, when ye are touched by distress, unto Him ye cry with groans;
column3: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

column2: Yet, when He removes the distress from you, behold! some of you turn to other gods to join with their Lord-
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: (As if) to show their ingratitude for the favours we have bestowed on them! then enjoy (your brief day): but soon will ye know (your folly)!
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column2: And they (even) assign, to things they do not know, a portion out of that which We have bestowed for their sustenance! By Allah, ye shall certainly be called to account for your false inventions.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: And they assign daughters for Allah! - Glory be to Him! - and for themselves (sons,- the issue) they desire!
column3: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen.

column2: When news is brought to one of them, of (the birth of) a female (child), his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief!
column3: And his daughter in law, Phinehas' wife, was with child, near to be delivered: and when she heard the tidings that the ark of God was taken, and that her father in law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and travailed; for her pains came upon her.

column2: With shame does he hide himself from his people, because of the bad news he has had! Shall he retain it on (sufferance and) contempt, or bury it in the dust? Ah! what an evil (choice) they decide on?
column3: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column2: To those who believe not in the Hereafter, applies the similitude of evil: to Allah applies the highest similitude: for He is the Exalted in Power, full of Wisdom.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column2: If Allah were to punish men for their wrong-doing, He would not leave, on the (earth), a single living creature: but He gives them respite for a stated Term: When their Term expires, they would not be able to delay (the punishment) for a single hour, just as they would not be able to anticipate it (for a single hour).
column3: All the king's servants, and the people of the king's provinces, do know, that whosoever, whether man or women, shall come unto the king into the inner court, who is not called, there is one law of his to put him to death, except such to whom the king shall hold out the golden sceptre, that he may live: but I have not been called to come in unto the king these thirty days.

column2: They attribute to Allah what they hate (for themselves), and their tongues assert the falsehood that all good things are for themselves: without doubt for them is the Fire, and they will be the first to be hastened on into it!
column3: Therefore prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because they have made you desolate, and swallowed you up on every side, that ye might be a possession unto the residue of the heathen, and ye are taken up in the lips of talkers, and are an infamy of the people:

column2: By Allah, We (also) sent (Our messengers) to Peoples before thee; but Satan made, (to the wicked), their own acts seem alluring: He is also their patron today, but they shall have a most grievous penalty.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: And We sent down the Book to thee for the express purpose, that thou shouldst make clear to them those things in which they differ, and that it should be a guide and a mercy to those who believe.
column3: But as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto thee all the commandments, and the statutes, and the judgments, which thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.

column2: And Allah sends down rain from the skies, and gives therewith life to the earth after its death: verily in this is a Sign for those who listen.
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: And verily in cattle (too) will ye find an instructive sign. From what is within their bodies between excretions and blood, We produce, for your drink, milk, pure and agreeable to those who drink it.
column3: And for an unclean person they shall take of the ashes of the burnt heifer of purification for sin, and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel:

column2: And from the fruit of the date-palm and the vine, ye get out wholesome drink and food: behold, in this also is a sign for those who are wise.
column3: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

column2: And thy Lord taught the Bee to build its cells in hills, on trees, and in (men's) habitations;
column3: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

column2: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.
column3: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

column2: It is Allah who creates you and takes your souls at death; and of you there are some who are sent back to a feeble age, so that they know nothing after having known (much): for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.
column3: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun, that there is one event unto all: yea, also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to the dead.

column2: Allah has bestowed His gifts of sustenance more freely on some of you than on others: those more favoured are not going to throw back their gifts to those whom their right hands possess, so as to be equal in that respect. Will they then deny the favours of Allah?
column3: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

column2: And Allah has made for you mates (and companions) of your own nature, and made for you, out of them, sons and daughters and grandchildren, and provided for you sustenance of the best: will they then believe in vain things, and be ungrateful for Allah's favours?-
column3: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

column2: And worship others than Allah,- such as have no power of providing them, for sustenance, with anything in heavens or earth, and cannot possibly have such power?
column3: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

column2: Invent not similitudes for Allah: for Allah knoweth, and ye know not.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Allah sets forth the Parable (of two men: one) a slave under the dominion of another; He has no power of any sort; and (the other) a man on whom We have bestowed goodly favours from Ourselves, and he spends thereof (freely), privately and publicly: are the two equal? (By no means;) praise be to Allah. But most of them understand not.
column3: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

column2: Allah sets forth (another) Parable of two men: one of them dumb, with no power of any sort; a wearisome burden is he to his master; whichever way be directs him, he brings no good: is such a man equal with one who commands Justice, and is on a Straight Way?
column3: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

column2: To Allah belongeth the Mystery of the heavens and the earth. And the Decision of the Hour (of Judgment) is as the twingkling of an eye, or even quicker: for Allah hath power over all things.
column3: For who hath despised the day of small things? for they shall rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those seven; they are the eyes of the LORD, which run to and fro through the whole earth.

column2: It is He Who brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers when ye knew nothing; and He gave you hearing and sight and intelligence and affections: that ye may give thanks (to Allah).
column3: And that ye may prolong your days in the land, which the LORD sware unto your fathers to give unto them and to their seed, a land that floweth with milk and honey.

column2: Do they not look at the birds, held poised in the midst of (the air and) the sky? Nothing holds them up but (the power of) Allah. Verily in this are signs for those who believe.
column3: For who hath despised the day of small things? for they shall rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those seven; they are the eyes of the LORD, which run to and fro through the whole earth.

column2: It is Allah Who made your habitations homes of rest and quiet for you; and made for you, out of the skins of animals, (tents for) dwellings, which ye find so light (and handy) when ye travel and when ye stop (in your travels); and out of their wool, and their soft fibres (between wool and hair), and their hair, rich stuff and articles of convenience (to serve you) for a time.
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: It is Allah Who made out of the things He created, some things to give you shade; of the hills He made some for your shelter; He made you garments to protect you from heat, and coats of mail to protect you from your (mutual) violence. Thus does He complete His favours on you, that ye may bow to His Will (in Islam).
column3: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

column2: But if they turn away, thy duty is only to preach the clear Message.
column3: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

column2: They recognise the favours of Allah; then they deny them; and most of them are (creatures) ungrateful.
column3: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

column2: One Day We shall raise from all Peoples a Witness: then will no excuse be accepted from Unbelievers, nor will they receive any favours.
column3: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.

column2: When the wrong-doers (actually) see the Penalty, then will it in no way be mitigated, nor will they then receive respite.
column3: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

column2: When those who gave partners to Allah will see their "partners", they will say: "Our Lord! these are our 'partners,' those whom we used to invoke besides Thee." But they will throw back their word at them (and say): "Indeed ye are liars!"
column3: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

column2: That Day shall they (openly) show (their) submission to Allah; and all their inventions shall leave them in the lurch.
column3: For God hath put in their hearts to fulfil his will, and to agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the words of God shall be fulfilled.

column2: Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah - for them will We add Penalty to Penalty; for that they used to spread mischief.
column3: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

column2: One day We shall raise from all Peoples a witness against them, from amongst themselves: and We shall bring thee as a witness against these (thy people): and We have sent down to thee the Book explaining all things, a Guide, a Mercy, and Glad Tidings to Muslims.
column3: Thus saith the LORD, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;

column2: Allah commands justice, the doing of good, and liberality to kith and kin, and He forbids all shameful deeds, and injustice and rebellion: He instructs you, that ye may receive admonition.
column3: The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me; because the LORD hath anointed me to preach good tidings unto the meek; he hath sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to them that are bound;

column2: Fulfil the Covenant of Allah when ye have entered into it, and break not your oaths after ye have confirmed them; indeed ye have made Allah your surety; for Allah knoweth all that ye do.
column3: When thou vowest a vow unto God, defer not to pay it; for he hath no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed.

column2: And be not like a woman who breaks into untwisted strands the yarn which she has spun, after it has become strong. Nor take your oaths to practise deception between yourselves, lest one party should be more numerous than another: for Allah will test you by this; and on the Day of Judgment He will certainly make clear to you (the truth of) that wherein ye disagree.
column3: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.

column2: If Allah so willed, He could make you all one people: But He leaves straying whom He pleases, and He guides whom He pleases: but ye shall certainly be called to account for all your actions.
column3: The anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.

column2: And take not your oaths, to practise deception between yourselves, with the result that someone's foot may slip after it was firmly planted, and ye may have to taste the evil (consequences) of having hindered (men) from the Path of Allah, and a Mighty Wrath descend on you.
column3: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;

column2: Nor sell the covenant of Allah for a miserable price: for with Allah is (a prize) far better for you, if ye only knew.
column3: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

column2: What is with you must vanish: what is with Allah will endure. And We will certainly bestow, on those who patiently persevere, their reward according to the best of their actions.
column3: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

column2: Whoever works righteousness, man or woman, and has Faith, verily, to him will We give a new Life, a life that is good and pure and We will bestow on such their reward according to the best of their actions.
column3: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness, and the work of faith with power:

column2: When thou dost read the Qur'an, seek Allah's protection from Satan the rejected one.
column3: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

column2: No authority has he over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.
column3: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

column2: His authority is over those only, who take him as patron and who join partners with Allah.
column3: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

column2: When We substitute one revelation for another,- and Allah knows best what He reveals (in stages),- they say, "Thou art but a forger": but most of them understand not.
column3: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.

column2: Say, the Holy Spirit has brought the revelation from thy Lord in Truth, in order to strengthen those who believe, and as a Guide and Glad Tidings to Muslims.
column3: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

column2: We know indeed that they say, "It is a man that teaches him." The tongue of him they wickedly point to is notably foreign, while this is Arabic, pure and clear.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column2: Those who believe not in the Signs of Allah,- Allah will not guide them, and theirs will be a grievous Penalty.
column3: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

column2: It is those who believe not in the Signs of Allah, that forge falsehood: it is they who lie!
column3: I know thy works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and I know the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews, and are not, but are the synagogue of Satan.

column2: Any one who, after accepting faith in Allah, utters Unbelief,- except under compulsion, his heart remaining firm in Faith - but such as open their breast to Unbelief, on them is Wrath from Allah, and theirs will be a dreadful Penalty.
column3: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

column2: This because they love the life of this world better than the Hereafter: and Allah will not guide those who reject Faith.
column3: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

column2: Those are they whose hearts, ears, and eyes Allah has sealed up, and they take no heed.
column3: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

column2: Without doubt, in the Hereafter they will perish.
column3: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

column2: But verily thy Lord,- to those who leave their homes after trials and persecutions,- and who thereafter strive and fight for the faith and patiently persevere,- Thy Lord, after all this is oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: O LORD, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant, and to the prayer of thy servants, who desire to fear thy name: and prosper, I pray thee, thy servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king's cupbearer.

column2: One Day every soul will come up struggling for itself, and every soul will be recompensed (fully) for all its actions, and none will be unjustly dealt with.
column3: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.

column2: Allah sets forth a Parable: a city enjoying security and quiet, abundantly supplied with sustenance from every place: Yet was it ungrateful for the favours of Allah: so Allah made it taste of hunger and terror (in extremes) (closing in on it) like a garment (from every side), because of the (evil) which (its people) wrought.
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: And there came to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they falsely rejected him; so the Wrath seized them even in the midst of their iniquities.
column3: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

column2: So eat of the sustenance which Allah has provided for you, lawful and good; and be grateful for the favours of Allah, if it is He Whom ye serve.
column3: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

column2: He has only forbidden you dead meat, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and any (food) over which the name of other than Allah has been invoked. But if one is forced by necessity, without wilful disobedience, nor transgressing due limits,- then Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

column2: But say not - for any false thing that your tongues may put forth,- "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so as to ascribe false things to Allah. For those who ascribe false things to Allah, will never prosper.
column3: But the prophet, which shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, even that prophet shall die.

column2: (In such falsehood) is but a paltry profit; but they will have a most grievous Penalty.
column3: Which devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

column2: To the Jews We prohibited such things as We have mentioned to thee before: We did them no wrong, but they were used to doing wrong to themselves.
column3: And ye shall not walk in the manners of the nation, which I cast out before you: for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.

column2: But verily thy Lord,- to those who do wrong in ignorance, but who thereafter repent and make amends,- thy Lord, after all this, is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

column2: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:
column3: That I gave my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the ruler of the palace, charge over Jerusalem: for he was a faithful man, and feared God above many.

column2: He showed his gratitude for the favours of Allah, who chose him, and guided him to a Straight Way.
column3: Thus did Urijah the priest, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.

column2: And We gave him Good in this world, and he will be, in the Hereafter, in the ranks of the Righteous.
column3: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

column2: So We have taught thee the inspired (Message), "Follow the ways of Abraham the True in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah."
column3: Men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

column2: The Sabbath was only made (strict) for those who disagreed (as to its observance); But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment, as to their differences.
column3: In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the LORD: it shall be a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.

column2: Invite (all) to the Way of thy Lord with wisdom and beautiful preaching; and argue with them in ways that are best and most gracious: for thy Lord knoweth best, who have strayed from His Path, and who receive guidance.
column3: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

column2: And if ye do catch them out, catch them out no worse than they catch you out: But if ye show patience, that is indeed the best (course) for those who are patient.
column3: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.

column2: And do thou be patient, for thy patience is but from Allah; nor grieve over them: and distress not thyself because of their plots.
column3: Take thou no usury of him, or increase: but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.

column2: For Allah is with those who restrain themselves, and those who do good.
column3: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

column2: Glory to (Allah) Who did take His servant for a Journey by night from the Sacred Mosque to the farthest Mosque, whose precincts We did bless,- in order that We might show him some of Our Signs: for He is the One Who heareth and seeth (all things).
column3: To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.

column2: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a Guide to the Children of Israel, (commanding): "Take not other than Me as Disposer of (your) affairs."
column3: And Moses wrote this law, and delivered it unto the priests the sons of Levi, which bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and unto all the elders of Israel.

column2: O ye that are sprung from those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah! Verily he was a devotee most grateful.
column3: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.

column2: And We gave (Clear) Warning to the Children of Israel in the Book, that twice would they do mischief on the earth and be elated with mighty arrogance (and twice would they be punished)!
column3: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

column2: When the first of the warnings came to pass, We sent against you Our servants given to terrible warfare: They entered the very inmost parts of your homes; and it was a warning (completely) fulfilled.
column3: And I sent the hornet before you, which drave them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; but not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.

column2: Then did We grant you the Return as against them: We gave you increase in resources and sons, and made you the more numerous in man-power.
column3: Thus shall he do in the most strong holds with a strange god, whom he shall acknowledge and increase with glory: and he shall cause them to rule over many, and shall divide the land for gain.

column2: If ye did well, ye did well for yourselves; if ye did evil, (ye did it) against yourselves. So when the second of the warnings came to pass, (We permitted your enemies) to disfigure your faces, and to enter your Temple as they had entered it before, and to visit with destruction all that fell into their power.
column3: When ye have transgressed the covenant of the LORD your God, which he commanded you, and have gone and served other gods, and bowed yourselves to them; then shall the anger of the LORD be kindled against you, and ye shall perish quickly from off the good land which he hath given unto you.

column2: It may be that your Lord may (yet) show Mercy unto you; but if ye revert (to your sins), We shall revert (to Our punishments): And we have made Hell a prison for those who reject (all Faith).
column3: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

column2: Verily this Qur'an doth guide to that which is most right (or stable), and giveth the Glad Tidings to the Believers who work deeds of righteousness, that they shall have a magnificent reward;
column3: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

column2: And to those who believe not in the Hereafter, (it announceth) that We have prepared for them a Penalty Grievous (indeed).
column3: Howbeit, because by this deed thou hast given great occasion to the enemies of the LORD to blaspheme, the child also that is born unto thee shall surely die.

column2: The prayer that man should make for good, he maketh for evil; for man is given to hasty (deeds).
column3: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

column2: We have made the Night and the Day as two (of Our) Signs: the Sign of the Night have We obscured, while the Sign of the Day We have made to enlighten you; that ye may seek bounty from your Lord, and that ye may know the number and count of the years: all things have We explained in detail.
column3: Until the LORD have given your brethren rest, as he hath given you, and they also have possessed the land which the LORD your God giveth them: then ye shall return unto the land of your possession, and enjoy it, which Moses the LORD's servant gave you on this side Jordan toward the sunrising.

column2: Every man's fate We have fastened on his own neck: On the Day of Judgment We shall bring out for him a scroll, which he will see spread open.
column3: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

column2: (It will be said to him:) "Read thine (own) record: Sufficient is thy soul this day to make out an account against thee."
column3: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

column2: Who receiveth guidance, receiveth it for his own benefit: who goeth astray doth so to his own loss: No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another: nor would We visit with Our Wrath until We had sent an messenger (to give warning).
column3: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.

column2: When We decide to destroy a population, We (first) send a definite order to those among them who are given the good things of this life and yet transgress; so that the word is proved true against them: then (it is) We destroy them utterly.
column3: Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.

column2: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? and enough is thy Lord to note and see the sins of His servants.
column3: Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?

column2: If any do wish for the transitory things (of this life), We readily grant them - such things as We will, to such person as We will: in the end have We provided Hell for them: they will burn therein, disgraced and rejected.
column3: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

column2: Those who do wish for the (things of) the Hereafter, and strive therefor with all due striving, and have Faith,- they are the ones whose striving is acceptable (to Allah).
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: Of the bounties of thy Lord We bestow freely on all- These as well as those: The bounties of thy Lord are not closed (to anyone).
column3: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

column2: See how We have bestowed more on some than on others; but verily the Hereafter is more in rank and gradation and more in excellence.
column3: For our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that part which lacked.

column2: Take not with Allah another object of worship; or thou (O man!) wilt sit in disgrace and destitution.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Thy Lord hath decreed that ye worship none but Him, and that ye be kind to parents. Whether one or both of them attain old age in thy life, say not to them a word of contempt, nor repel them, but address them in terms of honour.
column3: Whosoever he be that doth rebel against thy commandment, and will not hearken unto thy words in all that thou commandest him, he shall be put to death: only be strong and of a good courage.

column2: And, out of kindness, lower to them the wing of humility, and say: "My Lord! bestow on them thy Mercy even as they cherished me in childhood."
column3: I beseech thee, O LORD, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.

column2: Your Lord knoweth best what is in your hearts: If ye do deeds of righteousness, verily He is Most Forgiving to those who turn to Him again and again (in true penitence).
column3: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

column2: And render to the kindred their due rights, as (also) to those in want, and to the wayfarer: But squander not (your wealth) in the manner of a spendthrift.
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: Verily spendthrifts are brothers of the Evil Ones; and the Evil One is to his Lord (himself) ungrateful.
column3: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

column2: And even if thou hast to turn away from them in pursuit of the Mercy from thy Lord which thou dost expect, yet speak to them a word of easy kindness.
column3: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not suffer sin upon him.

column2: Make not thy hand tied (like a niggard's) to thy neck, nor stretch it forth to its utmost reach, so that thou become blameworthy and destitute.
column3: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.

column2: Verily thy Lord doth provide sustenance in abundance for whom He pleaseth, and He provideth in a just measure. For He doth know and regard all His servants.
column3: The LORD shall command the blessing upon thee in thy storehouses, and in all that thou settest thine hand unto; and he shall bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.

column2: Kill not your children for fear of want: We shall provide sustenance for them as well as for you. Verily the killing of them is a great sin.
column3: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

column2: Nor come nigh to adultery: for it is a shameful (deed) and an evil, opening the road (to other evils).
column3: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

column2: Nor take life - which Allah has made sacred - except for just cause. And if anyone is slain wrongfully, we have given his heir authority (to demand qisas or to forgive): but let him not exceed bounds in the matter of taking life; for he is helped (by the Law).
column3: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

column2: Come not nigh to the orphan's property except to improve it, until he attains the age of full strength; and fulfil (every) engagement, for (every) engagement will be enquired into (on the Day of Reckoning).
column3: And if he that sanctified the field will in any wise redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shall be assured to him.

column2: Give full measure when ye measure, and weigh with a balance that is straight: that is the most fitting and the most advantageous in the final determination.
column3: Unto you therefore which believe he is precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

column2: And pursue not that of which thou hast no knowledge; for every act of hearing, or of seeing or of (feeling in) the heart will be enquired into (on the Day of Reckoning).
column3: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man's work, pass the time of your sojourning here in fear:

column2: Nor walk on the earth with insolence: for thou canst not rend the earth asunder, nor reach the mountains in height.
column3: The fruit of thy land, and all thy labors, shall a nation which thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed alway:

column2: Of all such things the evil is hateful in the sight of thy Lord.
column3: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

column2: These are among the (precepts of) wisdom, which thy Lord has revealed to thee. Take not, with Allah, another object of worship, lest thou shouldst be thrown into Hell, blameworthy and rejected.
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Has then your Lord (O Pagans!) preferred for you sons, and taken for Himself daughters among the angels? Truly ye utter a most dreadful saying!
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: We have explained (things) in various (ways) in this Qur'an, in order that they may receive admonition, but it only increases their flight (from the Truth)!
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: Say: If there had been (other) gods with Him, as they say,- behold, they would certainly have sought out a way to the Lord of the Throne!
column3: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

column2: Glory to Him! He is high above all that they say!- Exalted and Great (beyond measure)!
column3: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

column2: The seven heavens and the earth, and all beings therein, declare His glory: there is not a thing but celebrates His praise; And yet ye understand not how they declare His glory! Verily He is Oft-Forbear, Most Forgiving!
column3: Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth.

column2: When thou dost recite the Qur'an, We put, between thee and those who believe not in the Hereafter, a veil invisible:
column3: And thou shalt command the priests that bear the ark of the covenant, saying, When ye are come to the brink of the water of Jordan, ye shall stand still in Jordan.

column2: And We put coverings over their hearts (and minds) lest they should understand the Qur'an, and deafness into their ears: when thou dost commemorate thy Lord and Him alone in the Qur'an, they turn on their backs, fleeing (from the Truth).
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: We know best why it is they listen, when they listen to thee; and when they meet in private conference, behold, the wicked say, "Ye follow none other than a man bewitched!"
column3: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?

column2: See what similes they strike for thee: but they have gone astray, and never can they find a way.
column3: They return, but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.

column2: They say: "What! when we are reduced to bones and dust, should we really be raised up (to be) a new creation?"
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: Say: "(Nay!) be ye stones or iron,
