column2: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: "And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"
column3: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)

column2: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.
column3: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

column2: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!
column3: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

column2: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
column3: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

column2: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
column3: Howbeit, because by this deed thou hast given great occasion to the enemies of the LORD to blaspheme, the child also that is born unto thee shall surely die.

column2: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).
column3: And shall go out to deceive the nations which are in the four quarters of the earth, Gog, and Magog, to gather them together to battle: the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.

column2: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
column3: Shall horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:

column2: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

column2: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
column3: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

column2: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
column3: The earth shall quake before them; the heavens shall tremble: the sun and the moon shall be dark, and the stars shall withdraw their shining:

column2: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
column3: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

column2: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.
column3: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel: and this is it that their father spake unto them, and blessed them; every one according to his blessing he blessed them.

column2: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.
column3: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

column2: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
column3: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.

column2: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?
column3: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

column2: Ta-Ha.
column3: Remember Lot's wife.

column2: We have not sent down the Qur'an to thee to be (an occasion) for thy distress,
column3: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

column2: But only as an admonition to those who fear (Allah),-
column3: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

column2: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.
column3: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

column2: (Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of authority).
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, and all between them, and all beneath the soil.
column3: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

column2: If thou pronounce the word aloud, (it is no matter): for verily He knoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden.
column3: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

column2: Allah! there is no god but He! To Him belong the most Beautiful Names.
column3: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

column2: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
column3: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah concerning the dearth.

column2: Behold, he saw a fire: So he said to his family, "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire."
column3: Come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant.

column2: But when he came to the fire, a voice was heard: "O Moses!
column3: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold it, the voice of the LORD came unto him,

column2: "Verily I am thy Lord! therefore (in My presence) put off thy shoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa.
column3: I will wash mine hands in innocency: so will I compass thine altar, O LORD:

column2: "I have chosen thee: listen, then, to the inspiration (sent to thee).
column3: As it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

column2: "Verily, I am Allah: There is no god but I: So serve thou Me (only), and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: "Verily the Hour is coming - My design is to keep it hidden - for every soul to receive its reward by the measure of its Endeavour.
column3: And, behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be.

column2: "Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their own lusts, divert thee therefrom, lest thou perish!"..
column3: Thou hast indeed smitten Edom, and thine heart hath lifted thee up: glory of this, and tarry at home: for why shouldest thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee?

column2: "And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"
column3: Master, which is the great commandment in the law?

column2: He said, "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder for my flocks; and in it I find other uses."
column3: But he shall say, I am no prophet, I am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.

column2: (Allah) said, "Throw it, O Moses!"
column3: Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;

column2: He threw it, and behold! It was a snake, active in motion.
column3: And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.

column2: (Allah) said, "Seize it, and fear not: We shall return it at once to its former condition"..
column3: And when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.

column2: "Now draw thy hand close to thy side: It shall come forth white (and shining), without harm (or stain),- as another Sign,-
column3: Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;

column2: "In order that We may show thee (two) of our Greater Signs.
column3: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

column2: "Go thou to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds."
column3: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.

column2: (Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;
column3: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost, The LORD said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

column2: "Ease my task for me;
column3: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.

column2: "And remove the impediment from my speech,
column3: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

column2: "So they may understand what I say:
column3: And charged them that they should not make him known:

column2: "And give me a Minister from my family,
column3: And one kid of the goats, to make an atonement for you.

column2: "Aaron, my brother;
column3: Remember Lot's wife.

column2: "Add to my strength through him,
column3: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

column2: "And make him share my task:
column3: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

column2: "That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint,
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: "And remember Thee without stint:
column3: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

column2: "For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us."
column3: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

column2: (Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer, O Moses!"
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: "And indeed We conferred a favour on thee another time (before).
column3: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.

column2: "Behold! We sent to thy mother, by inspiration, the message:
column3: They sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus; Unto Darius the king, all peace.

column2: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.
column3: And, behold, the whole family is risen against thine handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him, for the life of his brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left, and shall not leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the earth.

column2: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, 'shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man, but We saved thee from trouble, and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained, O Moses!
column3: When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel's sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?

column2: "And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)"..
column3: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

column2: "Go, thou and thy brother, with My Signs, and slacken not, either of you, in keeping Me in remembrance.
column3: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

column2: "Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds;
column3: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

column2: "But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear (Allah)."
column3: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

column2: They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! We fear lest he hasten with insolence against us, or lest he transgress all bounds."
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see (everything).
column3: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

column2: "So go ye both to him, and say, 'Verily we are messengers sent by thy Lord: Send forth, therefore, the Children of Israel with us, and afflict them not: with a Sign, indeed, have we come from thy Lord! and peace to all who follow guidance!
column3: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.

column2: "'Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits) those who reject and turn away.'"
column3: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

column2: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"
column3: Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.

column2: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its form and nature, and further, gave (it) guidance."
column3: Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"
column3: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?

column2: He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord, duly recorded: my Lord never errs, nor forgets,-
column3: And Haman answered the king, For the man whom the king delighteth to honour,

column2: "He Who has, made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has sent down water from the sky." With it have We produced diverse pairs of plants each separate from the others.
column3: When ye go, ye shall come unto a people secure, and to a large land: for God hath given it into your hands; a place where there is no want of any thing that is in the earth.

column2: Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
column3: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

column2: From the (earth) did We create you, and into it shall We return you, and from it shall We bring you out once again.
column3: Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit shall return unto God who gave it.

column2: And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs, but he did reject and refuse.
column3: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

column2: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy magic, O Moses?
column3: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

column2: "But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor thou - in a place where both shall have even chances."
column3: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

column2: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up."
column3: And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, to morrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even.

column2: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).
column3: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

column2: Moses said to him: Woe to you! Forge not ye a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger must suffer frustration!"
column3: And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against the LORD's anointed, and be guiltless?

column2: So they disputed, one with another, over their affair, but they kept their talk secret.
column3: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

column2: They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their object is to drive you out from your land with their magic, and to do away with your most cherished institutions.
column3: And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,

column2: "Therefore concert your plan, and then assemble in (serried) ranks: He wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or that we be the first to throw?"
column3: Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?

column2: He said, "Nay, throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their rods-so it seemed to him on account of their magic - began to be in lively motion!
column3: And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.

column2: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
column3: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,

column2: We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:
column3: But if I say thus unto the young man, Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way: for the LORD hath sent thee away.

column2: "Throw that which is in thy right hand: Quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked what they have faked is but a magician's trick: and the magician thrives not, (no matter) where he goes."
column3: Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter's clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?

column2: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".
column3: And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell before the LORD, worshipping the LORD.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"
column3: And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye anoint me king over you, then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.

column2: They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear Signs that have come to us, or than Him Who created us! so decree whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree (touching) the life of this world.
column3: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for any man: for thou regardest not the person of men.

column2: "For us, we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults, and the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best and Most Abiding."
column3: O LORD, though our iniquities testify against us, do thou it for thy name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.

column2: Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at Judgment),- for him is Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live.
column3: Blessed and holy is he that hath part in the first resurrection: on such the second death hath no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.

column2: But such as come to Him as Believers who have worked righteous deeds,- for them are ranks exalted,-
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell therein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify themselves (from evil).
column3: Blessed are they that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and may enter in through the gates into the city.

column2: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear."
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

column2: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces, but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
column3: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.

column2: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
column3: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

column2: O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a Covenant with you on the right side of Mount (Sinai), and We sent down to you Manna and quails:
column3: And I, behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are given as a gift for the LORD, to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

column2: (Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your sustenance, but commit no excess therein, lest My Wrath should justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do perish indeed!
column3: I also will do this unto you; I will even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burning ague, that shall consume the eyes, and cause sorrow of heart: and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.

column2: "But, without doubt, I am (also) He that forgives again and again, to those who repent, believe, and do right, who,- in fine, are ready to receive true guidance."
column3: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

column2: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"
column3: Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness?

column2: He replied: "Behold, they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to thee, O my Lord, to please thee."
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: (Allah) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the Samiri has led them astray."
column3: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

column2: So Moses returned to his people in a state of indignation and sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your Lord on you, and so ye broke your promise to me?"
column3: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, Did not ye hate me, and expel me out of my father's house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?

column2: They said: "We broke not the promise to thee, as far as lay in our power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the (whole) people, and we threw them (into the fire), and that was what the Samiri suggested.
column3: They have built also the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings unto Baal, which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:

column2: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"
column3: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

column2: Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for answer), and that it had no power either to harm them or to do them good?
column3: They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.

column2: Aaron had already, before this said to them: "O my people! ye are being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (Allah) Most Gracious; so follow me and obey my command."
column3: Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.

column2: They had said: "We will not abandon this cult, but we will devote ourselves to it until Moses returns to us."
column3: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.

column2: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,
column3: And David said to Saul, Wherefore hearest thou men's words, saying, Behold, David seeketh thy hurt?

column2: "From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"
column3: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

column2: (Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say, 'Thou has caused a division among the children of Israel, and thou didst not respect my word!'"
column3: And Samuel said unto Saul, I will not return with thee: for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.

column2: (Moses) said: "What then is thy case, O Samiri?"
column3: And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against the LORD's anointed, and be guiltless?

column2: He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of dust) from the footprint of the Messenger, and threw it (into the calf): thus did my soul suggest to me."
column3: For her blood is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of a rock; she poured it not upon the ground, to cover it with dust;

column2: (Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life will be that thou wilt say, 'touch me not'; and moreover (for a future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: Now look at thy god, of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: We will certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in the sea!"
column3: Then said Abishai to David, God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear even to the earth at once, and I will not smite him the second time.

column2: But the god of you all is the One Allah: there is no god but He: all things He comprehends in His knowledge.
column3: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

column2: Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before: for We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.
column3: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

column2: If any do turn away therefrom, verily they will bear a burden on the Day of judgment;
column3: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

column2: They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be to them on that Day,-
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day, We shall gather the sinful, blear-eyed (with terror).
column3: Behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do this day, to make your voice to be heard on high.

column2: In whispers will they consult each other: "Yet tarried not longer than ten (Days);
column3: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:

column2: We know best what they will say, when their leader most eminent in conduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"
column3: And they said, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.

column2: They ask thee concerning the Mountains: say, "My Lord will uproot them and scatter them as dust;
column3: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

column2: "He will leave them as plains smooth and level;
column3: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.

column2: "Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place."
column3: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

column2: On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble themselves in the Presence of (Allah) Most Gracious: nothing shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march).
column3: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.

column2: On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom permission has been granted by (Allah) Most Gracious and whose word is acceptable to Him.
column3: Whereof I am made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given to me for you, to fulfil the word of God;

column2: He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or behind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: (All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) - the Living, the Self-Subsisting, Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that carries iniquity (on his back).
column3: If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.

column2: But he who works deeds of righteousness, and has faith, will have no fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).
column3: When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;

column2: Thus have We sent this down - an arabic Qur'an - and explained therein in detail some of the warnings, in order that they may fear Allah, or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him).
column3: Men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

column2: High above all is Allah, the King, the Truth! Be not in haste with the Qur'an before its revelation to thee is completed, but say, "O my Lord! advance me in knowledge."
column3: Son of man, take up a lamentation upon the king of Tyrus, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.

column2: We had already, beforehand, taken the covenant of Adam, but he forgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve.
column3: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

column2: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam", they prostrated themselves, but not Iblis: he refused.
column3: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.

column2: Then We said: "O Adam! verily, this is an enemy to thee and thy wife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden, so that thou art landed in misery.
column3: Then said I, Ah, Lord GOD! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.

column2: "There is therein (enough provision) for thee not to go hungry nor to go naked,
column3: And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the LORD: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the LORD, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

column2: "Nor to suffer from thirst, nor from the sun's heat."
column3: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

column2: But Satan whispered evil to him: he said, "O Adam! shall I lead thee to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"
column3: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?

column2: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.
column3: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

column2: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.
column3: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

column2: He said: "Get ye down, both of you,- all together, from the Garden, with enmity one to another: but if, as is sure, there comes to you Guidance from Me, whosoever follows My Guidance, will not lose his way, nor fall into misery.
column3: And, behold, I will send a lad, saying, Go, find out the arrows. If I expressly say unto the lad, Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee, take them; then come thou: for there is peace to thee, and no hurt; as the LORD liveth.

column2: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: He will say: "O my Lord! why hast Thou raised me up blind, while I had sight (before)?"
column3: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

column2: (Allah) will say: "Thus didst Thou, when Our Signs came unto thee, disregard them: so wilt thou, this day, be disregarded."
column3: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,

column2: And thus do We recompense him who transgresses beyond bounds and believes not in the Signs of his Lord: and the Penalty of the Hereafter is far more grievous and more enduring.
column3: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column2: Is it not a warning to such men (to call to mind) how many generations before them We destroyed, in whose haunts they (now) move? Verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
column3: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eyes in comparison of it as nothing?

column2: Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a Term appointed (for respite).
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Therefore be patient with what they say, and celebrate (constantly) the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun, and before its setting; yea, celebrate them for part of the hours of the night, and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have (spiritual) joy.
column3: When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;

column2: Nor strain thine eyes in longing for the things We have given for enjoyment to parties of them, the splendour of the life of this world, through which We test them: but the provision of thy Lord is better and more enduring.
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Enjoin prayer on thy people, and be constant therein. We ask thee not to provide sustenance: We provide it for thee. But the (fruit of) the Hereafter is for righteousness.
column3: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

column2: They say: "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has not a Clear Sign come to them of all that was in the former Books of revelation?
column3: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?

column2: And if We had inflicted on them a penalty before this, they would have said: "Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent us a messenger, we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame."
column3: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.

column2: Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye, therefore, and soon shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way, and who it is that has received Guidance."
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
column3: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

column2: Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord, but they listen to it as in jest,-
column3: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

column2: Their hearts toying as with trifles. The wrong-doers conceal their private counsels, (saying), "Is this (one) more than a man like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?"
column3: Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

column2: Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."
column3: Sing unto the LORD; for he hath done excellent things: this is known in all the earth.

column2: "Nay," they say, "(these are) medleys of dream! - Nay, He forged it! - Nay, He is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!"
column3: Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert; go not forth: behold, he is in the secret chambers; believe it not.

column2: (As to those) before them, not one of the populations which We destroyed believed: will these believe?
column3: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

column2: Before thee, also, the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
column3: To hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;

column2: Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they exempt from death.
column3: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

column2: In the end We fulfilled to them Our Promise, and We saved them and those whom We pleased, but We destroyed those who transgressed beyond bounds.
column3: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.

column2: We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message for you: will ye not then understand?
column3: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

column2: How many were the populations We utterly destroyed because of their iniquities, setting up in their places other peoples?
column3: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time, who should walk after their own ungodly lusts.

column2: Yet, when they felt Our Punishment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: Flee not, but return to the good things of this life which were given you, and to your homes in order that ye may be called to account.
column3: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.

column2: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
column3: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!

column2: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
column3: The bellows are burned, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.

column2: Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and all that is between!
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime, We should surely have taken it from the things nearest to Us, if We would do (such a thing)!
column3: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

column2: Nay, We hurl the Truth against falsehood, and it knocks out its brain, and behold, falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the (false) things ye ascribe (to Us).
column3: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column2: To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: Even those who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they (ever) weary (of His service):
column3: And all the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing: and he doeth according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand, or say unto him, What doest thou?

column2: They celebrate His praises night and day, nor do they ever flag or intermit.
column3: Neither shall any priest drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.

column2: Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can raise (the dead)?
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: If there were, in the heavens and the earth, other gods besides Allah, there would have been confusion in both! but glory to Allah, the Lord of the Throne: (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: He cannot be questioned for His acts, but they will be questioned (for theirs).
column3: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,

column2: Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides him? Say, "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not the Truth, and so turn away.
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: Not a messenger did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.
column3: That the LORD may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.

column2: And they say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten offspring." Glory to Him! they are (but) servants raised to honour.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: They speak not before He speaks, and they act (in all things) by His Command.
column3: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

column2: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable, and they stand in awe and reverence of His (Glory).
column3: Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

column2: If any of them should say, "I am a god besides Him", such a one We should reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.
column3: If others be partakers of this power over you, are not we rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

column2: Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of creation), before we clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
column3: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

column2: And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with them, and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive Guidance.
column3: And thou shalt say, I will go up to the land of unwalled villages; I will go to them that are at rest, that dwell safely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates,

column2: And We have made the heavens as a canopy well guarded: yet do they turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.
column3: Thus saith the LORD, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is his name:

column2: We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if then thou shouldst die, would they live permanently?
column3: And whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the tree roots; thy kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known that the heavens do rule.

column2: Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil and by good by way of trial. to Us must ye return.
column3: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

column2: When the Unbelievers see thee, they treat thee not except with ridicule. "Is this," (they say), "the one who talks of your gods?" and they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious!
column3: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

column2: Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My Signs; then ye will not ask Me to hasten them!
column3: Yea, before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?

column2: They say: "When will this promise come to pass, if ye are telling the truth?"
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor yet from their backs, and (when) no help can reach them!
column3: LORD, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.

column2: Nay, it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no power will they have then to avert it, nor will they (then) get respite.
column3: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

column2: Mocked were (many) messenger before thee; But their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column2: Say: "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath of) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
column3: And the men of Bethshemesh said, Who is able to stand before this holy LORD God? and to whom shall he go up from us?

column2: Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power to aid themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.
column3: And my people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High, none at all would exalt him.

column2: Nay, We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?
column3: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

column2: Say, "I do but warn you according to revelation": But the deaf will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned!
column3: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.

column2: If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them, they will then say, "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"
column3: For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the LORD of hosts.

column2: We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least, and if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
column3: So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before thy face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.

column2: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-
column3: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:

column2: Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts, and who hold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe.
column3: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

column2: And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye then reject it?
column3: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:

column2: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.
column3: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

column2: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"
column3: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee:

column2: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."
column3: Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.

column2: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."
column3: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.

column2: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"
column3: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?

column2: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).
column3: And he said unto them, I am an Hebrew; and I fear the LORD, the God of heaven, which hath made the sea and the dry land.

column2: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..
column3: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

column2: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.
column3: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

column2: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
column3: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

column2: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."
column3: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

column2: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
column3: And they said unto Jephthah, Come, and be our captain, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.

column2: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"
column3: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?

column2: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
column3: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

column2: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
column3: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

column2: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"
column3: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?

column2: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
column3: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

column2: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city, even behind the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:

column2: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"
column3: And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:

column2: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.
column3: And he defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.

column2: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
column3: And I gave unto Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; but Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.

column2: And We made them leaders, guiding (men) by Our Command, and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds, to establish regular prayers, and to practise regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only).
column3: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

column2: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.
column3: For there are certain men crept in unawares, who were before of old ordained to this condemnation, ungodly men, turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness, and denying the only Lord God, and our Lord Jesus Christ.

column2: And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the Righteous.
column3: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

column2: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.
column3: Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation wherewith he provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger.

column2: We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they were a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood) all together.
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.
column3: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them off from executing the priest's office unto the LORD:

column2: To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises, with David: it was We Who did (all these things).
column3: And he provided the first part for himself, because there, in a portion of the lawgiver, was he seated; and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the LORD, and his judgments with Israel.

column2: It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your benefit, to guard you from each other's violence: will ye then be grateful?
column3: Also I said, It is not good that ye do: ought ye not to walk in the fear of our God because of the reproach of the heathen our enemies?

column2: (It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow (tamely) for Solomon, to his order, to the land which We had blessed: for We do know all things.
column3: For who hath despised the day of small things? for they shall rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those seven; they are the eyes of the LORD, which run to and fro through the whole earth.

column2: And of the evil ones, were some who dived for him, and did other work besides; and it was We Who guarded them.
column3: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and also concerning the swine.

column2: And (remember) Job, when He cried to his Lord, "Truly distress has seized me, but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."
column3: And when he came to the den, he cried with a lamentable voice unto Daniel: and the king spake and said to Daniel, O Daniel, servant of the living God, is thy God, whom thou servest continually, able to deliver thee from the lions?

column2: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.
column3: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river of Ahava, that we might afflict ourselves before our God, to seek of him a right way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance.

column2: And (remember) Isma'il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;
column3: Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;

column2: We admitted them to Our mercy: for they were of the righteous ones.
column3: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.

column2: And remember Zun-nun, when he departed in wrath: He imagined that We had no power over him! But he cried through the deptHs of darkness, "There is no god but thou: glory to thee: I was indeed wrong!"
column3: Therefore, thou son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thee, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal:

column2: So We listened to him: and delivered him from distress: and thus do We deliver those who have faith.
column3: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

column2: And (remember) Zakariya, when he cried to his Lord: "O my Lord! leave me not without offspring, though thou art the best of inheritors."
column3: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, which told me that I should be king over this people.

column2: So We listened to him: and We granted him Yahya: We cured his wife's (Barrenness) for him. These (three) were ever quick in emulation in good works; they used to call on Us with love and reverence, and humble themselves before Us.
column3: His prayer also, and how God was intreated of him, and all his sins, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.

column2: And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for all peoples.
column3: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

column2: Verily, this brotherhood of yours is a single brotherhood, and I am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore serve Me (and no other).
column3: As for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations.

column2: But (later generations) cut off their affair (of unity), one from another: (yet) will they all return to Us.
column3: Now that being broken, whereas four stood up for it, four kingdoms shall stand up out of the nation, but not in his power.

column2: Whoever works any act of righteousness and has faith,- His endeavour will not be rejected: We shall record it in his favour.
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed: that they shall not return,
column3: I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations which Joshua left when he died:

column2: Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every hill.
column3: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.

column2: Then will the true promise draw nigh (of fulfilment): then behold! the eyes of the Unbelievers will fixedly stare in horror: "Ah! Woe to us! we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we truly did wrong!"
column3: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.

column2: Verily ye, (unbelievers), and the (false) gods that ye worship besides Allah, are (but) fuel for Hell! to it will ye (surely) come!
column3: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

column2: If these had been gods, they would not have got there! but each one will abide therein.
column3: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

column2: There, sobbing will be their lot, nor will they there hear (aught else).
column3: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

column2: Those for whom the good (record) from Us has gone before, will be removed far therefrom.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Not the slightest sound will they hear of Hell: what their souls desired, in that will they dwell.
column3: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

column2: The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will meet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day,- (the Day) that ye were promised."
column3: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

column2: The Day that We roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books (completed),- even as We produced the first creation, so shall We produce a new one: a promise We have undertaken: truly shall We fulfil it.
column3: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.

column2: Before this We wrote in the Psalms, after the Message (given to Moses): My servants the righteous, shall inherit the earth."
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

column2: Verily in this (Qur'an) is a Message for people who would (truly) worship Allah.
column3: It is a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in mount Sinai for a sweet savor, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD.

column2: We sent thee not, but as a Mercy for all creatures.
column3: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.

column2: Say: "What has come to me by inspiration is that your Allah is One Allah: will ye therefore bow to His Will (in Islam)?"
column3: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

column2: But if they turn back, Say: "I have proclaimed the Message to you all alike and in truth; but I know not whether that which ye are promised is near or far.
column3: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.

column2: "It is He Who knows what is open in speech and what ye hide (in your hearts).
column3: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

column2: "I know not but that it may be a trial for you, and a grant of (worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time."
column3: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

column2: Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is the One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies ye utter!"
column3: O LORD, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant, and to the prayer of thy servants, who desire to fear thy name: and prosper, I pray thee, thy servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king's cupbearer.

column2: O mankind! fear your Lord! for the convulsion of the Hour (of Judgment) will be a thing terrible!
column3: Howl ye; for the day of the LORD is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.

column2: The Day ye shall see it, every mother giving suck shall forget her suckling-babe, and every pregnant female shall drop her load (unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot, yet not drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah.
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: And yet among men there are such as dispute about Allah, without knowledge, and follow every evil one obstinate in rebellion!
column3: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)

column2: About the (Evil One) it is decreed that whoever turns to him for friendship, him will he lead astray, and he will guide him to the Penalty of the Fire.
column3: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

column2: O mankind! if ye have a doubt about the Resurrection, (consider) that We created you out of dust, then out of sperm, then out of a leech-like clot, then out of a morsel of flesh, partly formed and partly unformed, in order that We may manifest (our power) to you; and We cause whom We will to rest in the wombs for an appointed term, then do We bring you out as babes, then (foster you) that ye may reach your age of full strength; and some of you are called to die, and some are sent back to the feeblest old age, so that they know nothing after having known (much), and (further), thou seest the earth barren and lifeless, but when We pour down rain on it, it is stirred (to life), it swells, and it puts forth every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs).
column3: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

column2: This is so, because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life to the dead, and it is He Who has power over all things.
column3: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.

column2: And verily the Hour will come: there can be no doubt about it, or about (the fact) that Allah will raise up all who are in the graves.
column3: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

column2: Yet there is among men such a one as disputes about Allah, without Knowledge, without Guidance, and without a Book of Enlightenment,-
column3: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

column2: (Disdainfully) bending his side, in order to lead (men) astray from the Path of Allah: for him there is disgrace in this life, and on the Day of Judgment We shall make him taste the Penalty of burning (Fire).
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: (It will be said): "This is because of the deeds which thy hands sent forth, for verily Allah is not unjust to His servants.
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: There are among men some who serve Allah, as it were, on the verge: if good befalls them, they are, therewith, well content; but if a trial comes to them, they turn on their faces: they lose both this world and the Hereafter: that is loss for all to see!
column3: Though a sinner do evil an hundred times, and his days be prolonged, yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, which fear before him:

column2: They call on such deities, besides Allah, as can neither hurt nor profit them: that is straying far indeed (from the Way)!
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: (Perhaps) they call on one whose hurt is nearer than his profit: evil, indeed, is the patron, and evil the companion (or help)!
column3: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.
