column2: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no son has He begotten, nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is He who created all things, and ordered them in due proportions.
column3: For thus saith the LORD that created the heavens; God himself that formed the earth and made it; he hath established it, he created it not in vain, he formed it to be inhabited: I am the LORD; and there is none else.

column2: Yet have they taken, besides him, gods that can create nothing but are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to themselves; nor can they control death nor life nor resurrection.
column3: There is no man that hath power over the spirit to retain the spirit; neither hath he power in the day of death: and there is no discharge in that war; neither shall wickedness deliver those that are given to it.

column2: But the misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has forged, and others have helped him at it." In truth it is they who have put forward an iniquity and a falsehood.
column3: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

column2: And they say: "Tales of the ancients, which he has caused to be written: and they are dictated before him morning and evening."
column3: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

column2: Say: "The (Qur'an) was sent down by Him who knows the mystery (that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: And they say: "What sort of a messenger is this, who eats food, and walks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to him to give admonition with him?
column3: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;

column2: "Or (Why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him, or why has he (not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none other than a man bewitched."
column3: And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand?

column2: See what kinds of comparisons they make for thee! But they have gone astray, and never a way will they be able to find!
column3: Thy calf, O Samaria, hath cast thee off; mine anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?

column2: Blessed is He who, if that were His will, could give thee better (things) than those,- Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He could give thee palaces (secure to dwell in).
column3: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

column2: Nay they deny the hour (of the judgment to come): but We have prepared a blazing fire for such as deny the hour:
column3: Assemble yourselves and come; draw near together, ye that are escaped of the nations: they have no knowledge that set up the wood of their graven image, and pray unto a god that cannot save.

column2: When it sees them from a place far off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.
column3: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.

column2: And when they are cast, bound together into a constricted place therein, they will plead for destruction there and then!
column3: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into a land which they know not?

column2: "This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for destruction oft-repeated!"
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: Say: "Is that best, or the eternal garden, promised to the righteous? for them, that is a reward as well as a goal (of attainment).
column3: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

column2: "For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will dwell (there) for aye: A promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."
column3: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

column2: The day He will gather them together as well as those whom they worship besides Allah, He will ask: "Was it ye who let these My servants astray, or did they stray from the Path themselves?"
column3: Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? when he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go, and they departed?

column2: They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides Thee: But Thou didst bestow, on them and their fathers, good things (in life), until they forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost."
column3: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

column2: (Allah will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say: so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help." And whoever among you does wrong, him shall We cause to taste of a grievous Penalty.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: And the messengers whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as a trial for others: will ye have patience? for Allah is One Who sees (all things).
column3: And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu appointed fourscore men without, and said, If any of the men whom I have brought into your hands escape, he that letteth him go, his life shall be for the life of him.

column2: Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are not the angels sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves, and mighty is the insolence of their impiety!
column3: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the LORD in Zion? is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with strange vanities?

column2: The Day they see the angels,- no joy will there be to the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden (to you) altogether!"
column3: But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.

column2: And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life), and We shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: The Companions of the Garden will be well, that Day, in their abode, and have the fairest of places for repose.
column3: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

column2: The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and angels shall be sent down, descending (in ranks),-
column3: And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll: and all their host shall fall down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a falling fig from the fig tree.

column2: That Day, the dominion as of right and truth, shall be (wholly) for (Allah) Most Merciful: it will be a Day of dire difficulty for the misbelievers.
column3: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column2: The Day that the wrong-doer will bite at his hands, he will say, "Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Messenger!
column3: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant's sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:

column2: "Ah! woe is me! Would that I had never taken such a one for a friend!
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: "He did lead me astray from the Message (of Allah) after it had come to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!"
column3: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

column2: Then the Messenger will say: "O my Lord! Truly my people took this Qur'an for just foolish nonsense."
column3: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.

column2: Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners: but enough is thy Lord to guide and to help.
column3: So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.

column2: Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to him all at once? Thus (is it revealed), that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow, well-arranged stages, gradually.
column3: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

column2: And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the truth and the best explanation (thereof).
column3: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

column2: Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces,- they will be in an evil plight, and, as to Path, most astray.
column3: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.

column2: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;
column3: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

column2: And We command: "Go ye both, to the people who have rejected our Signs:" And those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.
column3: And the LORD sent thee on a journey, and said, Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed.

column2: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-
column3: Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge, and have taken vengeance with a despiteful heart, to destroy it for the old hatred;

column2: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
column3: The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.

column2: To each one We set forth Parables and examples; and each one We broke to utter annihilation (for their sins).
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection.
column3: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

column2: When they see thee, they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?"
column3: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.

column2: "He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods, had it not been that we were constant to them!" - Soon will they know, when they see the Penalty, who it is that is most misled in Path!
column3: And if the avenger of blood pursue after him, then they shall not deliver the slayer up into his hand; because he smote his neighbor unwittingly, and hated him not beforetime.

column2: Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
column3: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

column2: Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle;- nay, they are worse astray in Path.
column3: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

column2: Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord?- How He doth prolong the shadow! If He willed, He could make it stationary! then do We make the sun its guide;
column3: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

column2: Then We draw it in towards Ourselves,- a contraction by easy stages.
column3: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.

column2: And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you, and Sleep as Repose, and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.
column3: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

column2: And He it is Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky,-
column3: Ask ye of the LORD rain in the time of the latter rain; so the LORD shall make bright clouds, and give them showers of rain, to every one grass in the field.

column2: That with it We may give life to a dead land, and slake the thirst of things We have created,- cattle and men in great numbers.
column3: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.

column2: And We have distributed the (water) amongst them, in order that they may celebrate (our) praises, but most men are averse (to aught) but (rank) ingratitude.
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column2: Had it been Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every centre of population.
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers, but strive against them with the utmost strenuousness, with the (Qur'an).
column3: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

column2: It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: One palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter; yet has He made a barrier between them, a partition that is forbidden to be passed.
column3: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition between us;

column2: It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established relationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power (over all things).
column3: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

column2: Yet do they worship, besides Allah, things that can neither profit them nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord!
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
column3: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

column2: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one who will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate his praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of His servants;-
column3: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

column2: He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between, in six days, and is firmly established on the Throne (of Authority): Allah Most Gracious: ask thou, then, about Him of any acquainted (with such things).
column3: To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.

column2: When it is said to them, "Prostrate to (Allah) Most Gracious!", they say, "And what is (Allah) Most Gracious? Shall we prostrate to that which thou commandest us?" And it increases their flight (from the Truth).
column3: It may be the LORD thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God, and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.

column2: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;
column3: Thus saith the LORD, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is his name:

column2: And it is He Who made the Night and the Day to follow each other: for such as have the will to celebrate His praises or to show their gratitude.
column3: For God hath put in their hearts to fulfil his will, and to agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the words of God shall be fulfilled.

column2: And the servants of (Allah) Most Gracious are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace!";
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate and standing;
column3: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

column2: Those who say, "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell, for its Wrath is indeed an affliction grievous,-
column3: O LORD, according to all thy righteousness, I beseech thee, let thine anger and thy fury be turned away from thy city Jerusalem, thy holy mountain: because for our sins, and for the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach to all that are about us.

column2: "Evil indeed is it as an abode, and as a place to rest in";
column3: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun, that there is one event unto all: yea, also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to the dead.

column2: Those who, when they spend, are not extravagant and not niggardly, but hold a just (balance) between those (extremes);
column3: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

column2: Those who invoke not, with Allah, any other god, nor slay such life as Allah has made sacred except for just cause, nor commit fornication; - and any that does this (not only) meets punishment.
column3: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

column2: (But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will dwell therein in ignominy,-
column3: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column2: Unless he repents, believes, and works righteous deeds, for Allah will change the evil of such persons into good, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful,
column3: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

column2: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with an (acceptable) conversion;-
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: Those who witness no falsehood, and, if they pass by futility, they pass by it with honourable (avoidance);
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: Those who, when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord, droop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind;
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Grant unto us wives and offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous."
column3: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

column2: Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in heaven, because of their patient constancy: therein shall they be met with salutations and peace,
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Dwelling therein;- how beautiful an abode and place of rest!
column3: And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;

column2: Say (to the Rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if ye call not on Him: But ye have indeed rejected (Him), and soon will come the inevitable (punishment)!"
column3: And he was sore athirst, and called on the LORD, and said, Thou hast given this great deliverance into the hand of thy servant: and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?

column2: Ta. Sin. Mim.
column3: Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

column2: These are verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
column3: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

column2: It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief, that they do not become Believers.
column3: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

column2: If (such) were Our Will, We could send down to them from the sky a Sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
column3: For God hath put in their hearts to fulfil his will, and to agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the words of God shall be fulfilled.

column2: But there comes not to them a newly-revealed Message from (Allah) Most Gracious, but they turn away therefrom.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: Do they not look at the earth,- how many noble things of all kinds We have produced therein?
column3: But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!

column2: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
column3: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

column2: And verily, thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
column3: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

column2: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt: for all the men are dead which sought thy life.

column2: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
column3: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

column2: He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with falsehood:
column3: Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.

column2: "My breast will be straitened. And my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron.
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: "And (further), they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me."
column3: And the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness be a false witness, and hath testified falsely against his brother;

column2: Allah said: "By no means! proceed then, both of you, with Our Signs; We are with you, and will listen (to your call).
column3: Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.

column2: "So go forth, both of you, to Pharaoh, and say: 'We have been sent by the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds;
column3: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:

column2: "'Send thou with us the Children of Israel.'"
column3: Yea, thou shalt see thy children's children, and peace upon Israel.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?
column3: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honor, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:

column2: "And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst, and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!"
column3: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

column2: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.
column3: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the LORD:

column2: "So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the messengers.
column3: But I would not hearken unto Balaam; therefore he blessed you still: so I delivered you out of his hand.

column2: "And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
column3: And thou shalt know that I am the LORD, and that I have heard all thy blasphemies which thou hast spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate, they are given us to consume.

column2: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"
column3: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

column2: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."
column3: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.

column2: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"
column3: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

column2: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"
column3: And this is the blessing, wherewith Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"
column3: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,

column2: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"
column3: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"
column3: Then said Abishai to David, God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear even to the earth at once, and I will not smite him the second time.

column2: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
column3: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"
column3: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.

column2: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
column3: And when Moses saw that the people were naked; (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies:)

column2: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
column3: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

column2: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:
column3: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,

column2: "His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then what is it ye counsel?"
column3: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.

column2: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while), and dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect-
column3: And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:

column2: "And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
column3: And carry these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.

column2: So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day well-known,
column3: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

column2: And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?-
column3: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?

column2: "That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: "Of course - shall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?
column3: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

column2: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person)."
column3: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

column2: Moses said to them: "Throw ye - that which ye are about to throw!"
column3: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?

column2: So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will certainly win!"
column3: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.

column2: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!
column3: And not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

column2: Then did the sorcerers fall down, prostrate in adoration,
column3: Then these men assembled, and found Daniel praying and making supplication before his God.

column2: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
column3: Then said he, These are the two anointed ones, that stand by the LORD of the whole earth.

column2: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
column3: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

column2: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"
column3: Now Absalom had commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now when Amnon's heart is merry with wine, and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon; then kill him, fear not: have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.

column2: They said: "No matter! for us, we shall but return to our Lord!
column3: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

column2: "Only, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults, that we may become foremost among the believers!"
column3: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

column2: By inspiration we told Moses: "Travel by night with my servants; for surely ye shall be pursued."
column3: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.

column2: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities,
column3: And he sent the letters unto all the Jews, to the hundred twenty and seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with words of peace and truth,

column2: (Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band,
column3: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it.

column2: "And they are raging furiously against us;
column3: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

column2: "But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
column3: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

column2: So We expelled them from gardens, springs,
column3: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.

column2: Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;
column3: A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

column2: Thus it was, but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
column3: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.

column2: So they pursued them at sunrise.
column3: So the people rested on the seventh day.

column2: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."
column3: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?

column2: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"
column3: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?

column2: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.
column3: That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?

column2: And We made the other party approach thither.
column3: These going before tarried for us at Troas.

column2: We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
column3: Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with him, even with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans that were found there, and the men of war.

column2: But We drowned the others.
column3: So the people rested on the seventh day.

column2: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
column3: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

column2: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.
column3: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.

column2: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
column3: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?

column2: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them."
column3: And this thing became a sin: for the people went to worship before the one, even unto Dan.

column2: He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)?"
column3: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

column2: "Or do you good or harm?"
column3: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.

column2: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do)."
column3: Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.

column2: He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-
column3: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

column2: "Ye and your fathers before you?-
column3: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

column2: "For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
column3: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column2: "Who created me, and it is He Who guides me;
column3: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace,

column2: "Who gives me food and drink,
column3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

column2: "And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me;
column3: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace,

column2: "Who will cause me to die, and then to life (again);
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: "And who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the day of Judgment.
column3: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

column2: "O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me, and join me with the righteous;
column3: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

column2: "Grant me honourable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations);
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: "Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
column3: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

column2: "Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
column3: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

column2: "And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;-
column3: In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people.

column2: "The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
column3: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

column2: "But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: "To the righteous, the Garden will be brought near,
column3: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.

column2: "And to those straying in Evil, the Fire will be placed in full view;
column3: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

column2: "And it shall be said to them: 'Where are the (gods) ye worshipped-
column3: And he shall say, Where are their gods, their rock in whom they trusted,

column2: "'Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'

column3: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

column2: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
column3: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?

column2: "I will certainly punish him with a severe penalty, or execute him, unless he bring me a clear reason (for absence)."
column3: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.

column2: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: "I found (there) a woman ruling over them and provided with every requisite; and she has a magnificent throne.
column3: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished and prepared: there make ready for us.

column2: "I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah: Satan has made their deeds seem pleasing in their eyes, and has kept them away from the Path,- so they receive no guidance,-
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: "(Kept them away from the Path), that they should not worship Allah, Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what ye hide and what ye reveal.
column3: To open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.

column2: "Allah!- there is no god but He!- Lord of the Throne Supreme!"
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: (Solomon) said: "Soon shall we see whether thou hast told the truth or lied!
column3: Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me? or what if thy father answer thee roughly?

column2: "Go thou, with this letter of mine, and deliver it to them: then draw back from them, and (wait to) see what answer they return"...
column3: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

column2: (The queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me - a letter worthy of respect.
column3: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

column2: "It is from Solomon, and is (as follows): 'In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful:
column3: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:

column2: "'Be ye not arrogant against me, but come to me in submission (to the true Religion).'"
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair have I decided except in your presence."
column3: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

column2: They said: "We are endued with strength, and given to vehement war: but the command is with thee; so consider what thou wilt command."
column3: I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?

column2: She said: "Kings, when they enter a country, despoil it, and make the noblest of its people its meanest thus do they behave.
column3: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

column2: "But I am going to send him a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ambassadors."
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: Now when (the embassy) came to Solomon, he said: "Will ye give me abundance in wealth? But that which Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you! Nay it is ye who rejoice in your gift!
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Go back to them, and be sure we shall come to them with such hosts as they will never be able to meet: We shall expel them from there in disgrace, and they will feel humbled (indeed)."
column3: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.

column2: He said (to his own men): "Ye chiefs! which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: Said an 'Ifrit, of the Jinns: "I will bring it to thee before thou rise from thy council: indeed I have full strength for the purpose, and may be trusted."
column3: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

column2: Said one who had knowledge of the Book: "I will bring it to thee within the twinkling of an eye!" Then when (Solomon) saw it placed firmly before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Lord!- to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! and if any is grateful, truly his gratitude is (a gain) for his own soul; but if any is ungrateful, truly my Lord is Free of all Needs, Supreme in Honour!"
column3: And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:

column2: He said: "Transform her throne out of all recognition by her: let us see whether she is guided (to the truth) or is one of those who receive no guidance."
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is this thy throne?" She said, "It was just like this; and knowledge was bestowed on us in advance of this, and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)."
column3: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,

column2: And he diverted her from the worship of others besides Allah: for she was (sprung) of a people that had no faith.
column3: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.

column2: She was asked to enter the lofty Palace: but when she saw it, she thought it was a lake of water, and she (tucked up her skirts), uncovering her legs. He said: "This is but a palace paved smooth with slabs of glass." She said: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul: I do (now) submit (in Islam), with Solomon, to the Lord of the Worlds."
column3: Her filthiness is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end; therefore she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O LORD, behold my affliction: for the enemy hath magnified himself.

column2: We sent (aforetime), to the Thamud, their brother Salih, saying, "Serve Allah": But behold, they became two factions quarrelling with each other.
column3: In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those which kept the door, were wroth, and sought to lay hands on the king Ahasuerus.

column2: He said: "O my people! why ask ye to hasten on the evil in preference to the good? If only ye ask Allah for forgiveness, ye may hope to receive mercy.
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: They said: "Ill omen do we augur from thee and those that are with thee". He said: "Your ill omen is with Allah; yea, ye are a people under trial."
column3: Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

column2: There were in the city nine men of a family, who made mischief in the land, and would not reform.
column3: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

column2: They said: "Swear a mutual oath by Allah that we shall make a secret night attack on him and his people, and that we shall then say to his heir (when he seeks vengeance): 'We were not present at the slaughter of his people, and we are positively telling the truth.'"
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: They plotted and planned, but We too planned, even while they perceived it not.
column3: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

column2: Then see what was the end of their plot!- this, that We destroyed them and their people, all (of them).
column3: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.

column2: Now such were their houses, - in utter ruin, - because they practised wrong-doing. Verily in this is a Sign for people of knowledge.
column3: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.

column2: And We saved those who believed and practised righteousness.
column3: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

column2: (We also sent) Lut (as a messenger): behold, He said to his people, "Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: Would ye really approach men in your lusts rather than women? Nay, ye are a people (grossly) ignorant!
column3: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

column2: But his people gave no other answer but this: they said, "Drive out the followers of Lut from your city: these are indeed men who want to be clean and pure!"
column3: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this man to reign over us.

column2: But We saved him and his family, except his wife; her We destined to be of those who lagged behind.
column3: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

column2: And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: Say: Praise be to Allah, and Peace on his servants whom He has chosen (for his Message). (Who) is better?- Allah or the false gods they associate (with Him)?
column3: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column2: Or, Who has created the heavens and the earth, and Who sends you down rain from the sky? Yea, with it We cause to grow well-planted orchards full of beauty of delight: it is not in your power to cause the growth of the trees in them. (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay, they are a people who swerve from justice.
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: Or, Who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar between the two bodies of flowing water? (can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay, most of them know not.
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: Or, Who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him, and Who relieves its suffering, and makes you (mankind) inheritors of the earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Little it is that ye heed!
column3: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

column2: Or, Who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea, and Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His Mercy? (Can there be another) god besides Allah?- High is Allah above what they associate with Him!
column3: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.

column2: Or, Who originates creation, then repeats it, and who gives you sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Say, "Bring forth your argument, if ye are telling the truth!"
column3: And the men of Bethshemesh said, Who is able to stand before this holy LORD God? and to whom shall he go up from us?

column2: Say: None in the heavens or on earth, except Allah, knows what is hidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for Judgment).
column3: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

column2: Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: Nay, they are in doubt and uncertainty thereanent; nay, they are blind thereunto!
column3: For all his days are sorrows, and his travail grief; yea, his heart taketh not rest in the night. This is also vanity.

column2: The Unbelievers say: "What! when we become dust,- we and our fathers,- shall we really be raised (from the dead)?
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: "It is true we were promised this,- we and our fathers before (us): these are nothing but tales of the ancients."
column3: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

column2: Say: "Go ye through the earth and see what has been the end of those guilty (of sin)."
column3: The LORD will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.

column2: But grieve not over them, nor distress thyself because of their plots.
column3: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked:

column2: They also say: "When will this promise (come to pass)? (Say) if ye are truthful."
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: Say: "It may be that some of the events which ye wish to hasten on may be (close) in your pursuit!"
column3: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of bounty, and not as of covetousness.

column2: But verily thy Lord is full of grace to mankind: Yet most of them are ungrateful.
column3: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

column2: And verily thy Lord knoweth all that their hearts do hide. As well as all that they reveal.
column3: And they come unto thee as the people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness.

column2: Nor is there aught of the unseen, in heaven or earth, but is (recorded) in a clear record.
column3: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

column2: Verily this Qur'an doth explain to the Children of Israel most of the matters in which they disagree.
column3: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.

column2: And it certainly is a Guide and a Mercy to those who believe.
column3: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

column2: Verily thy Lord will decide between them by His Decree: and He is Exalted in Might, All-Knowing.
column3: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column2: So put thy trust in Allah: for thou art on (the path of) manifest Truth.
column3: Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

column2: Truly thou canst not cause the dead to listen, nor canst thou cause the deaf to hear the call, (especially) when they turn back in retreat.
column3: Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.

column2: Nor canst thou be a guide to the blind, (to prevent them) from straying: only those wilt thou get to listen who believe in Our Signs, and they will bow in Islam.
column3: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

column2: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.
column3: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

column2: One day We shall gather together from every people a troop of those who reject our Signs, and they shall be kept in ranks,-
column3: And this man shall be the peace, when the Assyrian shall come into our land: and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise against him seven shepherds, and eight principal men.

column2: Until, when they come (before the Judgment-seat), (Allah) will say: "Did ye reject My Signs, though ye comprehended them not in knowledge, or what was it ye did?"
column3: It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.

column2: And the Word will be fulfilled against them, because of their wrong-doing, and they will be unable to speak (in plea).
column3: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake.

column2: See they not that We have made the Night for them to rest in and the Day to give them light? Verily in this are Signs for any people that believe!
column3: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

column2: And the Day that the Trumpet will be sounded - then will be smitten with terror those who are in the heavens, and those who are on earth, except such as Allah will please (to exempt): and all shall come to His (Presence) as beings conscious of their lowliness.
column3: And it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled on their lees: that say in their heart, The LORD will not do good, neither will he do evil.

column2: Thou seest the mountains and thinkest them firmly fixed: but they shall pass away as the clouds pass away: (such is) the artistry of Allah, who disposes of all things in perfect order: for he is well acquainted with all that ye do.
column3: As thou knowest not what is the way of the spirit, nor how the bones do grow in the womb of her that is with child: even so thou knowest not the works of God who maketh all.

column2: If any do good, good will (accrue) to them therefrom; and they will be secure from terror that Day.
column3: Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares.

column2: And if any do evil, their faces will be thrown headlong into the Fire: "Do ye receive a reward other than that which ye have earned by your deeds?"
column3: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

column2: For me, I have been commanded to serve the Lord of this city, Him Who has sanctified it and to Whom (belong) all things: and I am commanded to be of those who bow in Islam to Allah's Will,-
column3: Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the LORD, to serve him, and to love the name of the LORD, to be his servants, every one that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and taketh hold of my covenant;

column2: And to rehearse the Qur'an: and if any accept guidance, they do it for the good of their own souls, and if any stray, say: "I am only a Warner".
column3: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

column2: And say: "Praise be to Allah, Who will soon show you His Signs, so that ye shall know them"; and thy Lord is not unmindful of all that ye do.
column3: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the LORD, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

column2: Ta. Sin. Mim.
column3: Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

column2: These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
column3: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

column2: We rehearse to thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in Truth, for people who believe.
column3: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

column2: Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people into sections, depressing a small group among them: their sons he slew, but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker of mischief.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: And We wished to be Gracious to those who were being depressed in the land, to make them leaders (in Faith) and make them heirs,
column3: Blessed are they that do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and may enter in through the gates into the city.

column2: To establish a firm place for them in the land, and to show Pharaoh, Haman, and their hosts, at their hands, the very things against which they were taking precautions.
column3: Unto the men of the east with the Ammonites, and will give them in possession, that the Ammonites may not be remembered among the nations.

column2: So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child), but when thou hast fears about him, cast him into the river, but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."
column3: Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the LORD; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

column2: Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (It was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin.
column3: And they left the house of the LORD God of their fathers, and served groves and idols: and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their trespass.

column2: The wife of Pharaoh said: "(Here is) joy of the eye, for me and for thee: slay him not. It may be that he will be use to us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not (what they were doing)!
column3: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.

column2: But there came to be a void in the heart of the mother of Moses: She was going almost to disclose his (case), had We not strengthened her heart (with faith), so that she might remain a (firm) believer.
column3: For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as was the heart of David his father.

column2: And she said to the sister of (Moses), "Follow him" so she (the sister) watched him in the character of a stranger. And they knew not.
column3: And the Israelitish woman's son blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed. And they brought him unto Moses: (and his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:)

column2: And we ordained that he refused suck at first, until (His sister came up and) said: "Shall I point out to you the people of a house that will nourish and bring him up for you and be sincerely attached to him?"...
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: Thus did We restore him to his mother, that her eye might be comforted, that she might not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true: but most of them do not understand.
column3: And he said, While the child was yet alive, I fasted and wept: for I said, Who can tell whether GOD will be gracious to me, that the child may live?

column2: When he reached full age, and was firmly established (in life), We bestowed on him wisdom and knowledge: for thus do We reward those who do good.
column3: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

column2: And he entered the city at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting,- one of his own religion, and the other, of his foes. Now the man of his own religion appealed to him against his foe, and Moses struck him with his fist and made an end of him. He said: "This is a work of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!"
column3: And he sought Ahaziah: and they caught him, (for he was hid in Samaria,) and brought him to Jehu: and when they had slain him, they buried him: Because, said they, he is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought the LORD with all his heart. So the house of Ahaziah had no power to keep still the kingdom.

column2: He prayed: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul! Do Thou then forgive me!" So (Allah) forgave him: for He is the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities be overpast.

column2: He said: "O my Lord! For that Thou hast bestowed Thy Grace on me, never shall I be a help to those who sin!"
column3: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

column2: So he saw the morning in the city, looking about, in a state of fear, when behold, the man who had, the day before, sought his help called aloud for his help (again). Moses said to him: "Thou art truly, it is clear, a quarrelsome fellow!"
column3: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;

column2: Then, when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them, that man said: "O Moses! Is it thy intention to slay me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other than to become a powerful violent man in the land, and not to be one who sets things right!"
column3: And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?

column2: And there came a man, running, from the furthest end of the City. He said: "O Moses! the Chiefs are taking counsel together about thee, to slay thee: so get thee away, for I do give thee sincere advice."
column3: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.

column2: He therefore got away therefrom, looking about, in a state of fear. He prayed "O my Lord! save me from people given to wrong-doing."
column3: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

column2: Then, when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan, he said: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and straight Path."
column3: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

column2: And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan, he found there a group of men watering (their flocks), and besides them he found two women who were keeping back (their flocks). He said: "What is the matter with you?" They said: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds take back (their flocks): And our father is a very old man."
column3: And as they went up the hill to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?

column2: So he watered (their flocks) for them; then he turned back to the shade, and said:"O my Lord! truly am I in (desperate) need of any good that Thou dost send me!"
column3: And he was sore athirst, and called on the LORD, and said, Thou hast given this great deliverance into the hand of thy servant: and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?

column2: Afterwards one of the (damsels) came (back) to him, walking bashfully. She said: "My father invites thee that he may reward thee for having watered (our flocks) for us." So when he came to him and narrated the story, he said: "Fear thou not: (well) hast thou escaped from unjust people."
column3: And now I have heard that thou hast shearers: now thy shepherds which were with us, we hurt them not, neither was there ought missing unto them, all the while they were in Carmel.

column2: Said one of the (damsels): "O my (dear) father! engage him on wages: truly the best of men for thee to employ is the (man) who is strong and trusty"....
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: He said: "I intend to wed one of these my daughters to thee, on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou complete ten years, it will be (grace) from thee. But I intend not to place thee under a difficulty: thou wilt find me, indeed, if Allah wills, one of the righteous."
column3: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:

column2: He said: "Be that (the agreement) between me and thee: whichever of the two terms I fulfil, let there be no ill-will to me. Be Allah a witness to what we say."
column3: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.

column2: Now when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his family, he perceived a fire in the direction of Mount Tur. He said to his family: "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; I hope to bring you from there some information, or a burning firebrand, that ye may warm yourselves."
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses, Behold, thy days approach that thou must die: call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tabernacle of the congregation, that I may give him a charge. And Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the tabernacle of the congregation.

column2: But when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard from the right bank of the valley, from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses! Verily I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds....
column3: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

column2: "Now do thou throw thy rod!" but when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake, he turned back in retreat, and retraced not his steps: O Moses!" (It was said), "Draw near, and fear not: for thou art of those who are secure.
column3: Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:

column2: "Move thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm), and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear. Those are the two credentials from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious and wicked."
column3: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands.

column2: He said: "O my Lord! I have slain a man among them, and I fear lest they slay me.
column3: And, behold, one like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord, by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength.

column2: "And my brother Aaron - He is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper, to confirm (and strengthen) me: for I fear that they may accuse me of falsehood."
column3: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.

column2: He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy brother, and invest you both with authority, so they shall not be able to touch you: with Our Sign shall ye triumph,- you two as well as those who follow you."
column3: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

column2: When Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said: "This is nothing but sorcery faked up: never did we head the like among our fathers of old!"
column3: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

column2: Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with guidance from Him and whose end will be best in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper."
column3: For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God?

column2: Pharaoh said: "O Chiefs! no god do I know for you but myself: therefore, O Haman! light me a (kiln to bake bricks) out of clay, and build me a lofty palace, that I may mount up to the god of Moses: but as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!"
column3: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, which told me that I should be king over this people.
