column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: Further, they say, "When will this promise (come to pass), if what ye say is true?"
column3: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

column2: They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it will seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
column3: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turned to his course, as the horse rusheth into the battle.

column2: No (chance) will they then have, by will, to dispose (of their affairs), nor to return to their own people!
column3: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

column2: The trumpet shall be sounded, when behold! from the sepulchres (men) will rush forth to their Lord!
column3: And with the arms of a flood shall they be overflown from before him, and shall be broken; yea, also the prince of the covenant.

column2: They will say: "Ah! Woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose?"... (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most Gracious had promised. And true was the word of the messengers!"
column3: And the men of Bethshemesh said, Who is able to stand before this holy LORD God? and to whom shall he go up from us?

column2: It will be no more than a single Blast, when lo! they will all be brought up before Us!
column3: He cried also in mine ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause them that have charge over the city to draw near, even every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.

column2: Then, on that Day, not a soul will be wronged in the least, and ye shall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds.
column3: And they shall recompense your lewdness upon you, and ye shall bear the sins of your idols: and ye shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

column2: Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in all that they do;
column3: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

column2: They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade, reclining on Thrones (of dignity);
column3: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

column2: (Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have whatever they call for;
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: "Peace!" - a word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!
column3: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

column2: "And O ye in sin! Get ye apart this Day!
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: "Did I not enjoin on you, O ye Children of Adam, that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?-
column3: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man's blood upon us.

column2: "And that ye should worship Me, (for that) this was the Straight Way?
column3: Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?

column2: "But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not, then, understand?
column3: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.

column2: "This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned!
column3: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death.

column2: "Embrace ye the (fire) this Day, for that ye (persistently) rejected (Truth)."
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: That Day shall We set a seal on their mouths. But their hands will speak to us, and their feet bear witness, to all that they did.
column3: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.

column2: If it had been our Will, We could surely have blotted out their eyes; then should they have run about groping for the Path, but how could they have seen?
column3: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

column2: And if it had been Our Will, We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places; then should they have been unable to move about, nor could they have returned (after error).
column3: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

column2: If We grant long life to any, We cause him to be reversed in nature: Will they not then understand?
column3: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.

column2: We have not instructed the (Prophet) in Poetry, nor is it meet for him: this is no less than a Message and a Qur'an making things clear:
column3: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

column2: That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive, and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).
column3: For if they which are of the law be heirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:

column2: See they not that it is We Who have created for them - among the things which Our hands have fashioned - cattle, which are under their dominion?-
column3: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

column2: And that We have subjected them to their (use)? of them some do carry them and some they eat:
column3: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.

column2: And they have (other) profits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful?
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: Yet they take (for worship) gods other than Allah, (hoping) that they might be helped!
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).
column3: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

column2: Let not their speech, then, grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose.
column3: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

column2: Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!
column3: Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?

column2: And he makes comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (origin and) Creation: He says, "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?"
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: Say, "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-
column3: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

column2: "The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! ye kindle therewith (your own fires)!
column3: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

column2: "Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" - Yea, indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme, of skill and knowledge (infinite)!
column3: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:

column2: Verily, when He intends a thing, His Command is, "be", and it is!
column3: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

column2: So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.
column3: And I will bring back all the people unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.

column2: By those who range themselves in ranks,
column3: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

column2: And so are strong in repelling (evil),
column3: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

column2: And thus proclaim the Message (of Allah)!
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: Verily, verily, your Allah is one!-
column3: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

column2: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all between them, and Lord of every point at the rising of the sun!
column3: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

column2: We have indeed decked the lower heaven with beauty (in) the stars,-
column3: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

column2: (For beauty) and for guard against all obstinate rebellious evil spirits,
column3: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

column2: (So) they should not strain their ears in the direction of the Exalted Assembly but be cast away from every side,
column3: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.

column2: Repulsed, for they are under a perpetual penalty,
column3: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

column2: Except such as snatch away something by stealth, and they are pursued by a flaming fire, of piercing brightness.
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: Just ask their opinion: are they the more difficult to create, or the (other) beings We have created? Them have We created out of a sticky clay!
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: Truly dost thou marvel, while they ridicule,
column3: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

column2: And, when they are admonished, pay no heed,-
column3: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

column2: And, when they see a Sign, turn it to mockery,
column3: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

column2: And say, "This is nothing but evident sorcery!
column3: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

column2: "What! when we die, and become dust and bones, shall we (then) be raised up (again)
column3: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

column2: "And also our fathers of old?"
column3: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.

column2: Say thou: "Yea, and ye shall then be humiliated (on account of your evil)."
column3: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake.

column2: Then it will be a single (compelling) cry; and behold, they will begin to see!
column3: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

column2: They will say, "Ah! Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"
column3: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!

column2: (A voice will say,) "This is the Day of Sorting Out, whose truth ye (once) denied!"
column3: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

column2: "Bring ye up", it shall be said, "The wrong-doers and their wives, and the things they worshipped-
column3: But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country, Go into the harlot's house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.

column2: "Besides Allah, and lead them to the Way to the (Fierce) Fire!
column3: Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

column2: "But stop them, for they must be asked:
column3: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

column2: "'What is the matter with you that ye help not each other?'"
column3: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?

column2: Nay, but that day they shall submit (to Judgment);
column3: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

column2: And they will turn to one another, and question one another.
column3: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.

column2: They will say: "It was ye who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"
column3: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)

column2: They will reply: "Nay, ye yourselves had no Faith!
column3: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

column2: "Nor had we any authority over you. Nay, it was ye who were a people in obstinate rebellion!
column3: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.

column2: "So now has been proved true, against us, the word of our Lord that we shall indeed (have to) taste (the punishment of our sins).
column3: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.

column2: "We led you astray: for truly we were ourselves astray."
column3: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

column2: Truly, that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty.
column3: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

column2: Verily that is how We shall deal with Sinners.
column3: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

column2: For they, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, would puff themselves up with Pride,
column3: When his disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?

column2: And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column2: Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth, and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).
column3: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one assent; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.

column2: Ye shall indeed taste of the Grievous Penalty;-
column3: What do ye imagine against the LORD? he will make an utter end: affliction shall not rise up the second time.

column2: But it will be no more than the retribution of (the Evil) that ye have wrought;-
column3: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column2: But the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah,-
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: For them is a Sustenance determined,
column3: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

column2: Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity,
column3: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

column2: In Gardens of Felicity,
column3: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column2: Facing each other on Thrones (of Dignity):
column3: The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the stays.

column2: Round will be passed to them a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain,
column3: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

column2: Crystal-white, of a taste delicious to those who drink (thereof),
column3: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

column2: Free from headiness; nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.
column3: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

column2: And besides them will be chaste women, restraining their glances, with big eyes (of wonder and beauty).
column3: These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaketh great swelling words, having men's persons in admiration because of advantage.

column2: As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded.
column3: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

column2: Then they will turn to one another and question one another.
column3: Greet one another with an holy kiss.

column2: One of them will start the talk and say: "I had an intimate companion (on the earth),
column3: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

column2: "Who used to say, 'what! art thou amongst those who bear witness to the Truth (of the Message)?
column3: Son of man, what is that proverb that ye have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged, and every vision faileth?

column2: "'When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed receive rewards and punishments?'"
column3: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

column2: (A voice) said: "Would ye like to look down?"
column3: He said, Bring them hither to me.

column2: He looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.
column3: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.

column2: He said: "By Allah! thou wast little short of bringing me to perdition!
column3: Then said I, Ah, Lord GOD! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.

column2: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I should certainly have been among those brought (there)!
column3: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:

column2: "Is it (the case) that we shall not die,
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: "Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: Verily this is the supreme achievement!
column3: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column2: For the like of this let all strive, who wish to strive.
column3: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

column2: Is that the better entertainment or the Tree of Zaqqum?
column3: And Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmeelite.

column2: For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.
column3: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

column2: For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-Fire:
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils:
column3: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

column2: Truly they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.
column3: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

column2: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water.
column3: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all.

column2: Then shall their return be to the (Blazing) Fire.
column3: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

column2: Truly they found their fathers on the wrong Path;
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: So they (too) were rushed down on their footsteps!
column3: And many believed on him there.

column2: And truly before them, many of the ancients went astray;-

column2: O David! We did indeed make thee a vicegerent on earth: so judge thou between men in truth (and justice): Nor follow thou the lusts (of thy heart), for they will mislead thee from the Path of Allah: for those who wander astray from the Path of Allah, is a Penalty Grievous, for that they forget the Day of Account.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column3: And with the arms of a flood shall they be overflown from before him, and shall be broken; yea, also the prince of the covenant.

column2: As also the evil ones, (including) every kind of builder and diver,-
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: As also others bound together in fetters.
column3: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

column2: "Such are Our Bounties: whether thou bestow them (on others) or withhold them, no account will be asked."
column3: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

column2: And he enjoyed, indeed, a Near Approach to Us, and a beautiful Place of (Final) Return.
column3: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

column2: Commemorate Our Servant Job. Behold he cried to his Lord: "The Evil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering!"
column3: And in the time of his distress did he trespass yet more against the LORD: this is that king Ahaz.

column2: (The command was given:) "Strike with thy foot: here is (water) wherein to wash, cool and refreshing, and (water) to drink."
column3: Then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive and clean, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:

column2: And We gave him (back) his people, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who have Understanding.
column3: And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever;

column2: "And take in thy hand a little grass, and strike therewith: and break not (thy oath)." Truly We found him full of patience and constancy. How excellent in Our service! ever did he turn (to Us)!
column3: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

column2: And commemorate Our Servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, possessors of Power and Vision.
column3: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless ye the LORD.

column2: Verily We did choose them for a special (purpose)- proclaiming the Message of the Hereafter.
column3: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

column2: They were, in Our sight, truly, of the company of the Elect and the Good.
column3: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

column2: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.
column3: And the sons of Kohath by their families; Amram, and Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

column2: This is a Message (of admonition): and verily, for the righteous, is a beautiful Place of (Final) Return,-
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: Gardens of Eternity, whose doors will (ever) be open to them;
column3: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.

column2: Therein will they recline (at ease): Therein can they call (at pleasure) for fruit in abundance, and (delicious) drink;
column3: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!

column2: And beside them will be chaste women restraining their glances, (companions) of equal age.
column3: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

column2: Such is the Promise made, to you for the Day of Account!
column3: And for the wood offering, at times appointed, and for the firstfruits. Remember me, O my God, for good.

column2: Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail;-
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: Yea, such! but - for the wrong-doers will be an evil place of (Final) Return!-
column3: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

column2: Hell!- they will burn therein, - an evil bed (indeed, to lie on)!-
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: Yea, such! - then shall they taste it,- a boiling fluid, and a fluid dark, murky, intensely cold!-
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: And other Penalties of a similar kind, to match them!
column3: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

column2: Here is a troop rushing headlong with you! No welcome for them! truly, they shall burn in the Fire!
column3: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

column2: (The followers shall cry to the misleaders:) "Nay, ye (too)! No welcome for you! It is ye who have brought this upon us! Now evil is (this) place to stay in!"
column3: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.

column2: They will say: "Our Lord! whoever brought this upon us,- Add to him a double Penalty in the Fire!"
column3: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Woe to the bloody city! I will even make the pile for fire great.

column2: And they will say: "What has happened to us that we see not men whom we used to number among the bad ones?
column3: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:

column2: "Did we treat them (as such) in ridicule, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
column3: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eyes in comparison of it as nothing?

column2: Truly that is just and fitting,- the mutual recriminations of the People of the Fire!
column3: And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.

column2: Say: "Truly am I a Warner: no god is there but the one Allah, Supreme and Irresistible,-
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- Exalted in Might, able to enforce His Will, forgiving again and again."
column3: I make a decree, That in every dominion of my kingdom men tremble and fear before the God of Daniel: for he is the living God, and stedfast for ever, and his kingdom that which shall not be destroyed, and his dominion shall be even unto the end.

column2: Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all),-
column3: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

column2: "From which ye do turn away!
column3: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the LORD afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.

column2: "No knowledge have I of the Chiefs on high, when they discuss (matters) among themselves.
column3: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.

column2: Only this has been revealed to me: that I am to give warning plainly and publicly."
column3: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.

column2: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:
column3: And the LORD said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.

column2: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
column3: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.

column2: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
column3: And when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves, and worshipped.

column2: Not so Iblis: he was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith.
column3: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.

column2: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! What prevents thee from prostrating thyself to one whom I have created with my hands? Art thou haughty? Or art thou one of the high (and mighty) ones?"
column3: And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?

column2: (Iblis) said: "I am better than he: thou createdst me from fire, and him thou createdst from clay."
column3: But Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: thou art waxen fat, thou art grown thick, thou art covered with fatness; then he forsook God which made him, and lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.

column2: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here: for thou art rejected, accursed.
column3: The LORD said moreover unto me; Son of man, wilt thou judge Aholah and Aholibah? yea, declare unto them their abominations;

column2: "And My curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgment."
column3: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

column2: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
column3: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

column2: (Allah) said: "Respite then is granted thee-
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: "Till the Day of the Time Appointed."
column3: In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.

column2: (Iblis) said: "Then, by Thy power, I will put them all in the wrong,-
column3: And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:

column2: "Except Thy Servants amongst them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
column3: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

column2: (Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting- and I say what is just and fitting-
column3: The preacher sought to find out acceptable words: and that which was written was upright, even words of truth.

column2: "That I will certainly fill Hell with thee and those that follow thee,- every one."
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (Qur'an), nor am I a pretender.
column3: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:

column2: "This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.
column3: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

column2: "And ye shall certainly know the truth of it (all) after a while."
column3: The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain the time, because ye see the thing is gone from me.

column2: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Power, full of Wisdom.
column3: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

column2: Verily it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee in Truth: so serve Allah, offering Him sincere devotion.
column3: The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.

column2: Is it not to Allah that sincere devotion is due? But those who take for protectors other than Allah (say): "We only serve them in order that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Truly Allah will judge between them in that wherein they differ. But Allah guides not such as are false and ungrateful.
column3: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

column2: Had Allah wished to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whom He pleased out of those whom He doth create: but Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah, the One, the Irresistible.
column3: For he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil.

column2: He created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): He makes the Night overlap the Day, and the Day overlap the Night: He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law): Each one follows a course for a time appointed. Is not He the Exalted in Power - He Who forgives again and again?
column3: Thus saith the LORD, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is his name:

column2: He created you (all) from a single person: then created, of like nature, his mate; and he sent down for you eight head of cattle in pairs: He makes you, in the wombs of your mothers, in stages, one after another, in three veils of darkness. such is Allah, your Lord and Cherisher: to Him belongs (all) dominion. There is no god but He: then how are ye turned away (from your true Centre)?
column3: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

column2: If ye reject (Allah), Truly Allah hath no need of you; but He liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful, He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. In the end, to your Lord is your Return, when He will tell you the truth of all that ye did (in this life). for He knoweth well all that is in (men's) hearts.
column3: Thou shalt not hearken unto the words of that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams: for the LORD your God proveth you, to know whether ye love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

column2: When some trouble toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favour upon him as from Himself, (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before, and he doth set up rivals unto Allah, thus misleading others from Allah's Path. Say, "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!"
column3: For every one of the house of Israel, or of the stranger that sojourneth in Israel, which separateth himself from me, and setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to a prophet to enquire of him concerning me; I the LORD will answer him by myself:

column2: Is one who worships devoutly during the hour of the night prostrating himself or standing (in adoration), who takes heed of the Hereafter, and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord - (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal, those who know and those who do not know? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition.
column3: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.

column2: Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord, good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world. Spacious is Allah's earth! those who patiently persevere will truly receive a reward without measure!"
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: Say: "Verily, I am commanded to serve Allah with sincere devotion;
column3: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

column2: "And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in Islam."
column3: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

column2: Say: "I would, if I disobeyed my Lord, indeed have fear of the Penalty of a Mighty Day."
column3: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

column2: Say: "It is Allah I serve, with my sincere (and exclusive) devotion:
column3: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God, unto our fathers:

column2: "Serve ye what ye will besides him." Say: "Truly, those in loss are those who lose their own souls and their People on the Day of Judgment: Ah! that is indeed the (real and) evident Loss!
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: They shall have Layers of Fire above them, and Layers (of Fire) below them: with this doth Allah warn off his servants: "O My Servants! then fear ye Me!"
column3: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

column2: Those who eschew Evil,- and fall not into its worship,- and turn to Allah (in repentance),- for them is Good News: so announce the Good News to My Servants,-
column3: When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them:

column2: Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best (meaning) in it: those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones endued with understanding.
column3: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

column2: Is, then, one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due (equal to one who eschews Evil)? Wouldst thou, then, deliver one (who is) in the Fire?
column3: Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

column2: But it is for those who fear their Lord. That lofty mansions, one above another, have been built: beneath them flow rivers (of delight): (such is) the Promise of Allah: never doth Allah fail in (His) promise.
column3: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.

column2: Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and leads it through springs in the earth? Then He causes to grow, therewith, produce of various colours: then it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then He makes it dry up and crumble away. Truly, in this, is a Message of remembrance to men of understanding.
column3: Say thou, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Shall it prosper? shall he not pull up the roots thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it wither? it shall wither in all the leaves of her spring, even without great power or many people to pluck it up by the roots thereof.

column2: Is one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam, so that he has received Enlightenment from Allah, (no better than one hard-hearted)? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against celebrating the praises of Allah! they are manifestly wandering (in error)!
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: Allah has revealed (from time to time) the most beautiful Message in the form of a Book, consistent with itself, (yet) repeating (its teaching in various aspects): the skins of those who fear their Lord tremble thereat; then their skins and their hearts do soften to the celebration of Allah's praises. Such is the guidance of Allah: He guides therewith whom He pleases, but such as Allah leaves to stray, can have none to guide.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: Is, then, one who has to fear the brunt of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment (and receive it) on his face, (like one guarded therefrom)? It will be said to the wrong-doers: "Taste ye (the fruits of) what ye earned!"
column3: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

column2: Those before them (also) rejected (revelation), and so the Punishment came to them from directions they did not perceive.
column3: And this thing became a sin: for the people went to worship before the one, even unto Dan.

column2: So Allah gave them a taste of humiliation in the present life, but greater is the punishment of the Hereafter, if they only knew!
column3: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we are not cleansed until this day, although there was a plague in the congregation of the LORD,

column2: We have put forth for men, in this Qur'an every kind of Parable, in order that they may receive admonition.
column3: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,

column2: (It is) a Qur'an in Arabic, without any crookedness (therein): in order that they may guard against Evil.
column3: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

column2: Allah puts forth a Parable a man belonging to many partners at variance with each other, and a man belonging entirely to one master: are those two equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! but most of them have no knowledge.
column3: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.

column2: Truly thou wilt die (one day), and truly they (too) will die (one day).
column3: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

column2: In the end will ye (all), on the Day of Judgment, settle your disputes in the presence of your Lord.
column3: Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubilee to sound on the tenth day of the seventh month, in the day of atonement shall ye make the trumpet sound throughout all your land.

column2: Who, then, doth more wrong than one who utters a lie concerning Allah, and rejects the Truth when it comes to him; is there not in Hell an abode for blasphemers?
column3: Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? he retaineth not his anger for ever, because he delighteth in mercy.

column2: And he who brings the Truth and he who confirms (and supports) it - such are the men who do right.
column3: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

column2: They shall have all that they wish for, in the presence of their Lord: such is the reward of those who do good:
column3: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

column2: So that Allah will turn off from them (even) the worst in their deeds and give them their reward according to the best of what they have done.
column3: Seeing it is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

column2: Is not Allah enough for his Servant? But they try to frighten thee with other (gods) besides Him! for such as Allah leaves to stray, there can be no guide.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: And such as Allah doth guide there can be none to lead astray. Is not Allah Exalted in Power, (Able to enforce His Will), Lord of Retribution?
column3: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

column2: If indeed thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth, they would be sure to say, "Allah". Say: "See ye then? the things that ye invoke besides Allah,- can they, if Allah wills some Penalty for me, remove His Penalty?- Or if He wills some Grace for me, can they keep back his Grace?" Say: "Sufficient is Allah for me! In Him trust those who put their trust."
column3: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto the LORD your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass, that whatsoever thing the LORD shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.

column2: Say: "O my People! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but soon will ye know-
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: "Who it is to whom comes a Penalty of ignominy, and on whom descends a Penalty that abides."
column3: And not as it was by one that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment was by one to condemnation, but the free gift is of many offences unto justification.

column2: Verily We have revealed the Book to thee in Truth, for (instructing) mankind. He, then, that receives guidance benefits his own soul: but he that strays injures his own soul. Nor art thou set over them to dispose of their affairs.
column3: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

column2: It is Allah that takes the souls (of men) at death; and those that die not (He takes) during their sleep: those on whom He has passed the decree of death, He keeps back (from returning to life), but the rest He sends (to their bodies) for a term appointed verily in this are Signs for those who reflect.
column3: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

column2: What! Do they take for intercessors others besides Allah? Say: "Even if they have no power whatever and no intelligence?"
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: Say: "To Allah belongs exclusively (the right to grant) intercession: to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: In the End, it is to Him that ye shall be brought back."
column3: And the kingdom and dominion, and the greatness of the kingdom under the whole heaven, shall be given to the people of the saints of the most High, whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.

column2: When Allah, the One and Only, is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust and horror; but when (gods) other than He are mentioned, behold, they are filled with joy!
column3: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:

column2: Say: "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is hidden and open! it is Thou that wilt judge between Thy Servants in those matters about which they have differed."
column3: And said, O LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and showest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:

column2: Even if the wrong-doers had all that there is on earth, and as much more, (in vain) would they offer it for ransom from the pain of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment: but something will confront them from Allah, which they could never have counted upon!
column3: Then said they, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him? They answered, Five golden emerods, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines: for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.

column2: For the evils of their Deeds will confront them, and they will be (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!
column3: The merchants of these things, which were made rich by her, shall stand afar off for the fear of her torment, weeping and wailing,

column2: Now, when trouble touches man, he cries to Us: But when We bestow a favour upon him as from Ourselves, he says, "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" Nay, but this is but a trial, but most of them understand not!
column3: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

column2: Thus did the (generations) before them say! But all that they did was of no profit to them.
column3: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:

column2: Nay, the evil results of their Deeds overtook them. And the wrong-doers of this (generation)- the evil results of their Deeds will soon overtake them (too), and they will never be able to frustrate (Our Plan)!
column3: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

column2: Know they not that Allah enlarges the provision or restricts it, for any He pleases? Verily, in this are Signs for those who believe!
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Say: "O my Servants who have transgressed against their souls! Despair not of the Mercy of Allah: for Allah forgives all sins: for He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

column2: "Turn ye to our Lord (in repentance) and bow to His (Will), before the Penalty comes on you: after that ye shall not be helped.
column3: But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

column2: "And follow the best of (the courses) revealed to you from your Lord, before the Penalty comes on you - of a sudden while ye perceive not!-
column3: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;

column2: "Lest the soul should (then) say: 'Ah! Woe is me!- In that I neglected (my duty) towards Allah, and was but among those who mocked!'-
column3: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

column2: "Or (lest) it should say: 'If only Allah had guided me, I should certainly have been among the righteous!'-
column3: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.

column2: "Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the penalty: 'If only I had another chance, I should certainly be among those who do good!'
column3: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant's sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:

column2: "(The reply will be:) 'Nay, but there came to thee my Signs, and thou didst reject them: thou wast Haughty, and became one of those who reject faith!'"
column3: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

column2: On the Day of Judgment wilt thou see those who told lies against Allah;- their faces will be turned black; Is there not in Hell an abode for the Haughty?
column3: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the LORD's vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.

column2: But Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation: no evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.
column3: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.

column2: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Guardian and Disposer of all affairs.
column3: For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

column2: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: and those who reject the Signs of Allah,- it is they who will be in loss.
column3: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column2: Say: "Is it some one other than Allah that ye order me to worship, O ye ignorant ones?"
column3: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

column2: But it has already been revealed to thee,- as it was to those before thee,- "If thou wert to join (gods with Allah), truly fruitless will be thy work (in life), and thou wilt surely be in the ranks of those who lose (all spiritual good)".
column3: And it shall be, if thou do at all forget the LORD thy God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify against you this day that ye shall surely perish.

column2: Nay, but worship Allah, and be of those who give thanks.
column3: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous: for praise is comely for the upright.

column2: No just estimate have they made of Allah, such as is due to Him: On the Day of Judgment the whole of the earth will be but His handful, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: Glory to Him! High is He above the Partners they attribute to Him!
column3: The adversaries of the LORD shall be broken to pieces; out of heaven shall he thunder upon them: the LORD shall judge the ends of the earth; and he shall give strength unto his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed.

column2: The Trumpet will (just) be sounded, when all that are in the heavens and on earth will swoon, except such as it will please Allah (to exempt). Then will a second one be sounded, when, behold, they will be standing and looking on!
column3: And when the king's decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his empire, (for it is great,) all the wives shall give to their husbands honour, both to great and small.

column2: And the Earth will shine with the Glory of its Lord: the Record (of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward and a just decision pronounced between them; and they will not be wronged (in the least).
column3: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

column2: And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its Deeds; and (Allah) knoweth best all that they do.
column3: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.

column2: The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowd: until, when they arrive, there, its gates will be opened. And its keepers will say, "Did not messengers come to you from among yourselves, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord, and warning you of the Meeting of This Day of yours?" The answer will be: "True: but the Decree of Punishment has been proved true against the Unbelievers!"
column3: And, behold, God himself is with us for our captain, and his priests with sounding trumpets to cry alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against the LORD God of your fathers; for ye shall not prosper.

column2: (To them) will be said: "Enter ye the gates of Hell, to dwell therein: and evil is (this) Abode of the Arrogant!"
column3: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

column2: And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Garden in crowds: until behold, they arrive there; its gates will be opened; and its keepers will say: "Peace be upon you! well have ye done! enter ye here, to dwell therein."
column3: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.

column2: They will say: "Praise be to Allah, Who has truly fulfilled His Promise to us, and has given us (this) land in heritage: We can dwell in the Garden as we will: how excellent a reward for those who work (righteousness)!"
column3: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

column2: And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the Throne (Divine) on all sides, singing Glory and Praise to their Lord. The Decision between them (at Judgment) will be in (perfect) justice, and the cry (on all sides) will be, "Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!"
column3: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

column2: Ha Mim
column3: Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

column2: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, Exalted in Power, Full of Knowledge,-
column3: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

column2: Who forgiveth sin, accepteth repentance, is strict in punishment, and hath a long reach (in all things). there is no god but He: to Him is the final goal.
column3: Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? he retaineth not his anger for ever, because he delighteth in mercy.

column2: None can dispute about the Signs of Allah but the Unbelievers. Let not, then, their strutting about through the land deceive thee!
column3: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.

column2: But (there were people) before them, who denied (the Signs),- the People of Noah, and the Confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet, to seize him, and disputed by means of vanities, therewith to condemn the Truth; but it was I that seized them! and how (terrible) was My Requital!
column3: And they rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified against them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the heathen that were round about them, concerning whom the LORD had charged them, that they should not do like them.

column2: Thus was the Decree of thy Lord proved true against the Unbelievers; that truly they are Companions of the Fire!
column3: And the burden of the LORD shall ye mention no more: for every man's word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of the LORD of hosts our God.

column2: Those who sustain the Throne (of Allah) and those around it Sing Glory and Praise to their Lord; believe in Him; and implore Forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord! Thy Reach is over all things, in Mercy and Knowledge. Forgive, then, those who turn in Repentance, and follow Thy Path; and preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire!
column3: O LORD, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.

column2: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.
column3: Thus saith the LORD, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;

column2: "And preserve them from (all) ills; and any whom Thou dost preserve from ills that Day,- on them wilt Thou have bestowed Mercy indeed: and that will be truly (for them) the highest Achievement".
column3: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

column2: The Unbelievers will be addressed: "Greater was the aversion of Allah to you than (is) your aversion to yourselves, seeing that ye were called to the Faith and ye used to refuse."
column3: To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

column2: They will say: "Our Lord! twice hast Thou made us without life, and twice hast Thou given us Life! Now have we recognised our sins: Is there any way out (of this)?"
column3: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?

column2: (The answer will be:) "This is because, when Allah was invoked as the Only (object of worship), ye did reject Faith, but when partners were joined to Him, ye believed! the Command is with Allah, Most High, Most Great!"
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: He it is Who showeth you his Signs, and sendeth down sustenance for you from the sky: but only those receive admonition who turn (to Allah).
column3: It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.

column2: Call ye, then, upon Allah with sincere devotion to Him, even though the Unbelievers may detest it.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Raised high above ranks (or degrees), (He is) the Lord of the Throne (of Authority): by His Command doth He send the Spirit (of inspiration) to any of His servants he pleases, that it may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting,-
column3: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

column2: The Day whereon they will (all) come forth: not a single thing concerning them is hidden from Allah. Whose will be the dominion that Day?" That of Allah, the One the Irresistible!
column3: For who hath despised the day of small things? for they shall rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those seven; they are the eyes of the LORD, which run to and fro through the whole earth.

column2: That Day will every soul be requited for what it earned; no injustice will there be that Day, for Allah is Swift in taking account.
column3: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

column2: Warn them of the Day that is (ever) drawing near, when the hearts will (come) right up to the throats to choke (them); No intimate friend nor intercessor will the wrong-doers have, who could be listened to.
column3: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

column2: (Allah) knows of (the tricks) that deceive with the eyes, and all that the hearts (of men) conceal.
column3: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies? yea, they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart;

column2: And Allah will judge with (justice and) Truth: but those whom (men) invoke besides Him, will not (be in a position) to judge at all. Verily it is Allah (alone) Who hears and sees (all things).
column3: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

column2: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were even superior to them in strength, and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but Allah did call them to account for their sins, and none had they to defend them against Allah.
column3: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of mine offerings, and eat it; but the LORD accepteth them not; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins: they shall return to Egypt.

column2: That was because there came to them their messengers with Clear (Signs), but they rejected them: So Allah called them to account: for He is Full of Strength, Strict in Punishment.
column3: Men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

column2: Of old We sent Moses, with Our Signs and an authority manifest,
column3: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

column2: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...
column3: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.

column2: Now, when he came to them in Truth, from Us, they said, "Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and keep alive their females," but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and delusions)!...
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion, or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!"
column3: And David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for we shall not else escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtake us suddenly, and bring evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.

column2: Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"
column3: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.

column2: A believer, a man from among the people of Pharaoh, who had concealed his faith, said: "Will ye slay a man because he says, 'My Lord is Allah'?- when he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? and if he be a liar, on him is (the sin of) his lie: but, if he is telling the Truth, then will fall on you something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: Truly Allah guides not one who transgresses and lies!
column3: For every one of the house of Israel, or of the stranger that sojourneth in Israel, which separateth himself from me, and setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to a prophet to enquire of him concerning me; I the LORD will answer him by myself:

column2: "O my People! Yours is the dominion this day: Ye have the upper hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of Allah, should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you that which I see (myself); Nor do I guide you but to the Path of Right!"
column3: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the habitation of the strong: but I will make them suddenly run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?

column2: Then said the man who believed: "O my people! Truly I do fear for you something like the Day (of disaster) of the Confederates (in sin)!-
column3: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God, unto our fathers:

column2: "Something like the fate of the People of Noah, the 'Ad, and the Thamud, and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes injustice to his Servants.
column3: The twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:

column2: "And O my people! I fear for you a Day when there will be Mutual calling (and wailing),-
column3: And the inhabitant of this isle shall say in that day, Behold, such is our expectation, whither we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria: and how shall we escape?

column2: "A Day when ye shall turn your backs and flee: No defender shall ye have from Allah: Any whom Allah leaves to stray, there is none to guide...
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: "And to you there came Joseph in times gone by, with Clear Signs, but ye ceased not to doubt of the (Mission) for which he had come: At length, when he died, ye said: 'No messenger will Allah send after him.' thus doth Allah leave to stray such as transgress and live in doubt,-
column3: When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel's sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?

column2: "(Such) as dispute about the Signs of Allah, without any authority that hath reached them, grievous and odious (is such conduct) in the sight of Allah and of the Believers. Thus doth Allah, seal up every heart - of arrogant and obstinate Transgressors."
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: Pharaoh said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty palace, that I may attain the ways and means-
column3: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.

column2: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).
column3: And said, If it please the king, and if I have favour in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I be pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews which are in all the king's provinces:

column2: The man who believed said further: "O my people! Follow me: I will lead you to the Path of Right.
column3: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:

column2: "O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary) convenience: It is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.
column3: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

column2: "He that works evil will not be requited but by the like thereof: and he that works a righteous deed - whether man or woman - and is a Believer- such will enter the Garden (of Bliss): Therein will they have abundance without measure.
column3: Notwithstanding no devoted thing, that a man shall devote unto the LORD of all that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy unto the LORD.

column2: "And O my people! How (strange) it is for me to call you to Salvation while ye call me to the Fire!
column3: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because ye are all become dross, behold, therefore I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.

column2: "Ye do call upon me to blaspheme against Allah, and to join with Him partners of whom I have no knowledge; and I call you to the Exalted in Power, Who forgives again and again!"
column3: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:

column2: "Without doubt ye do call me to one who is not fit to be called to, whether in this world, or in the Hereafter; our return will be to Allah; and the Transgressors will be Companions of the Fire!
column3: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

column2: "Soon will ye remember what I say to you (now), My (own) affair I commit to Allah: for Allah (ever) watches over His Servants."
column3: And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the LORD which sanctify you.

column2: Then Allah saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against him), but the burnt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the People of Pharaoh.
column3: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.

column2: In front of the Fire will they be brought, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"
column3: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

column2: Behold, they will dispute with each other in the Fire! The weak ones (who followed) will say to those who had been arrogant, "We but followed you: Can ye then take (on yourselves) from us some share of the Fire?
column3: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

column2: Those who had been arrogant will say: "We are all in this (Fire)! Truly, Allah has judged between (his) Servants!"
column3: The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.

column2: Those in the Fire will say to the Keepers of Hell: "Pray to your Lord to lighten us the Penalty for a day (at least)!"
