column3: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

column2: On the earth are signs for those of assured Faith,
column3: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

column2: As also in your own selves: Will ye not then see?
column3: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publicans so?

column2: And in heaven is your Sustenance, as (also) that which ye are promised.
column3: And this oblation of the land that is offered shall be unto them a thing most holy by the border of the Levites.

column2: Then, by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.
column3: Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.

column2: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?
column3: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

column2: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."
column3: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?

column2: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,
column3: The rich man had exceeding many flocks and herds:

column2: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"
column3: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

column2: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.
column3: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.

column2: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"
column3: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

column2: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."
column3: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

column2: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"
column3: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

column2: They said, "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin;-
column3: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.

column2: "To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone),
column3: And he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:

column2: "Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there,
column3: So stood the two companies of them that gave thanks in the house of God, and I, and the half of the rulers with me:

column2: But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one house:
column3: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

column2: And We left there a Sign for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

column2: And in the 'Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:

column2: And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.

column2: But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.

column2: I have only created Jinns and men, that they may serve Me.

column2: For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).
column3: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: Woe, then, to the Unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised!

column3: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

column2: Round about them will serve, (devoted) to them, young male servants (handsome) as Pearls well-guarded.
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column3: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

column2: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
column3: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

column2: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
column3: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

column2: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

column2: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
column3: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

column2: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
column3: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

column2: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
column3: Daniel spake and said, I saw in my vision by night, and, behold, the four winds of the heaven strove upon the great sea.

column2: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
column3: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

column2: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
column3: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

column2: But We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.
column3: And Israel set liers in wait round about Gibeah.

column2: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
column3: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into a land which they know not?

column2: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
column3: I speak to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you? no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brethren?

column2: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!
column3: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and robbery; the prey departeth not;

column2: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
column3: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.

column2: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one's right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
column3: Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.

column2: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).
column3: And Abimelech rose up, and all the people that were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.

column2: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
column3: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

column2: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
column3: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

column2: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
column3: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.

column2: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
column3: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name.

column2: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.
column3: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.

column2: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
column3: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turned to his course, as the horse rusheth into the battle.

column2: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
column3: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

column2: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
column3: I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

column2: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).
column3: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

column2: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.
column3: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

column2: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
column3: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

column2: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
column3: Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

column2: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
column3: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.

column2: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.
column3: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

column2: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
column3: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

column2: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
column3: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

column2: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
column3: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

column2: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.
column3: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

column2: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?
column3: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column2: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
column3: This is the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.

column2: Every matter, small and great, is on record.
column3: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

column2: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
column3: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

column2: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.
column3: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

column2: (Allah) Most Gracious!
column3: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

column2: It is He Who has taught the Qur'an.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: He has created man:
column3: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it.

column2: He has taught him speech (and intelligence).
column3: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

column2: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
column3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

column2: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.
column3: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

column2: And the Firmament has He raised high, and He has set up the Balance (of Justice),
column3: And judgment is turned away backward, and justice standeth afar off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equity cannot enter.

column2: In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
column3: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.

column2: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:
column3: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: Therein is fruit and date-palms, producing spathes (enclosing dates);
column3: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

column2: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants.
column3: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,
column3: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

column2: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: (He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:
column3: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: He has let free the two bodies of flowing water, meeting together:
column3: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

column2: Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:
column3: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
column3: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas, lofty as mountains:
column3: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: All that is on earth will perish:
column3: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

column2: But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord,- full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
column3: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Soon shall We settle your affairs, O both ye worlds!
column3: Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!
column3: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:
column3: The field is wasted, the land mourneth; for the corn is wasted: the new wine is dried up, the oil languisheth.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
column3: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: (For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
column3: And the righteous men, they shall judge them after the manner of adulteresses, and after the manner of women that shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:
column3: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

column2: In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!
column3: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens-
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-
column3: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);
column3: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
column3: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).
column3: And the curious girdle of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; even of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
column3: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Like unto Rubies and coral.
column3: And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?
column3: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: And besides these two, there are two other Gardens,-
column3: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Dark-green in colour (from plentiful watering).
column3: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:
column3: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them will be Fruits, and dates and pomegranates:
column3: A land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of oil olive, and honey;

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: In them will be fair (Companions), good, beautiful;-
column3: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
column3: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

column2: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
column3: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

column2: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
column3: Saying, Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

column2: When the Event inevitable cometh to pass,
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
column3: What do ye imagine against the LORD? he will make an utter end: affliction shall not rise up the second time.

column2: (Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;
column3: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

column2: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths,
column3: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

column2: And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms,
column3: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.

column2: Becoming dust scattered abroad,
column3: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

column2: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.
column3: And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

column2: Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
column3: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast: and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who is like unto the beast? who is able to make war with him?

column2: And the Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
column3: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

column2: And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).
column3: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

column2: These will be those Nearest to Allah:
column3: The families of the sons of Kohath shall pitch on the side of the tabernacle southward.

column2: In Gardens of Bliss:
column3: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column2: A number of people from those of old,
column3: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

column2: And a few from those of later times.
column3: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

column2: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),
column3: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.

column2: Reclining on them, facing each other.
column3: Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of an hill afar off; a great space being between them:

column2: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:
column3: And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:

column2: No after-ache will they receive therefrom, nor will they suffer intoxication:
column3: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

column2: And with fruits, any that they may select:
column3: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column2: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.
column3: The priests shall not eat of any thing that is dead of itself, or torn, whether it be fowl or beast.

column2: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-
column3: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

column2: Like unto Pearls well-guarded.
column3: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

column2: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
column3: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

column2: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-
column3: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

column2: Only the saying, "Peace! Peace".
column3: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

column2: The Companions of the Right Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
column3: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

column2: (They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns,
column3: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.

column2: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-
column3: Joseph is a fruitful bough, even a fruitful bough by a well; whose branches run over the wall:

column2: In shade long-extended,
column3: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.

column2: By water flowing constantly,
column3: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

column2: And fruit in abundance.
column3: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

column2: Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden,
column3: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

column2: And on Thrones (of Dignity), raised high.
column3: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

column2: We have created (their Companions) of special creation.
column3: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

column2: And made them virgin - pure (and undefiled), -
column3: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

column2: Beloved (by nature), equal in age,-
column3: And now I have sent a cunning man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father's,

column2: For the Companions of the Right Hand.
column3: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.

column2: A (goodly) number from those of old,
column3: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

column2: And a (goodly) number from those of later times.
column3: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those that were numbered of them, threescore thousand and five hundred.

column2: The Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
column3: Your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for ever?

column2: (They will be) in the midst of a Fierce Blast of Fire and in Boiling Water,
column3: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of mountains shall they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as a strong people set in battle array.

column2: And in the shades of Black Smoke:
column3: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

column2: Nothing (will there be) to refresh, nor to please:
column3: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

column2: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),
column3: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness.

column2: And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!
column3: Concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.

column2: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-
column3: And they shall pass through it, hardly bestead and hungry: and it shall come to pass, that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

column2: "(We) and our fathers of old?"
column3: Your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for ever?

column2: Say: "Yea, those of old and those of later times,
column3: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

column2: "All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a Day well-known.
column3: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished and prepared: there make ready for us.

column2: "Then will ye truly,- O ye that go wrong, and treat (Truth) as Falsehood!-
column3: And ye have done worse than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the imagination of his evil heart, that they may not hearken unto me:

column2: "Ye will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum.
column3: And ye shall point out your east border from Hazarenan to Shepham:

column2: "Then will ye fill your insides therewith,
column3: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

column2: "And drink Boiling Water on top of it:
column3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

column2: "Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"
column3: Their drink is sour: they have committed whoredom continually: her rulers with shame do love, Give ye.

column2: Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital!
column3: In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.

column2: It is We Who have created you: why will ye not witness the Truth?
column3: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

column2: Do ye then see?- The (human Seed) that ye throw out,-
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: Is it ye who create it, or are We the Creators?
column3: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

column2: We have decreed Death to be your common lot, and We are not to be frustrated
column3: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

column2: from changing your Forms and creating you (again) in (forms) that ye know not.
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: And ye certainly know already the first form of creation: why then do ye not celebrate His praises?
column3: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

column2: See ye the seed that ye sow in the ground?
column3: Ye eat the fat, and ye clothe you with the wool, ye kill them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock.

column2: Is it ye that cause it to grow, or are We the Cause?
column3: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

column2: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and ye would be left in wonderment,
column3: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of bounty, and not as of covetousness.

column2: (Saying), "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):
column3: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, that eat, asking no question for conscience sake:

column2: "Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: See ye the water which ye drink?
column3: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

column2: Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?
column3: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

column2: Were it Our Will, We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?
column3: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publicans so?

column2: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?
column3: And ye have not kept the charge of mine holy things: but ye have set keepers of my charge in my sanctuary for yourselves.

column2: Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it?
column3: Shall horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:

column2: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme!
column3: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

column2: Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars,-
column3: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

column2: And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew,-
column3: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

column2: That this is indeed a qur'an Most Honourable,
column3: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

column2: In Book well-guarded,
column3: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column2: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:
column3: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

column2: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
column3: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

column2: Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?
column3: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

column2: And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?
column3: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man's blood upon us.

column2: Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat,-
column3: Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,

column2: And ye the while (sit) looking on,-
column3: And sitting down they watched him there;

column2: But We are nearer to him than ye, and yet see not,-
column3: That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:

column2: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to Allah,
column3: That prepareth his heart to seek God, the LORD God of his fathers, though he be not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.

column2: (There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction, and a Garden of Delights.
column3: Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

column2: And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand,
column3: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:

column2: (For him is the salutation), "Peace be unto thee", from the Companions of the Right Hand.
column3: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it.

column2: And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood, who go wrong,
column3: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

column2: For him is Entertainment with Boiling Water.
column3: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

column2: And burning in Hell-Fire.
column3: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

column2: Verily, this is the Very Truth and Certainly.
column3: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

column2: So celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme.
column3: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

column2: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth,- let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
column3: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

column2: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.
column3: For thus saith the LORD that created the heavens; God himself that formed the earth and made it; he hath established it, he created it not in vain, he formed it to be inhabited: I am the LORD; and there is none else.

column2: He is the First and the Last, the Evident and the Immanent: and He has full knowledge of all things.
column3: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.

column2: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days, and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.
column3: And I heard the man clothed in linen, which was upon the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a time, times, and an half; and when he shall have accomplished to scatter the power of the holy people, all these things shall be finished.

column2: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: and all affairs are referred back to Allah.
column3: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

column2: He merges Night into Day, and He merges Day into Night; and He has full knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.
column3: And he changeth the times and the seasons: he removeth kings, and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom unto the wise, and knowledge to them that know understanding:

column2: Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend (in charity) out of the (substance) whereof He has made you heirs. For, those of you who believe and spend (in charity),- for them is a great Reward.
column3: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness, and the work of faith with power:

column2: What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your Covenant, if ye are men of Faith.
column3: And a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.

column2: He is the One Who sends to His Servant Manifest Signs, that He may lead you from the depths of Darkness into the Light and verily Allah is to you most kind and Merciful.
column3: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

column2: And what cause have ye why ye should not spend in the cause of Allah?- For to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought, before the Victory, (with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought afterwards. But to all has Allah promised a goodly (reward). And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.
column3: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall inherit them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness, from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

column2: Who is he that will Loan to Allah a beautiful loan? for (Allah) will increase it manifold to his credit, and he will have (besides) a liberal Reward.
column3: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

column2: One Day shalt thou see the believing men and the believing women- how their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens beneath which flow rivers! to dwell therein for aye! This is indeed the highest Achievement!"
column3: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

column2: One Day will the Hypocrites- men and women - say to the Believers: "Wait for us! Let us borrow (a Light) from your Light!" It will be said: "Turn ye back to your rear! then seek a Light (where ye can)!" So a wall will be put up betwixt them, with a gate therein. Within it will be Mercy throughout, and without it, all alongside, will be (Wrath and) Punishment!
column3: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

column2: (Those without) will call out, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! but ye led yourselves into temptation; ye looked forward (to our ruin); ye doubted (Allah's Promise); and (your false) desires deceived you; until there issued the Command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you in respect of Allah.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: "This Day shall no ransom be accepted of you, nor of those who rejected Allah." Your abode is the Fire: that is the proper place to claim you: and an evil refuge it is!"
column3: Arise ye, and depart; for this is not your rest: because it is polluted, it shall destroy you, even with a sore destruction.

column2: Has not the Time arrived for the Believers that their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been revealed (to them), and that they should not become like those to whom was given Revelation aforetime, but long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard? For many among them are rebellious transgressors.
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: Know ye (all) that Allah giveth life to the earth after its death! already have We shown the Signs plainly to you, that ye may learn wisdom.
column3: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.

column2: For those who give in Charity, men and women, and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan, it shall be increased manifold (to their credit), and they shall have (besides) a liberal reward.
column3: If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

column2: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers- they are the Sincere (lovers of Truth), and the witnesses (who testify), in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their Reward and their Light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs,- they are the Companions of Hell-Fire.
column3: O LORD, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.

column2: Know ye (all), that the life of this world is but play and amusement, pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similitude: How rain and the growth which it brings forth, delight (the hearts of) the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then it becomes dry and crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong). And Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah). And what is the life of this world, but goods and chattels of deception?
column3: And joy and gladness is taken from the plentiful field, and from the land of Moab, and I have caused wine to fail from the winepresses: none shall tread with shouting; their shouting shall be no shouting.

column2: Be ye foremost (in seeking) Forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden (of Bliss), the width whereof is as the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers: that is the Grace of Allah, which He bestows on whom he pleases: and Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls but is recorded in a decree before We bring it into existence: That is truly easy for Allah:
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: In order that ye may not despair over matters that pass you by, nor exult over favours bestowed upon you. For Allah loveth not any vainglorious boaster,-
column3: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

column2: Such persons as are covetous and commend covetousness to men. And if any turn back (from Allah's Way), verily Allah is Free of all Needs, Worthy of all Praise.
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: We sent aforetime our messengers with Clear Signs and sent down with them the Book and the Balance (of Right and Wrong), that men may stand forth in justice; and We sent down Iron, in which is (material for) mighty war, as well as many benefits for mankind, that Allah may test who it is that will help, Unseen, Him and His messengers: For Allah is Full of Strength, Exalted in Might (and able to enforce His Will).
column3: Forasmuch as an excellent spirit, and knowledge, and understanding, interpreting of dreams, and shewing of hard sentences, and dissolving of doubts, were found in the same Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar: now let Daniel be called, and he will shew the interpretation.

column2: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.
column3: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

column2: Then, in their wake, We followed them up with (others of) Our messengers: We sent after them Jesus the son of Mary, and bestowed on him the Gospel; and We ordained in the hearts of those who followed him Compassion and Mercy. But the Monasticism which they invented for themselves, We did not prescribe for them: (We commanded) only the seeking for the Good Pleasure of Allah; but that they did not foster as they should have done. Yet We bestowed, on those among them who believed, their (due) reward, but many of them are rebellious transgressors.
column3: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

column2: O ye that believe! Fear Allah, and believe in His Messenger, and He will bestow on you a double portion of His Mercy: He will provide for you a Light by which ye shall walk (straight in your path), and He will forgive you (your past): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the LORD your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.

column2: That the People of the Book may know that they have no power whatever over the Grace of Allah, that (His) Grace is (entirely) in His Hand, to bestow it on whomsoever He wills. For Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: Allah has indeed heard (and accepted) the statement of the woman who pleads with thee concerning her husband and carries her complaint (in prayer) to Allah: and Allah (always) hears the arguments between both sides among you: for Allah hears and sees (all things).
column3: It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.

column2: If any men among you divorce their wives by Zihar (calling them mothers), they cannot be their mothers: None can be their mothers except those who gave them birth. And in fact they use words (both) iniquitous and false: but truly Allah is one that blots out (sins), and forgives (again and again).
column3: Because they met not the children of Israel with bread and with water, but hired Balaam against them, that he should curse them: howbeit our God turned the curse into a blessing.

column2: But those who divorce their wives by Zihar, then wish to go back on the words they uttered,- (It is ordained that such a one) should free a slave before they touch each other: Thus are ye admonished to perform: and Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: And if any has not (the wherewithal), he should fast for two months consecutively before they touch each other. But if any is unable to do so, he should feed sixty indigent ones, this, that ye may show your faith in Allah and His Messenger. Those are limits (set by) Allah. For those who reject (Him), there is a grievous Penalty.
column3: If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the LORD for a sin offering.

column2: Those who resist Allah and His Messenger will be humbled to dust, as were those before them: for We have already sent down Clear Signs. And the Unbelievers (will have) a humiliating Penalty,-
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: On the Day that Allah will raise them all up (again) and show them the Truth (and meaning) of their conduct. Allah has reckoned its (value), though they may have forgotten it, for Allah is Witness to all things.
column3: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

column2: Seest thou not that Allah doth know (all) that is in the heavens and on earth? There is not a secret consultation between three, but He makes the fourth among them, - Nor between five but He makes the sixth,- nor between fewer nor more, but He is in their midst, wheresoever they be: In the end will He tell them the truth of their conduct, on the Day of Judgment. For Allah has full knowledge of all things.
column3: And all the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing: and he doeth according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand, or say unto him, What doest thou?

column2: Turnest thou not thy sight towards those who were forbidden secret counsels yet revert to that which they were forbidden (to do)? And they hold secret counsels among themselves for iniquity and hostility, and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to thee, they salute thee, not as Allah salutes thee, (but in crooked ways): And they say to themselves, "Why does not Allah punish us for our words?" Enough for them is Hell: In it will they burn, and evil is that destination!
column3: When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;

column2: O ye who believe! When ye hold secret counsel, do it not for iniquity and hostility, and disobedience to the Prophet; but do it for righteousness and self-restraint; and fear Allah, to Whom ye shall be brought back.
column3: Wherefore now let the fear of the LORD be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with the LORD our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of gifts.

column2: Secret counsels are only (inspired) by the Evil One, in order that he may cause grief to the Believers; but he cannot harm them in the least, except as Allah permits; and on Allah let the Believers put their trust.
column3: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

column2: O ye who believe! When ye are told to make room in the assemblies, (spread out and) make room: (ample) room will Allah provide for you. And when ye are told to rise up, rise up Allah will rise up, to (suitable) ranks (and degrees), those of you who believe and who have been granted (mystic) Knowledge. And Allah is well-acquainted with all ye do.
column3: Ye shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of the LORD with you, O Judah and Jerusalem: fear not, nor be dismayed; to morrow go out against them: for the LORD will be with you.

column2: O ye who believe! When ye consult the Messenger in private, spend something in charity before your private consultation. That will be best for you, and most conducive to purity (of conduct). But if ye find not (the wherewithal), Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Wherefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable unto thee, and break off thy sins by righteousness, and thine iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of thy tranquillity.

column2: Is it that ye are afraid of spending sums in charity before your private consultation (with him)? If, then, ye do not so, and Allah forgives you, then (at least) establish regular prayer; practise regular charity; and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is well-acquainted with all that ye do.
column3: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

column2: Turnest thou not thy attention to those who turn (in friendship) to such as have the Wrath of Allah upon them? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to falsehood knowingly.
column3: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

column2: Allah has prepared for them a severe Penalty: evil indeed are their deeds.
column3: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

column2: They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: therefore shall they have a humiliating Penalty.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: Of no profit whatever to them, against Allah, will be their riches nor their sons: they will be Companions of the Fire, to dwell therein (for aye)!
column3: They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the LORD.

column2: One day will Allah raise them all up (for Judgment): then will they swear to Him as they swear to you: And they think that they have something (to stand upon). No, indeed! they are but liars!
column3: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.

column2: The Evil One has got the better of them: so he has made them lose the remembrance of Allah. They are the Party of the Evil One. Truly, it is the Party of the Evil One that will perish!
column3: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

column2: Those who resist Allah and His Messenger will be among those most humiliated.
column3: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

column2: Allah has decreed: "It is I and My messengers who must prevail": For Allah is One full of strength, able to enforce His Will.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: Thou wilt not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day, loving those who resist Allah and His Messenger, even though they were their fathers or their sons, or their brothers, or their kindred. For such He has written Faith in their hearts, and strengthened them with a spirit from Himself. And He will admit them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein (for ever). Allah will be well pleased with them, and they with Him. They are the Party of Allah. Truly it is the Party of Allah that will achieve Felicity.
column3: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.

column2: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
column3: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

column2: It is He Who got out the Unbelievers among the People of the Book from their homes at the first gathering (of the forces). Little did ye think that they would get out: And they thought that their fortresses would defend them from Allah! But the (Wrath of) Allah came to them from quarters from which they little expected (it), and cast terror into their hearts, so that they destroyed their dwellings by their own hands and the hands of the Believers, take warning, then, O ye with eyes (to see)!
column3: For the LORD shall smite Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water, and he shall root up Israel out of this good land, which he gave to their fathers, and shall scatter them beyond the river, because they have made their groves, provoking the LORD to anger.

column2: And had it not been that Allah had decreed banishment for them, He would certainly have punished them in this world: And in the Hereafter they shall (certainly) have the Punishment of the Fire.
column3: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

column2: That is because they resisted Allah and His Messenger: and if any one resists Allah, verily Allah is severe in Punishment.
column3: Thus did Zimri destroy all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake against Baasha by Jehu the prophet.

column2: Whether ye cut down (O ye Muslim!) The tender palm-trees, or ye left them standing on their roots, it was by leave of Allah, and in order that He might cover with shame the rebellious transgresses.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: What Allah has bestowed on His Messenger (and taken away) from them - for this ye made no expedition with either cavalry or camelry: but Allah gives power to His messengers over any He pleases: and Allah has power over all things.
column3: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

column2: What Allah has bestowed on His Messenger (and taken away) from the people of the townships,- belongs to Allah,- to His Messenger and to kindred and orphans, the needy and the wayfarer; In order that it may not (merely) make a circuit between the wealthy among you. So take what the Messenger assigns to you, and deny yourselves that which he withholds from you. And fear Allah; for Allah is strict in Punishment.
column3: For God giveth to a man that is good in his sight wisdom, and knowledge, and joy: but to the sinner he giveth travail, to gather and to heap up, that he may give to him that is good before God. This also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

column2: (Some part is due) to the indigent Muhajirs, those who were expelled from their homes and their property, while seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure, and aiding Allah and His Messenger: such are indeed the sincere ones:-
column3: His prayer also, and how God was intreated of him, and all his sins, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.

column2: But those who before them, had homes (in Medina) and had adopted the Faith,- show their affection to such as came to them for refuge, and entertain no desire in their hearts for things given to the (latter), but give them preference over themselves, even though poverty was their (own lot). And those saved from the covetousness of their own souls,- they are the ones that achieve prosperity.
column3: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

column2: And those who came after them say: "Our Lord! Forgive us, and our brethren who came before us into the Faith, and leave not, in our hearts, rancour (or sense of injury) against those who have believed. Our Lord! Thou art indeed Full of Kindness, Most Merciful."
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: Hast thou not observed the Hypocrites say to their misbelieving brethren among the People of the Book? - "If ye are expelled, we too will go out with you, and we will never hearken to any one in your affair; and if ye are attacked (in fight) we will help you". But Allah is witness that they are indeed liars.
column3: Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.

column2: If they are expelled, never will they go out with them; and if they are attacked (in fight), they will never help them; and if they do help them, they will turn their backs; so they will receive no help.
column3: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?

column2: Of a truth ye are stronger (than they) because of the terror in their hearts, (sent) by Allah. This is because they are men devoid of understanding.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: They will not fight you (even) together, except in fortified townships, or from behind walls. Strong is their fighting (spirit) amongst themselves: thou wouldst think they were united, but their hearts are divided: that is because they are a people devoid of wisdom.
column3: Yea, they are greedy dogs which can never have enough, and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way, every one for his gain, from his quarter.

column2: Like those who lately preceded them, they have tasted the evil result of their conduct; and (in the Hereafter there is) for them a grievous Penalty;-
column3: To me belongeth vengeance and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

column2: (Their allies deceived them), like the Evil One, when he says to man, "Deny Allah": but when (man) denies Allah, (the Evil One) says, "I am free of thee: I do fear Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!"
column3: And when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.

column2: The end of both will be that they will go into the Fire, dwelling therein for ever. Such is the reward of the wrong-doers.
column3: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun, that there is one event unto all: yea, also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to the dead.

column2: O ye who believe! Fear Allah, and let every soul look to what (provision) He has sent forth for the morrow. Yea, fear Allah: for Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.
column3: Seek ye the LORD, all ye meek of the earth, which have wrought his judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid in the day of the LORD's anger.

column2: And be ye not like those who forgot Allah; and He made them forget their own souls! Such are the rebellious transgressors!
column3: Cast away from you all your transgressions, whereby ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

column2: Not equal are the Companions of the Fire and the Companions of the Garden: it is the Companions of the Garden, that will achieve Felicity.
column3: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

column2: Had We sent down this Qur'an on a mountain, verily, thou wouldst have seen it humble itself and cleave asunder for fear of Allah. Such are the similitudes which We propound to men, that they may reflect.
column3: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

column2: Allah is He, than Whom there is no other god;- Who knows (all things) both secret and open; He, Most Gracious, Most Merciful.
column3: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

column2: Allah is He, than Whom there is no other god;- the Sovereign, the Holy One, the Source of Peace (and Perfection), the Guardian of Faith, the Preserver of Safety, the Exalted in Might, the Irresistible, the Supreme: Glory to Allah! (High is He) above the partners they attribute to Him.
column3: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

column2: He is Allah, the Creator, the Evolver, the Bestower of Forms (or Colours). To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names: whatever is in the heavens and on earth, doth declare His Praises and Glory: and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
column3: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

column2: O ye who believe! Take not my enemies and yours as friends (or protectors),- offering them (your) love, even though they have rejected the Truth that has come to you, and have (on the contrary) driven out the Prophet and yourselves (from your homes), (simply) because ye believe in Allah your Lord! If ye have come out to strive in My Way and to seek My Good Pleasure, (take them not as friends), holding secret converse of love (and friendship) with them: for I know full well all that ye conceal and all that ye reveal. And any of you that does this has strayed from the Straight Path.
column3: But if ye shall at all turn from following me, ye or your children, and will not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them:

column2: If they were to get the better of you, they would behave to you as enemies, and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you for evil: and they desire that ye should reject the Truth.
column3: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.

column2: Of no profit to you will be your relatives and your children on the Day of Judgment: He will judge between you: for Allah sees well all that ye do.
column3: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
