column2: There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people: "We are clear of you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected you, and there has arisen, between us and you, enmity and hatred for ever,- unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee, though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah." (They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust, and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal.
column3: And said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we beseech thee, our supplication be accepted before thee, and pray for us unto the LORD thy God, even for all this remnant; (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us:)

column2: "Our Lord! Make us not a (test and) trial for the Unbelievers, but forgive us, our Lord! for Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
column3: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

column2: There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow,- for those whose hope is in Allah and in the Last Day. But if any turn away, truly Allah is Free of all Wants, Worthy of all Praise.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: It may be that Allah will grant love (and friendship) between you and those whom ye (now) hold as enemies. For Allah has power (over all things); And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

column2: Allah forbids you not, with regard to those who fight you not for (your) Faith nor drive you out of your homes, from dealing kindly and justly with them: for Allah loveth those who are just.
column3: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

column2: Allah only forbids you, with regard to those who fight you for (your) Faith, and drive you out of your homes, and support (others) in driving you out, from turning to them (for friendship and protection). It is such as turn to them (in these circumstances), that do wrong.
column3: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

column2: O ye who believe! When there come to you believing women refugees, examine (and test) them: Allah knows best as to their Faith: if ye ascertain that they are Believers, then send them not back to the Unbelievers. They are not lawful (wives) for the Unbelievers, nor are the (Unbelievers) lawful (husbands) for them. But pay the Unbelievers what they have spent (on their dower), and there will be no blame on you if ye marry them on payment of their dower to them. But hold not to the guardianship of unbelieving women: ask for what ye have spent on their dowers, and let the (Unbelievers) ask for what they have spent (on the dowers of women who come over to you). Such is the command of Allah: He judges (with justice) between you. And Allah is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
column3: And it shall be, when their fathers or their brethren come unto us to complain, that we will say unto them, Be favorable unto them for our sakes: because we reserved not to each man his wife in the war: for ye did not give unto them at this time, that ye should be guilty.

column2: And if any of your wives deserts you to the Unbelievers, and ye have an accession (by the coming over of a woman from the other side), then pay to those whose wives have deserted the equivalent of what they had spent (on their dower). And fear Allah, in Whom ye believe.
column3: And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu appointed fourscore men without, and said, If any of the men whom I have brought into your hands escape, he that letteth him go, his life shall be for the life of him.

column2: O Prophet! When believing women come to thee to take the oath of fealty to thee, that they will not associate in worship any other thing whatever with Allah, that they will not steal, that they will not commit adultery (or fornication), that they will not kill their children, that they will not utter slander, intentionally forging falsehood, and that they will not disobey thee in any just matter,- then do thou receive their fealty, and pray to Allah for the forgiveness (of their sins): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Therefore shall ye keep mine ordinance, that ye commit not any one of these abominable customs, which were committed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I am the LORD your God.

column2: O ye who believe! Turn not (for friendship) to people on whom is the Wrath of Allah, of the Hereafter they are already in despair, just as the Unbelievers are in despair about those (buried) in graves.
column3: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.

column2: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
column3: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

column2: O ye who believe! Why say ye that which ye do not?
column3: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without? do not ye judge them that are within?

column2: Grievously odious is it in the sight of Allah that ye say that which ye do not.
column3: For all that do such things, and all that do unrighteously, are an abomination unto the LORD thy God.

column2: Truly Allah loves those who fight in His Cause in battle array, as if they were a solid cemented structure.
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: And remember, Moses said to his people: "O my people! why do ye vex and insult me, though ye know that I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you?" Then when they went wrong, Allah let their hearts go wrong. For Allah guides not those who are rebellious transgressors.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: And remember, Jesus, the son of Mary, said: "O Children of Israel! I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you, confirming the Law (which came) before me, and giving Glad Tidings of a Messenger to come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he came to them with Clear Signs, they said, "this is evident sorcery!"
column3: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

column2: Who doth greater wrong than one who invents falsehood against Allah, even as he is being invited to Islam? And Allah guides not those who do wrong.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Their intention is to extinguish Allah's Light (by blowing) with their mouths: But Allah will complete (the revelation of) His Light, even though the Unbelievers may detest (it).
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: It is He Who has sent His Messenger with Guidance and the Religion of Truth, that he may proclaim it over all religion, even though the Pagans may detest (it).
column3: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column2: O ye who believe! Shall I lead you to a bargain that will save you from a grievous Penalty?-
column3: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

column2: That ye believe in Allah and His Messenger, and that ye strive (your utmost) in the Cause of Allah, with your property and your persons: That will be best for you, if ye but knew!
column3: These are the things that ye shall do; Speak ye every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:

column2: He will forgive you your sins, and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, and to beautiful mansions in Gardens of Eternity: that is indeed the Supreme Achievement.
column3: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

column2: And another (favour will He bestow,) which ye do love,- help from Allah and a speedy victory. So give the Glad Tidings to the Believers.
column3: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

column2: O ye who believe! Be ye helpers of Allah: As said Jesus the son of Mary to the Disciples, "Who will be my helpers to (the work of) Allah?" Said the disciples, "We are Allah's helpers!" then a portion of the Children of Israel believed, and a portion disbelieved: But We gave power to those who believed, against their enemies, and they became the ones that prevailed.
column3: And Nehemiah, which is the Tirshatha, and Ezra the priest the scribe, and the Levites that taught the people, said unto all the people, This day is holy unto the LORD your God; mourn not, nor weep. For all the people wept, when they heard the words of the law.

column2: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, doth declare the Praises and Glory of Allah,- the Sovereign, the Holy One, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
column3: And the kingdom and dominion, and the greatness of the kingdom under the whole heaven, shall be given to the people of the saints of the most High, whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.

column2: It is He Who has sent amongst the Unlettered a messenger from among themselves, to rehearse to them His Signs, to sanctify them, and to instruct them in Scripture and Wisdom,- although they had been, before, in manifest error;-
column3: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:

column2: As well as (to confer all these benefits upon) others of them, who have not already joined them: And He is exalted in Might, Wise.
column3: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

column2: Such is the Bounty of Allah, which He bestows on whom He will: and Allah is the Lord of the highest bounty.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: The similitude of those who were charged with the (obligations of the) Mosaic Law, but who subsequently failed in those (obligations), is that of a donkey which carries huge tomes (but understands them not). Evil is the similitude of people who falsify the Signs of Allah: and Allah guides not people who do wrong.
column3: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

column2: Say: "O ye that stand on Judaism! If ye think that ye are friends to Allah, to the exclusion of (other) men, then express your desire for Death, if ye are truthful!"
column3: Cast away from you all your transgressions, whereby ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

column2: But never will they express their desire (for Death), because of the (deeds) their hands have sent on before them! and Allah knows well those that do wrong!
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Say: "The Death from which ye flee will truly overtake you: then will ye be sent back to the Knower of things secret and open: and He will tell you (the truth of) the things that ye did!"
column3: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.

column2: O ye who believe! When the call is proclaimed to prayer on Friday (the Day of Assembly), hasten earnestly to the Remembrance of Allah, and leave off business (and traffic): That is best for you if ye but knew!
column3: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

column2: And when the Prayer is finished, then may ye disperse through the land, and seek of the Bounty of Allah: and celebrate the Praises of Allah often (and without stint): that ye may prosper.
column3: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

column2: But when they see some bargain or some amusement, they disperse headlong to it, and leave thee standing. Say: "The (blessing) from the Presence of Allah is better than any amusement or bargain! and Allah is the Best to provide (for all needs)."
column3: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

column2: When the Hypocrites come to thee, they say, "We bear witness that thou art indeed the Messenger of Allah." Yea, Allah knoweth that thou art indeed His Messenger, and Allah beareth witness that the Hypocrites are indeed liars.
column3: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The LORD hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.

column2: They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: truly evil are their deeds.
column3: Yea, all Israel have transgressed thy law, even by departing, that they might not obey thy voice; therefore the curse is poured upon us, and the oath that is written in the law of Moses the servant of God, because we have sinned against him.

column2: That is because they believed, then they rejected Faith: So a seal was set on their hearts: therefore they understand not.
column3: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

column2: When thou lookest at them, their exteriors please thee; and when they speak, thou listenest to their words. They are as (worthless as hollow) pieces of timber propped up, (unable to stand on their own). They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemies; so beware of them. The curse of Allah be on them! How are they deluded (away from the Truth)!
column3: To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the LORD is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

column2: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will pray for your forgiveness", they turn aside their heads, and thou wouldst see them turning away their faces in arrogance.
column3: And when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.

column2: It is equal to them whether thou pray for their forgiveness or not. Allah will not forgive them. Truly Allah guides not rebellious transgressors.
column3: Seeing it is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

column2: They are the ones who say, "Spend nothing on those who are with Allah's Messenger, to the end that they may disperse (and quit Medina)." But to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the Hypocrites understand not.
column3: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column2: They say, "If we return to Medina, surely the more honourable (element) will expel therefrom the meaner." But honour belongs to Allah and His Messenger, and to the Believers; but the Hypocrites know not.
column3: Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.

column2: O ye who believe! Let not your riches or your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. If any act thus, the loss is their own.
column3: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

column2: and spend something (in charity) out of the substance which We have bestowed on you, before Death should come to any of you and he should say, "O my Lord! why didst Thou not give me respite for a little while? I should then have given (largely) in charity, and I should have been one of the doers of good".
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: But to no soul will Allah grant respite when the time appointed (for it) has come; and Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do.
column3: The fierce anger of the LORD shall not return, until he hath done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.

column2: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, doth declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: to Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs praise: and He has power over all things.
column3: And the kingdom and dominion, and the greatness of the kingdom under the whole heaven, shall be given to the people of the saints of the most High, whose kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions shall serve and obey him.

column2: It is He Who has created you; and of you are some that are Unbelievers, and some that are Believers: and Allah sees well all that ye do.
column3: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

column2: He has created the heavens and the earth in just proportions, and has given you shape, and made your shapes beautiful: and to Him is the final Goal.
column3: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

column2: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth; and He knows what ye conceal and what ye reveal: yea, Allah knows well the (secrets) of (all) hearts.
column3: But God hath revealed them unto us by his Spirit: for the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.

column2: Has not the story reached you, of those who rejected Faith aforetime? So they tasted the evil result of their conduct; and they had a grievous Penalty.
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: That was because there came to them messengers with Clear Signs, but they said: "Shall (mere) human beings direct us?" So they rejected (the Message) and turned away. But Allah can do without (them): and Allah is free of all needs, worthy of all praise.
column3: The priests said not, Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

column2: The Unbelievers think that they will not be raised up (for Judgment). Say: "Yea, By my Lord, Ye shall surely be raised up: then shall ye be told (the truth) of all that ye did. And that is easy for Allah."
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: Believe, therefore, in Allah and His Messenger, and in the Light which we have sent down. And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.
column3: And we are his witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.

column2: The Day that He assembles you (all) for a Day of Assembly,- that will be a Day of mutual loss and gain (among you), and those who believe in Allah and work righteousness,- He will remove from them their ills, and He will admit them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever: that will be the Supreme Achievement.
column3: If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.

column2: But those who reject Faith and treat Our Signs as falsehoods, they will be Companions of the Fire, to dwell therein for aye: and evil is that Goal.
column3: Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words: but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.

column2: No kind of calamity can occur, except by the leave of Allah: and if any one believes in Allah, (Allah) guides his heart (aright): for Allah knows all things.
column3: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

column2: So obey Allah, and obey His Messenger: but if ye turn back, the duty of Our Messenger is but to proclaim (the Message) clearly and openly.
column3: And Samuel said unto the people, Fear not: ye have done all this wickedness: yet turn not aside from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart;

column2: Allah! There is no god but He: and on Allah, therefore, let the Believers put their trust.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: O ye who believe! Truly, among your wives and your children are (some that are) enemies to yourselves: so beware of them! But if ye forgive and overlook, and cover up (their faults), verily Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

column2: Your riches and your children may be but a trial: but in the Presence of Allah, is the highest, Reward.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: So fear Allah as much as ye can; listen and obey and spend in charity for the benefit of your own soul and those saved from the covetousness of their own souls,- they are the ones that achieve prosperity.
column3: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

column2: If ye loan to Allah, a beautiful loan, He will double it to your (credit), and He will grant you Forgiveness: for Allah is most Ready to appreciate (service), Most Forbearing,-
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Knower of what is open, Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.
column3: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

column2: O Prophet! When ye do divorce women, divorce them at their prescribed periods, and count (accurately), their prescribed periods: And fear Allah your Lord: and turn them not out of their houses, nor shall they (themselves) leave, except in case they are guilty of some open lewdness, those are limits set by Allah: and any who transgresses the limits of Allah, does verily wrong his (own) soul: thou knowest not if perchance Allah will bring about thereafter some new situation.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: Thus when they fulfil their term appointed, either take them back on equitable terms or part with them on equitable terms; and take for witness two persons from among you, endued with justice, and establish the evidence (as) before Allah. Such is the admonition given to him who believes in Allah and the Last Day. And for those who fear Allah, He (ever) prepares a way out,
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: And He provides for him from (sources) he never could imagine. And if any one puts his trust in Allah, sufficient is (Allah) for him. For Allah will surely accomplish his purpose: verily, for all things has Allah appointed a due proportion.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column2: Such of your women as have passed the age of monthly courses, for them the prescribed period, if ye have any doubts, is three months, and for those who have no courses (it is the same): for those who carry (life within their wombs), their period is until they deliver their burdens: and for those who fear Allah, He will make their path easy.
column3: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

column2: That is the Command of Allah, which He has sent down to you: and if any one fears Allah, He will remove his ills, from him, and will enlarge his reward.
column3: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

column2: Let the women live (in 'iddat) in the same style as ye live, according to your means: Annoy them not, so as to restrict them. And if they carry (life in their wombs), then spend (your substance) on them until they deliver their burden: and if they suckle your (offspring), give them their recompense: and take mutual counsel together, according to what is just and reasonable. And if ye find yourselves in difficulties, let another woman suckle (the child) on the (father's) behalf.
column3: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

column2: Let the man of means spend according to his means: and the man whose resources are restricted, let him spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah puts no burden on any person beyond what He has given him. After a difficulty, Allah will soon grant relief.
column3: Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

column2: How many populations that insolently opposed the Command of their Lord and of His messengers, did We not then call to account,- to severe account?- and We imposed on them an exemplary Punishment.
column3: And the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel; and he said, Because that this people hath transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice;

column2: Then did they taste the evil result of their conduct, and the End of their conduct was Perdition.
column3: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column2: Allah has prepared for them a severe Punishment (in the Hereafter). Therefore fear Allah, O ye men of understanding - who have believed!- for Allah hath indeed sent down to you a Message,-
column3: It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.

column2: An Messenger, who rehearses to you the Signs of Allah containing clear explanations, that he may lead forth those who believe and do righteous deeds from the depths of Darkness into Light. And those who believe in Allah and work righteousness, He will admit to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever: Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent Provision.
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: Allah is He Who created seven Firmaments and of the earth a similar number. Through the midst of them (all) descends His Command: that ye may know that Allah has power over all things, and that Allah comprehends, all things in (His) Knowledge.
column3: To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.

column2: O Prophet! Why holdest thou to be forbidden that which Allah has made lawful to thee? Thou seekest to please thy consorts. But Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column2: Allah has already ordained for you, (O men), the dissolution of your oaths (in some cases): and Allah is your Protector, and He is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: When the Prophet disclosed a matter in confidence to one of his consorts, and she then divulged it (to another), and Allah made it known to him, he confirmed part thereof and repudiated a part. Then when he told her thereof, she said, "Who told thee this? "He said, "He told me Who knows and is well-acquainted (with all things)."
column3: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.

column2: If ye two turn in repentance to Him, your hearts are indeed so inclined; But if ye back up each other against him, truly Allah is his Protector, and Gabriel, and (every) righteous one among those who believe,- and furthermore, the angels - will back (him) up.
column3: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

column2: It may be, if he divorced you (all), that Allah will give him in exchange consorts better than you,- who submit (their wills), who believe, who are devout, who turn to Allah in repentance, who worship (in humility), who travel (for Faith) and fast,- previously married or virgins.
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: O ye who believe! save yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is Men and Stones, over which are (appointed) angels stern (and) severe, who flinch not (from executing) the Commands they receive from Allah, but do (precisely) what they are commanded.
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: (They will say), "O ye Unbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! Ye are being but requited for all that ye did!"
column3: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.

column2: O ye who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance: In the hope that your Lord will remove from you your ills and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow,- the Day that Allah will not permit to be humiliated the Prophet and those who believe with him. Their Light will run forward before them and by their right hands, while they say, "Our Lord! Perfect our Light for us, and grant us Forgiveness: for Thou hast power over all things."
column3: O LORD, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.

column2: O Prophet! Strive hard against the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites, and be firm against them. Their abode is Hell,- an evil refuge (indeed).
column3: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.

column2: Allah sets forth, for an example to the Unbelievers, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of our righteous servants, but they were false to their (husbands), and they profited nothing before Allah on their account, but were told: "Enter ye the Fire along with (others) that enter!"
column3: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

column2: And Allah sets forth, as an example to those who believe the wife of Pharaoh: Behold she said: "O my Lord! Build for me, in nearness to Thee, a mansion in the Garden, and save me from Pharaoh and his doings, and save me from those that do wrong";
column3: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, which told me that I should be king over this people.

column2: And Mary the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (her body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations, and was one of the devout (servants).
column3: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost.

column2: Blessed be He in Whose hands is Dominion; and He over all things hath Power;-
column3: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy is his name.

column2: He Who created Death and Life, that He may try which of you is best in deed: and He is the Exalted in Might, Oft-Forgiving;-
column3: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

column2: He Who created the seven heavens one above another: No want of proportion wilt thou see in the Creation of (Allah) Most Gracious. So turn thy vision again: seest thou any flaw?
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: Again turn thy vision a second time: (thy) vision will come back to thee dull and discomfited, in a state worn out.
column3: And if thou draw out thy soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul; then shall thy light rise in obscurity, and thy darkness be as the noon day:

column2: And we have, (from of old), adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps, and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the Evil Ones, and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.
column3: For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles, which go forth unto the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

column2: For those who reject their Lord (and Cherisher) is the Penalty of Hell: and evil is (such), Destination.
column3: Whose end is destruction, whose God is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.)

column2: When they are cast therein, they will hear the (terrible) drawing in of its breath even as it blazes forth,
column3: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;

column2: Almost bursting with fury: Every time a Group is cast therein, its Keepers will ask, "Did no Warner come to you?"
column3: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

column2: They will say: "Yes indeed; a Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said, 'Allah never sent down any (Message): ye are nothing but an egregious delusion!'"
column3: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered morter:

column2: They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence, we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"
column3: And they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.

column2: They will then confess their sins: but far will be (Forgiveness) from the Companions of the Blazing Fire!
column3: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

column2: As for those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is Forgiveness and a great Reward.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column2: And whether ye hide your word or publish it, He certainly has (full) knowledge, of the secrets of (all) hearts.
column3: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

column2: Should He not know,- He that created? and He is the One that understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with them).
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: It is He Who has made the earth manageable for you, so traverse ye through its tracts and enjoy of the Sustenance which He furnishes: but unto Him is the Resurrection.
column3: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof:

column2: Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones), so that ye shall know how (terrible) was My warning?
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?
column3: And, lo, I perceived that God had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.

column2: Do they not observe the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly it is He that watches over all things.
column3: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

column2: Nay, who is there that can help you, (even as) an army, besides (Allah) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the Unbelievers.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? Nay, they obstinately persist in insolent impiety and flight (from the Truth).
column3: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

column2: Is then one who walks headlong, with his face grovelling, better guided,- or one who walks evenly on a Straight Way?
column3: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

column2: Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow), and made for you the faculties of hearing, seeing, feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give.
column3: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

column2: Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth, and to Him shall ye be gathered together."
column3: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and shall carry thee out.

column2: They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.
column3: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

column2: Say: "As to the knowledge of the time, it is with Allah alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."
column3: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

column2: At length, when they see it close at hand, grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled), which ye were calling for!"
column3: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.

column2: Say: "See ye?- If Allah were to destroy me, and those with me, or if He bestows His Mercy on us,- yet who can deliver the Unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"
column3: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

column2: Say: "He is (Allah) Most Gracious: We have believed in Him, and on Him have we put our trust: So, soon will ye know which (of us) it is that is in manifest error."
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth), who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"
column3: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.

column2: Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write,-
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.
column3: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

column2: Nay, verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:
column3: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

column2: And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
column3: The king's strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

column2: Soon wilt thou see, and they will see,
column3: And if any mischief follow, then thou shalt give life for life,

column2: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
column3: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

column2: Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best, which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.
column3: But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.

column2: So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).
column3: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

column2: Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.
column3: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

column2: Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,
column3: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

column2: A slanderer, going about with calumnies,
column3: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

column2: (Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
column3: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

column2: Violent (and cruel),- with all that, base-born,-
column3: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

column2: Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.
column3: The rich man had exceeding many flocks and herds:

column2: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!
column3: That chant to the sound of the viol, and invent to themselves instruments of musick, like David;

column2: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
column3: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

column2: But made no reservation, ("If it be Allah's Will").
column3: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

column2: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.
column3: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon's, greatly wondering.

column2: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
column3: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.

column2: As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-
column3: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,

column2: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
column3: Ye shall offer these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.

column2: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-
column3: And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

column2: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
column3: In the first day shall be an holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work therein:

column2: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
column3: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

column2: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
column3: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

column2: "Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"
column3: Our necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.

column2: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, 'Why not glorify (Allah)?'"
column3: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard this, said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?

column2: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
column3: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

column2: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.
column3: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.

column2: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
column3: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.

column2: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!
column3: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

column2: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.
column3: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

column2: Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
column3: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.

column2: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
column3: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?

column2: Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
column3: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

column2: That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?
column3: And ye shall proclaim on the selfsame day, that it may be an holy convocation unto you: ye shall do no servile work therein: it shall be a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.

column2: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!
column3: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?

column2: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-
column3: In the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble, and the strong men shall bow themselves, and the grinders cease because they are few, and those that look out of the windows be darkened,

column2: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).
column3: How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots' houses.

column2: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
column3: Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?

column2: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
column3: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son's mandrakes.

column2: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?
column3: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.

column2: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.
column3: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.

column2: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.
column3: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

column2: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.
column3: And he set the priests in their charges, and encouraged them to the service of the house of the LORD,

column2: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
column3: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.

column2: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
column3: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

column2: The Sure Reality!
column3: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

column2: What is the Sure Reality?
column3: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

column2: And what will make thee realise what the Sure Reality is?
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: The Thamud and the 'Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
column3: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.

column2: But the Thamud,- they were destroyed by a terrible Storm of thunder and lightning!
column3: And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

column2: And the 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;
column3: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;

column2: He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path), as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!
column3: Thou sawest till that a stone was cut out without hands, which smote the image upon his feet that were of iron and clay, and brake them to pieces.

column2: Then seest thou any of them left surviving?
column3: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves? for since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.

column2: And Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Cities Overthrown, committed habitual Sin.
column3: And them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:

column2: And disobeyed (each) the messenger of their Lord; so He punished them with an abundant Penalty.
column3: Wherefore the sin of the young men was very great before the LORD: for men abhorred the offering of the LORD.

column2: We, when the water (of Noah's Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, carried you (mankind), in the floating (Ark),
column3: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged;

column2: That We might make it a Message unto you, and that ears (that should hear the tale and) retain its memory should bear its (lessons) in remembrance.
column3: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

column2: Then, when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet,
column3: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?

column2: And the earth is moved, and its mountains, and they are crushed to powder at one stroke,-
column3: And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;

column2: On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.
column3: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.

column2: And the sky will be rent asunder, for it will that Day be flimsy,
column3: And with the arms of a flood shall they be overflown from before him, and shall be broken; yea, also the prince of the covenant.

column2: And the angels will be on its sides, and eight will, that Day, bear the Throne of thy Lord above them.
column3: In that day shall the LORD defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and he that is feeble among them at that day shall be as David; and the house of David shall be as God, as the angel of the LORD before them.

column2: That Day shall ye be brought to Judgment: not an act of yours that ye hide will be hidden.
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!
column3: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

column2: "I did really understand that my Account would (One Day) reach me!"
column3: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!

column2: And he will be in a life of Bliss,
column3: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

column2: In a Garden on high,
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: The Fruits whereof (will hang in bunches) low and near.
column3: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

column2: "Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"
column3: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

column2: And he that will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!
column3: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or in his hand,

column2: "And that I had never realised how my account (stood)!
column3: If I rejoice because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

column2: "Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!
column3: If I rejoice at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

column2: "Of no profit to me has been my wealth!
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: "My power has perished from me!"...
column3: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

column2: (The stern command will say): "Seize ye him, and bind ye him,
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: "And burn ye him in the Blazing Fire.
column3: And the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.

column2: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!
column3: And the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about.

column2: "This was he that would not believe in Allah Most High.
column3: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

column2: "And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!
column3: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

column2: "So no friend hath he here this Day.
column3: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

column2: "Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,
column3: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

column2: "Which none do eat but those in sin."
column3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

column2: So I do call to witness what ye see,
column3: The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain the time, because ye see the thing is gone from me.

column2: And what ye see not,
column3: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

column2: That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;
column3: This is the interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the most High, which is come upon my lord the king:

column2: It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!
column3: And have ye not read this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:

column2: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.
column3: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

column2: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.
column3: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

column2: And if the messenger were to invent any sayings in Our name,
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: We should certainly seize him by his right hand,
column3: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.

column2: And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:
column3: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

column2: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).
column3: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

column2: But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.
column3: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

column2: And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).
column3: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

column2: But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.
column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column2: But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.
column3: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column2: So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.
column3: Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the LORD our God is holy.

column2: A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-
column3: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

column2: The Unbelievers, the which there is none to ward off,-
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: (A Penalty) from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.
column3: The burden of the word of the LORD to Israel by Malachi.

column2: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:
column3: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty and two months.

column2: Therefore do thou hold Patience,- a Patience of beautiful (contentment).
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):
column3: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

column2: But We see it (quite) near.
column3: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

column2: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass,
column3: And the building of the wall of it was of jasper: and the city was pure gold, like unto clear glass.

column2: And the mountains will be like wool,
column3: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.

column2: And no friend will ask after a friend,
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column2: Though they will be put in sight of each other,- the sinner's desire will be: Would that he could redeem himself from the Penalty of that Day by (sacrificing) his children,
column3: And the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering:

column2: His wife and his brother,
column3: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

column2: His kindred who sheltered him,
column3: And every raven after his kind,

column2: And all, all that is on earth,- so it could deliver him:
column3: This is the land that yet remaineth: all the borders of the Philistines, and all Geshuri,

column2: By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-
column3: Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.

column2: Inviting (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the Right).
column3: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.

column2: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use)!
column3: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

column2: Truly man was created very impatient;-
column3: For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

column2: Fretful when evil touches him;
column3: If I rejoice at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

column2: And niggardly when good reaches him;-
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: Not so those devoted to Prayer;-
column3: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

column2: Those who remain steadfast to their prayer;
column3: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)

column2: And those in whose wealth is a recognised right.
column3: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.

column2: For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);
column3: Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

column2: And those who hold to the truth of the Day of Judgment;
column3: And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

column2: And those who fear the displeasure of their Lord,-
column3: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.

column2: For their Lord's displeasure is the opposite of Peace and Tranquillity;-
column3: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.

column2: And those who guard their chastity,
column3: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

column2: Except with their wives and the (captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (then) they are not to be blamed,
column3: The merchants of these things, which were made rich by her, shall stand afar off for the fear of her torment, weeping and wailing,

column2: But those who trespass beyond this are transgressors;-
column3: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

column2: And those who respect their trusts and covenants;
column3: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

column2: And those who stand firm in their testimonies;
column3: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

column2: And those who guard (the sacredness) of their worship;-
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: Such will be the honoured ones in the Gardens (of Bliss).
column3: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

column2: Now what is the matter with the Unbelievers that they rush madly before thee-
column3: For which cause both thou and all thy company are gathered together against the LORD: and what is Aaron, that ye murmur against him?

column2: From the right and from the left, in crowds?
column3: In four quarters were the porters, toward the east, west, north, and south.

column2: Does every man of them long to enter the Garden of Bliss?
column3: That no flesh should glory in his presence.

column2: By no means! For We have created them out of the (base matter) they know!
column3: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.

column2: Now I do call to witness the Lord of all points in the East and the West that We can certainly-
column3: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers which are beyond the river, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily,

column2: Substitute for them better (men) than they; And We are not to be defeated (in Our Plan).
column3: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

column2: So leave them to plunge in vain talk and play about, until they encounter that Day of theirs which they have been promised!-
column3: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

column2: The Day whereon they will issue from their sepulchres in sudden haste as if they were rushing to a goal-post (fixed for them),-
column3: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.

column2: Their eyes lowered in dejection,- ignominy covering them (all over)! such is the Day the which they are promised!
column3: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

column2: We sent Noah to his People (with the Command): "Do thou warn thy People before there comes to them a grievous Penalty."
column3: Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.

column2: He said: "O my People! I am to you a Warner, clear and open:
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: "That ye should worship Allah, fear Him and obey me:
column3: Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.

column2: "So He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a stated Term: for when the Term given by Allah is accomplished, it cannot be put forward: if ye only knew."
column3: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

column2: He said: "O my Lord! I have called to my People night and day:
column3: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:

column2: "But my call only increases (their) flight (from the Right).
column3: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

column2: "And every time I have called to them, that Thou mightest forgive them, they have (only) thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, grown obstinate, and given themselves up to arrogance.
column3: How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots' houses.

column2: "So I have called to them aloud;
column3: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

column2: "Further I have spoken to them in public and secretly in private,
column3: Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.

column2: "Saying, 'Ask forgiveness from your Lord; for He is Oft-Forgiving;
column3: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

column2: "'He will send rain to you in abundance;
column3: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

column2: "'Give you increase in wealth and sons; and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers (of flowing water).
column3: Then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield her increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.

column2: "'What is the matter with you, that ye place not your hope for kindness and long-suffering in Allah,-
column3: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

column2: "'Seeing that it is He that has created you in diverse stages?
column3: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

column2: "'See ye not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another,
column3: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

column2: "'And made the moon a light in their midst, and made the sun as a (Glorious) Lamp?
column3: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

column2: "'And Allah has produced you from the earth growing (gradually),
column3: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it.

column2: "'And in the End He will return you into the (earth), and raise you forth (again at the Resurrection)?
column3: Or, Who shall descend into the deep? (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)

column2: "'And Allah has made the earth for you as a carpet (spread out),
column3: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

column2: "'That ye may go about therein, in spacious roads.'"
column3: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

column2: Noah said: "O my Lord! They have disobeyed me, but they follow (men) whose wealth and children give them no increase but only Loss.
column3: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.

column2: "And they have devised a tremendous Plot.
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: "And they have said (to each other), 'Abandon not your gods: Abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa', neither Yaguth nor Ya'uq, nor Nasr';-
column3: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.

column2: "They have already misled many; and grant Thou no increase to the wrong-doers but in straying (from their mark)."
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: Because of their sins they were drowned (in the flood), and were made to enter the Fire (of Punishment): and they found- in lieu of Allah- none to help them.
column3: And they left the house of the LORD God of their fathers, and served groves and idols: and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their trespass.

column2: And Noah, said: "O my Lord! Leave not of the Unbelievers, a single one on earth!
column3: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

column2: "For, if Thou dost leave (any of) them, they will but mislead Thy devotees, and they will breed none but wicked ungrateful ones.
column3: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.

column2: "O my Lord! Forgive me, my parents, all who enter my house in Faith, and (all) believing men and believing women: and to the wrong-doers grant Thou no increase but in perdition!"
column3: The LORD is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment: hear, I pray you, all people, and behold my sorrow: my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.

column2: Say: It has been revealed to me that a company of Jinns listened (to the Qur'an). They said, 'We have really heard a wonderful Recital!
column3: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

column2: It gives guidance to the Right, and we have believed therein: we shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord.
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
column3: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.
