column2: There were some foolish ones among us, who used to utter extravagant lies against Allah;
column3: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.

column2: But we do think that no man or spirit should say aught that untrue against Allah.
column3: Then said these men, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning the law of his God.

column2: True, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns, but they increased them in folly.
column3: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, even as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.

column2: And they (came to) think as ye thought, that Allah would not raise up any one (to Judgment).
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: And we pried into the secrets of heaven; but we found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.
column3: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD unto the gate of Jerusalem.

column2: We used, indeed, to sit there in (hidden) stations, to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.
column3: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

column2: And we understand not whether ill is intended to those on earth, or whether their Lord (really) intends to guide them to right conduct.
column3: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

column2: There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.
column3: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the LORD hath laid on him the iniquity of us all.

column2: But we think that we can by no means frustrate Allah throughout the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by flight.
column3: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

column2: And as for us, since we have listened to the Guidance, we have accepted it: and any who believes in his Lord has no fear, either of a short (account) or of any injustice.
column3: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

column2: Amongst us are some that submit their wills (to Allah), and some that swerve from justice. Now those who submit their wills - they have sought out (the path) of right conduct:
column3: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

column2: But those who swerve,- they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire'-
column3: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

column2: (And Allah's Message is): "If they (the Pagans) had (only) remained on the (right) Way, We should certainly have bestowed on them Rain in abundance.
column3: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

column2: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.
column3: And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.

column2: "And the places of worship are for Allah (alone): So invoke not any one along with Allah;
column3: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

column2: "Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."
column3: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.

column2: Say: "I do no more than invoke my Lord, and I join not with Him any (false god)."
column3: I am the LORD: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.

column2: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to right conduct."
column3: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.

column2: Say: "No one can deliver me from Allah (If I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him,
column3: Moreover as for me, God forbid that I should sin against the LORD in ceasing to pray for you: but I will teach you the good and the right way:

column2: "Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His Messages: for any that disobey Allah and His Messenger,- for them is Hell: they shall dwell therein for ever."
column3: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.

column2: At length, when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised,- then will they know who it is that is weakest in (his) helper and least important in point of numbers.

column2: Say: "I know not whether the (Punishment) which ye are promised is near, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

column2: "He (alone) knows the Unseen, nor does He make any one acquainted with His Mysteries,-

column2: "That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."
column3: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

column2: O thou folded in garments!

column2: (He is) Lord of the East and the West: there is no god but He: take Him therefore for (thy) Disposer of Affairs.

column2: We have sent to you, (O men!) a messenger, to be a witness concerning you, even as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.

column2: Then how shall ye, if ye deny (Allah), guard yourselves against a Day that will make children hoary-headed?-

column2: Verily this is an Admonition: therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) path to his Lord!
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: Thy Lord doth know that thou standest forth (to prayer) nigh two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so doth a party of those with thee. But Allah doth appoint night and day in due measure He knoweth that ye are unable to keep count thereof. So He hath turned to you (in mercy): read ye, therefore, of the Qur'an as much as may be easy for you. He knoweth that there may be (some) among you in ill-health; others travelling through the land, seeking of Allah's bounty; yet others fighting in Allah's Cause, read ye, therefore, as much of the Qur'an as may be easy (for you); and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan. And whatever good ye send forth for your souls ye shall find it in Allah's Presence,- yea, better and greater, in Reward and seek ye the Grace of Allah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Until the LORD have given your brethren rest, as he hath given you, and they also have possessed the land which the LORD your God giveth them: then ye shall return unto the land of your possession, and enjoy it, which Moses the LORD's servant gave you on this side Jordan toward the sunrising.

column2: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!
column3: TEKEL; Thou art weighed in the balances, and art found wanting.

column3: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

column2: And thy Lord do thou magnify!
column3: The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.

column2: And thy garments keep free from stain!
column3: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

column2: And all abomination shun!

column2: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!
column3: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

Thus doth Allah leave to stray whom He pleaseth, and guide whom He pleaseth: and none can know the forces of thy Lord, except He and this is no other than a warning to mankind.

column2: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If thou seest them, thou wouldst think them scattered Pearls.

column2: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."

column2: It is We Who have sent down the Qur'an to thee by stages.

column2: Therefore be patient with constancy to the Command of thy Lord, and hearken not to the sinner or the ingrate among them.

column2: And celebrate the name of thy Lord morning and evening,

column2: And part of the night, prostrate thyself to Him; and glorify Him a long night through.

column2: As to these, they love the fleeting life, and put away behind them a Day (that will be) hard.

column2: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

column2: And the mountains as pegs?
column3: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

column2: And (have We not) created you in pairs,
column3: And the way of peace have they not known:

column2: And made your sleep for rest,
column3: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

column2: And made the night as a covering,
column3: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

column2: And made the day as a means of subsistence?
column3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

column2: And (have We not) built over you the seven firmaments,
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: And placed (therein) a Light of Splendour?
column3: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column3: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

column2: Woe to man! What hath made him reject Allah;
column3: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?

column2: From what stuff hath He created him?
column3: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

column2: From a sperm-drop: He hath created him, and then mouldeth him in due proportions;
column3: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

column2: Then doth He make His path smooth for him;
column3: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

column2: Then He causeth him to die, and putteth him in his grave;
column3: And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.

column2: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).
column3: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.

column2: By no means hath he fulfilled what Allah hath commanded him.
column3: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

column2: Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):
column3: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

column2: For that We pour forth water in abundance,
column3: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.

column2: And We split the earth in fragments,
column3: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

column2: And produce therein corn,
column3: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column2: And Grapes and nutritious plants,
column3: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column2: And Olives and Dates,
column3: A land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of oil olive, and honey;

column2: And enclosed Gardens, dense with lofty trees,
column3: And they set them up images and groves in every high hill, and under every green tree:

column2: And fruits and fodder,-
column3: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column2: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
column3: This do; Take you censers, Korah, and all his company;

column2: At length, when there comes the Deafening Noise,-

column2: That Day shall a man flee from his own brother,
column3: Then will the LORD be jealous for his land, and pity his people.

column2: And from his mother and his father,
column3: And they remembered his words,

column2: And from his wife and his children.
column3: All the families that remain, every family apart, and their wives apart.

column2: Each one of them, that Day, will have enough concern (of his own) to make him indifferent to the others.
column3: That every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

column2: Some faces that Day will be beaming,
column3: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

column2: Laughing, rejoicing.
column3: Rejoice evermore.

column2: And other faces that Day will be dust-stained,
column3: Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

column3: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

column3: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

column2: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up;
column3: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

column2: When the stars fall, losing their lustre;
column3: The sun and the moon shall be darkened, and the stars shall withdraw their shining.

column2: When the mountains vanish (like a mirage);
column3: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

column2: When the she-camels, ten months with young, are left untended;
column3: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

column2: When the wild beasts are herded together (in the human habitations);
column3: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

column2: When the oceans boil over with a swell;
column3: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

column2: When the souls are sorted out, (being joined, like with like);
column3: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

column2: When the female (infant), buried alive, is questioned -

column3: Then I saw that she was defiled, that they took both one way,

column2: When the scrolls are laid open;
column3: Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.

column2: When the world on High is unveiled;
column3: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

column2: When the Blazing Fire is kindled to fierce heat;
column3: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

column2: And when the Garden is brought near;-

column2: Go straight, or hide;
column3: If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?

column2: And the Night as it dissipates;
column3: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

column2: And the Dawn as it breathes away the darkness;-
column3: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

column2: Verily this is the word of a most honourable Messenger,
column3: And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

column2: Endued with Power, with rank before the Lord of the Throne,
column3: Strengthened with all might, according to his glorious power, unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;

column2: With authority there, (and) faithful to his trust.
column3: With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:

column2: And without doubt he saw him in the clear horizon.
column3: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

column2: Neither doth he withhold grudgingly a knowledge of the Unseen.

column2: Nor is it the word of an evil spirit accursed.
column3: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.

column2: When whither go ye?
column3: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

column2: Verily this is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds:
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: (With profit) to whoever among you wills to go straight:
column3: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

column2: But ye shall not will except as Allah wills,- the Cherisher of the Worlds.
column3: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column2: When the Stars are scattered;
column3: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

column2: When the Oceans are suffered to burst forth;
column3: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

column2: (Then) shall each soul know what it hath sent forward and (what it hath) kept back.

column2: O man! What has seduced thee from thy Lord Most Beneficent?-
column3: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

column2: Him Who created thee. Fashioned thee in due proportion, and gave thee a just bias;
column3: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column2: In whatever Form He wills, does He put thee together.
column3: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.

column2: Nay! But ye do reject Right and Judgment!
column3: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

column2: But verily over you (are appointed angels) to protect you,-

column2: Kind and honourable,- Writing down (your deeds):

column2: They know (and understand) all that ye do.
column3: And ye are witnesses of these things.

column2: And the Wicked - they will be in the Fire,

column2: Again, what will explain to thee what the Day of Judgment is?

column3: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

column2: And Who bringeth out the (green and luscious) pasture,
column3: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

column2: And then doth make it (but) swarthy stubble.
column3: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

column2: By degrees shall We teach thee to declare (the Message), so thou shalt not forget,
column3: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.

column2: Except as Allah wills: For He knoweth what is manifest and what is hidden.
column3: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.

column2: And We will make it easy for thee (to follow) the simple (Path).
column3: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

column2: Therefore give admonition in case the admonition profits (the hearer).
column3: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

column2: The admonition will be received by those who fear (Allah):
column3: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

column2: But it will be avoided by those most unfortunate ones,
column3: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

column2: Who will enter the Great Fire,
column3: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

column2: In which they will then neither die nor live.
column3: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

column2: But those will prosper who purify themselves,
column3: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

column2: And glorify the name of their Guardian-Lord, and (lift their hearts) in prayer.
column3: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

column2: Nay (behold), ye prefer the life of this world;
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: But the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
column3: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

column2: And this is in the Books of the earliest (Revelation),-
column3: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

column2: The Books of Abraham and Moses.
column3: And the rest of the acts of Zachariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

column2: Has the story reached thee of the overwhelming (Event)?
column3: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column2: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated,
column3: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.

column2: Labouring (hard), weary,-
column3: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

column2: The while they enter the Blazing Fire,-
column3: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

column2: The while they are given, to drink, of a boiling hot spring,
column3: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

column2: No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari'
column3: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

column2: Which will neither nourish nor satisfy hunger.
column3: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.

column2: (Other) faces that Day will be joyful,
column3: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

column2: Pleased with their striving,-
column3: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.

column2: In a Garden on high,
column3: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

column2: Where they shall hear no (word) of vanity:
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: Therein will be a bubbling spring:
column3: I made me pools of water, to water therewith the wood that bringeth forth trees:

column2: Therein will be Thrones (of dignity), raised on high,
column3: Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:

column2: Goblets placed (ready),
column3: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

column2: And cushions set in rows,
column3: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

column2: And rich carpets (all) spread out.
column3: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

column2: Do they not look at the Camels, how they are made?-
column3: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

column2: And at the Sky, how it is raised high?-
column3: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

column2: And at the Mountains, how they are fixed firm?-
column3: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

column2: And at the Earth, how it is spread out?
column3: How are the things of Esau searched out! how are his hidden things sought up!

column2: Therefore do thou give admonition, for thou art one to admonish.
column3: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

column2: Thou art not one to manage (men's) affairs.
column3: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.

column2: But if any turn away and reject Allah,-
column3: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

column2: Allah will punish him with a mighty Punishment,
column3: The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.

column2: For to Us will be their return;
column3: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

column2: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.
column3: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

column2: By the break of Day
column3: So the people rested on the seventh day.

column2: By the Nights twice five;
column3: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column2: By the even and odd (contrasted);
column3: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column2: And by the Night when it passeth away;-
column3: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.

column2: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?
column3: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

column2: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the 'Ad (people),-
column3: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel saying,

column2: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,
column3: And the south, and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, unto Zoar.

column2: The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-
column3: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.

column2: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?
column3: And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.

column2: (All) these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands,
column3: Which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

column2: And heaped therein mischief (on mischief).
column3: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

column2: Therefore did thy Lord pour on them a scourge of diverse chastisements:
column3: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:

column2: For thy Lord is (as a Guardian) on a watch-tower.
column3: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

column2: Now, as for man, when his Lord trieth him, giving him honour and gifts, then saith he, (puffed up), "My Lord hath honoured me."
column3: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.

column2: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"
column3: And the residue thereof he maketh a god, even his graven image: he falleth down unto it, and worshippeth it, and prayeth unto it, and saith, Deliver me; for thou art my god.

column2: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!
column3: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

column2: Nor do ye encourage one another to feed the poor!-
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,
column3: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column2: And ye love wealth with inordinate love!
column3: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

column2: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: And thy Lord cometh, and His angels, rank upon rank,
column3: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet are like fine brass;

column2: And Hell, that Day, is brought (face to face),- on that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance profit him?
column3: And he said, Behold, I will make thee know what shall be in the last end of the indignation: for at the time appointed the end shall be.

column2: He will say: "Ah! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my (Future) Life!"
column3: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant's sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:

column2: For, that Day, His Chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict,
column3: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column2: And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.
column3: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

column2: (To the righteous soul will be said:) "O (thou) soul, in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: "Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!
column3: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:

column2: "Enter thou, then, among My devotees!
column3: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;

column2: "Yea, enter thou My Heaven!
column3: Yea, thou shalt see thy children's children, and peace upon Israel.

column2: I do call to witness this City;-
column3: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

column2: And thou art a freeman of this City;-
column3: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.

column2: And (the mystic ties of) parent and child;-
column3: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

column2: Verily We have created man into toil and struggle.
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: Thinketh he, that none hath power over him?
column3: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

column2: He may say (boastfully); Wealth have I squandered in abundance!
column3: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column2: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?
column3: This persuasion cometh not of him that calleth you.

column2: Have We not made for him a pair of eyes?-
column3: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?

column2: And a tongue, and a pair of lips?-
column3: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

column2: And shown him the two highways?
column3: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

column2: But he hath made no haste on the path that is steep.
column3: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

column2: And what will explain to thee the path that is steep?-
column3: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

column2: (It is:) freeing the bondman;
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: Or the giving of food in a day of privation
column3: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

column2: To the orphan with claims of relationship,
column3: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

column2: Or to the indigent (down) in the dust.
column3: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.

column2: Then will he be of those who believe, and enjoin patience, (constancy, and self-restraint), and enjoin deeds of kindness and compassion.
column3: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

column2: Such are the Companions of the Right Hand.
column3: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

column2: But those who reject Our Signs, they are the (unhappy) Companions of the Left Hand.
column3: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

column2: On them will be Fire vaulted over (all round).
column3: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.

column2: By the Sun and his (glorious) splendour;
column3: The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

column2: By the Moon as she follows him;
column3: And sitting down they watched him there;

column2: By the Day as it shows up (the Sun's) glory;
column3: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

column2: By the Night as it conceals it;
column3: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

column2: By the Firmament and its (wonderful) structure;
column3: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

column2: By the Earth and its (wide) expanse:
column3: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.

column2: By the Soul, and the proportion and order given to it;
column3: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

column2: And its enlightenment as to its wrong and its right;-
column3: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

column2: Truly he succeeds that purifies it,
column3: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.

column2: And he fails that corrupts it!
column3: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

column2: The Thamud (people) rejected (their prophet) through their inordinate wrong-doing,
column3: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.

column2: Behold, the most wicked man among them was deputed (for impiety).
column3: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

column2: But the Messenger of Allah said to them: "It is a She-camel of Allah! And (bar her not from) having her drink!"
column3: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned, and is dead.

column2: Then they rejected him (as a false prophet), and they hamstrung her. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and made them equal (in destruction, high and low)!
column3: And they left the house of the LORD God of their fathers, and served groves and idols: and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their trespass.

column2: And for Him is no fear of its consequences.
column3: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

column2: By the Night as it conceals (the light);
column3: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.

column2: By the Day as it appears in glory;
column3: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

column2: By (the mystery of) the creation of male and female;-
column3: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

column2: Verily, (the ends) ye strive for are diverse.
column3: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

column2: So he who gives (in charity) and fears (Allah),
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: And (in all sincerity) testifies to the best,-
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Bliss.
column3: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.

column2: But he who is a greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient,
column3: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!

column2: And gives the lie to the best,-
column3: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's line of things made ready to our hand.

column2: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Misery;
column3: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

column2: Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong (into the Pit).
column3: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

column2: Verily We take upon Ourselves to guide,
column3: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

column2: And verily unto Us (belong) the End and the Beginning.
column3: This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God hath numbered thy kingdom, and finished it.

column2: Therefore do I warn you of a Fire blazing fiercely;
column3: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

column2: None shall reach it but those most unfortunate ones
column3: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

column2: Who give the lie to Truth and turn their backs.
column3: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.

column2: But those most devoted to Allah shall be removed far from it,-
column3: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against the LORD.

column2: Those who spend their wealth for increase in self-purification,
column3: Who being past feeling have given themselves over unto lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.

column2: And have in their minds no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,
column3: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

column2: But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High;
column3: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

column2: And soon will they attain (complete) satisfaction.
column3: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.

column2: By the Glorious Morning Light,
column3: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

column2: And by the Night when it is still,-
column3: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

column2: Thy Guardian-Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.
column3: The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

column2: And verily the Hereafter will be better for thee than the present.
column3: Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days: for yet the vision is for many days.

column2: And soon will thy Guardian-Lord give thee (that wherewith) thou shalt be well-pleased.
column3: And whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the tree roots; thy kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known that the heavens do rule.

column2: Did He not find thee an orphan and give thee shelter (and care)?
column3: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

column2: And He found thee wandering, and He gave thee guidance.
column3: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

column2: And He found thee in need, and made thee independent.
column3: And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.

column2: Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness,
column3: Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.

column2: Nor repulse the petitioner (unheard);
column3: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, that eat, asking no question for conscience sake:

column2: But the bounty of the Lord - rehearse and proclaim!
column3: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column2: Have We not expanded thee thy breast?-
column3: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

column2: And removed from thee thy burden
column3: Therefore remove sorrow from thy heart, and put away evil from thy flesh: for childhood and youth are vanity.

column2: The which did gall thy back?-
column3: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

column2: And raised high the esteem (in which) thou (art held)?
column3: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)

column2: So, verily, with every difficulty, there is relief:
column3: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.

column2: Verily, with every difficulty there is relief.
column3: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

column2: Therefore, when thou art free (from thine immediate task), still labour hard,
column3: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.

column2: And to thy Lord turn (all) thy attention.
column3: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment and wait on thy God continually.

column2: By the Fig and the Olive,
column3: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree, and the pine, and the box tree together:

column2: And the Mount of Sinai,
column3: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

column2: And this City of security,-
column3: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!

column2: We have indeed created man in the best of moulds,
column3: Behold, I have refined thee, but not with silver; I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.

column2: Then do We abase him (to be) the lowest of the low,-
column3: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

column2: Except such as believe and do righteous deeds: For they shall have a reward unfailing.
column3: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.

column2: Then what can, after this, contradict thee, as to the judgment (to come)?
column3: Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.

column2: Is not Allah the wisest of judges?
column3: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column2: Proclaim! (or read!) in the name of thy Lord and Cherisher, Who created-
column3: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

column2: Created man, out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:
column3: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

column2: Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful,-
column3: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

column2: He Who taught (the use of) the pen,-
column3: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

column2: Taught man that which he knew not.
column3: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

column2: Nay, but man doth transgress all bounds,
column3: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

column2: In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.
column3: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

column2: Verily, to thy Lord is the return (of all).
column3: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

column2: Seest thou one who forbids-
column3: Neither shalt thou set thee up any image; which the LORD thy God hateth.

column2: A votary when he (turns) to pray?
column3: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

column2: Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-
column3: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

column2: Or enjoins Righteousness?
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: Seest thou if he denies (Truth) and turns away?
column3: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

column2: Knoweth he not that Allah doth see?
column3: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

column2: Let him beware! If he desist not, We will drag him by the forelock,-
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: A lying, sinful forelock!
column3: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

column2: Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):
column3: And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:

column2: We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!
column3: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.

column2: Nay, heed him not: But bow down in adoration, and bring thyself the closer (to Allah)!
column3: Cut off thine hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on high places; for the LORD hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.

column2: We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power:
column3: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

column2: And what will explain to thee what the night of power is?
column3: The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?

column2: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.
column3: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

column2: Therein come down the angels and the Spirit by Allah's permission, on every errand:
column3: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

column2: Peace!... This until the rise of morn!
column3: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column2: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, were not going to depart (from their ways) until there should come to them Clear Evidence,-
column3: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.

column2: An messenger from Allah, rehearsing scriptures kept pure and holy:
column3: Whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

column2: Wherein are laws (or decrees) right and straight.
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: Nor did the People of the Book make schisms, until after there came to them Clear Evidence.
column3: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

column2: And they have been commanded no more than this: To worship Allah, offering Him sincere devotion, being true (in faith); to establish regular prayer; and to practise regular charity; and that is the Religion Right and Straight.
column3: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

column2: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, will be in Hell-Fire, to dwell therein (for aye). They are the worst of creatures.
column3: For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles, which go forth unto the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

column2: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds,- they are the best of creatures.
column3: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

column2: Their reward is with Allah: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which rivers flow; they will dwell therein for ever; Allah well pleased with them, and they with Him: all this for such as fear their Lord and Cherisher.
column3: For your shame ye shall have double; and for confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.

column2: When the earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion,
column3: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

column2: And the earth throws up her burdens (from within),
column3: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.

column2: And man cries (distressed): 'What is the matter with her?'-
column3: And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.

column2: On that Day will she declare her tidings:
column3: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column2: For that thy Lord will have given her inspiration.
column3: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O LORD, for ever.

column2: On that Day will men proceed in companies sorted out, to be shown the deeds that they (had done).
column3: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them.

column2: Then shall anyone who has done an atom's weight of good, see it!
column3: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?

column2: And anyone who has done an atom's weight of evil, shall see it.
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: By the (Steeds) that run, with panting (breath),
column3: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

column2: And strike sparks of fire,
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: And push home the charge in the morning,
column3: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

column2: And raise the dust in clouds the while,
column3: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

column2: And penetrate forthwith into the midst (of the foe) en masse;-
column3: And divide the prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who went out to battle, and between all the congregation:

column2: Truly man is, to his Lord, ungrateful;
column3: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.

column2: And to that (fact) he bears witness (by his deeds);
column3: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

column2: And violent is he in his love of wealth.
column3: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

column2: Does he not know,- when that which is in the graves is scattered abroad
column3: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

column2: And that which is (locked up) in (human) breasts is made manifest-
column3: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.

column2: That their Lord had been Well-acquainted with them, (even to) that Day?
column3: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.

column2: The (Day) of Noise and Clamour:
column3: A day of the trumpet and alarm against the fenced cities, and against the high towers.

column2: What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?
column3: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

column2: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: And the mountains will be like carded wool.
column3: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

column2: Then, he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy,
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.
column3: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

column2: But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light,-
column3: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

column2: Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.
column3: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.

column2: And what will explain to thee what this is?
column3: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?

column2: (It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
column3: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

column2: The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world) diverts you (from the more serious things),
column3: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

column2: Until ye visit the graves.
column3: Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.

column2: But nay, ye soon shall know (the reality).
column3: The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain the time, because ye see the thing is gone from me.

column2: Again, ye soon shall know!
column3: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

column2: Nay, were ye to know with certainty of mind, (ye would beware!)
column3: But if ye had known what this meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.

column2: Ye shall certainly see Hell-Fire!
column3: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

column2: Again, ye shall see it with certainty of sight!
column3: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in thy sight.

column2: Then, shall ye be questioned that Day about the joy (ye indulged in!).
column3: That ye put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts;

column2: By (the Token of) Time (through the ages),
column3: Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.

column2: Verily Man is in loss,
column3: Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

column2: Except such as have Faith, and do righteous deeds, and (join together) in the mutual teaching of Truth, and of Patience and Constancy.
column3: For kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

column2: Woe to every (kind of) scandal-monger and-backbiter,
column3: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

column2: Who pileth up wealth and layeth it by,
column3: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.

column2: Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!
column3: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

column2: By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into That which Breaks to Pieces,
column3: They shall fall in the midst of them that are slain by the sword: she is delivered to the sword: draw her and all her multitudes.

column2: And what will explain to thee That which Breaks to Pieces?
column3: But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded?

column2: (It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze),
column3: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind:

column2: The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts:
column3: In whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:

column2: It shall be made into a vault over them,
column3: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

column2: In columns outstretched.
column3: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

column2: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant?
column3: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves? for since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.

column2: Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?
column3: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

column2: And He sent against them Flights of Birds,
column3: And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.

column2: Striking them with stones of baked clay.
column3: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

column2: Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw, (of which the corn) has been eaten up.
column3: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.

column2: For the covenants (of security and safeguard enjoyed) by the Quraish,
column3: Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.

column2: Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer,-
column3: A several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

column2: Let them adore the Lord of this House,
column3: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.

column2: Who provides them with food against hunger, and with security against fear (of danger).
column3: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

column2: Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?
column3: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

column2: Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness),
column3: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

column2: And encourages not the feeding of the indigent.
column3: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

column2: So woe to the worshippers
column3: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

column2: Who are neglectful of their prayers,
column3: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

column2: Those who (want but) to be seen (of men),
column3: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

column2: But refuse (to supply) (even) neighbourly needs.
column3: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

column2: To thee have We granted the Fount (of Abundance).
column3: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.

column2: Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.
column3: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

column2: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).
column3: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.

column2: Say: O ye that reject Faith!
column3: Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,

column2: I worship not that which ye worship,
column3: Ye shall not do so unto the LORD your God.

column2: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
column3: Ye shall not do so unto the LORD your God.

column2: And I will not worship that which ye have been wont to worship,
column3: And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?

column2: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
column3: Ye shall not do so unto the LORD your God.

column2: To you be your Way, and to me mine.
column3: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

column2: When comes the Help of Allah, and Victory,
column3: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

column2: And thou dost see the people enter Allah's Religion in crowds,
column3: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar a mount of the east.

column2: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).
column3: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.

column2: Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!
column3: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

column2: No profit to him from all his wealth, and all his gains!
column3: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

column2: Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of Blazing Flame!
column3: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

column2: His wife shall carry the (crackling) wood - As fuel!-
column3: And he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:

column2: A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
column3: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

column2: Say: He is Allah, the One and Only;
column3: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

column2: Allah, the Eternal, Absolute;
column3: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

column2: He begetteth not, nor is He begotten;
column3: But those riches perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son, and there is nothing in his hand.

column2: And there is none like unto Him.
column3: That no flesh should glory in his presence.

column2: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn
column3: Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.

column2: From the mischief of created things;
column3: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

column2: From the mischief of Darkness as it overspreads;
column3: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

column2: From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;
column3: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

column2: And from the mischief of the envious one as he practises envy.
column3: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

column2: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind,
column3: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

column2: The King (or Ruler) of Mankind,
column3: The king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam of Carmel, one;

column2: The god (or judge) of Mankind,-
column3: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

column2: From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil), who withdraws (after his whisper),-
column3: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

column2: (The same) who whispers into the hearts of Mankind,-
column3: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

column2: Among Jinns and among men.
column3: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.
